Hilda, una de las miembros, esta trabajando arduamente por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de ese trabajo y con ayuda de su grupo. Ella es consciente de que trabajando es la única forma de salir adelante. Hilda se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa pequeña, pero bien surtida,  en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma ir creciendo con su negocio y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, condimentos, carnes, leche, panificados y demás, ya que son los productos que más vende y quiere poder tener un buen stock de ellos.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Luchadoras" is in its first cycle. They are starting to do a survey on the elimination of poverty. They are very hard-working women who joined together in order to seek the best for their families.
Hilda, one of the members, is working arduously to get ahead and help her family, through her work and with the help of her group. She knows that work is the only way to get ahead. Hilda is a merchant and has a small but well-stocked store. She works there every day from the wee hours of the morning. Her goal is to be able to keep working and expanding her business.
She is requesting this loan in order to invest in the purchase of vegetables, condiments, meat, milk, bread ingredients, and other items. These are her biggest sellers, and she wants to have a good stock of them.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, milk, bread ingredients, and other items.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, 57, is a hardworking mother who sells assorted items such as candies, frozen foods, junk foods and soft drinks. As a businesswoman, she wishes to have a greater income. In connection to this, she is asking a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy sweets, breads, biscuits, junk foods, soft drinks, embotido and longganisa. Through the loan, she hopes to improve her business and acquire increased income in order to live an enhanced life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, breads, biscuits, junk foods, soft drinks, embotido and longganisa.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Oñondivepa está en su ciclo número 3º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Todas ellas han hecho la encuentra de eliminación de pobreza, y están siendo capacitadas para ir mejorando.
La Sra. Sandra, una de las miembros, es comerciante y también limpiadora en una Escuela cercana a su casa. En su trabajo de comerciante se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, como ser harina, verduras, carnes y demás. Ella es muy sacrificada, ya que tiene dos trabajos, y por medio de ambos siempre trata de dar lo mejor a su familia y tener mayores ingresos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, carnes y demás, para que con ello siga trabajando con sus ventas y teniendo un ingreso extra.
texts.en:
The communal bank Oñondivepa is in its 3rd loan cycle with the women's program, in which everyone works and helps each other get ahead. The members have participated in the poverty reduction survey and are being trained to improve their skills.

Sandra, a member, is a merchant and also a janitor at the local school. As a merchant, she sells basic items such as flour, vegetables, and meat. She is very dedicated, as she works two jobs so that she can provide the best for her family and have more income. She is applying for a loan to buy vegetables, meats, and more to keep selling merchandise and have extra income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other clothing items.

loans.name: Kuña Kayupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry está en su ciclo 1. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las mujeres a través de los talleres, visitas semanales están tratando de salir adelante ya que se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza. Actualmente están en proceso de pasar al nivel dos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que hace ventas de comestibles , como ser sopa paraguaya, chipa, y ventas diarias de ropas. Como se ve, ella es muy trabajadora y quiere salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para sus alimentos, como ser choclo, sal, queso, huevo, aceite y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kuña Katupyry is in its first loan cycle. It is participating in the poverty reduction survey, where the women, who are now living below the poverty line, are trying to get ahead through workshops and weekly visits. They are about to reach poverty level two.

Sonia, a member, was at poverty level one in the last survey. She sells prepared foods, traditional soups and breads, and clothing. She is hardworking and wants to succeed. She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients such as sweet corn, salt, cheese, eggs, and oil to prepare her dishes, which will help her firm up her business plan and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy sweet corn, salt, cheese, eggs, oil, and more.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, es separada  tiene dos  hijas una de ellas se encuentra en etapa escolar,  viven en casa en alquiler, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Mururata de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió solo hasta el nivel primario, se dedica a la venta de distinta variedad de frutas en distintas ferias de la ciudad.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar una gran diversidad de frutas de la temporada (piña,tunas,bananas, mangos).

El sueño de Virginia es poder convertirse en distribuidora al por mayor de frutas.

Es la segunda  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Virginia is separated and has two daughters, one of whom is school age.  They live in a rented house, which is located in the Mururata area of the city of El Alto.  

She only studied through primary school.  She makes her living selling a variety of fruits in different markets in the city.

She needs the loan to buy a wide variety of seasonal fruits (pineapple, prickly pears, bananas, mangos).  Virginia's dream is to be able to become a wholesale fruit distributor.  This is the second time she is applying for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits (pineapples, prickly pears, mangos, bananas, etc.) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alcadio

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcadio es dueño de una zapatería se dedica a está actividad  hace más de 30 años, está casado y tiene dos hijos. Alcadio es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con muy buena referencia en el barrio.
Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que es muy conocido por el buen trabajo que hace, y gracias a ello está ayudando a su familia y saliendo adelante. Su meta es seguir trabajando y teniendo los medios para seguir teniendo los ingresos para cubrir el día a día.
Solicita de este crédito para pode invertirlo en la compra de cuero, suela para calzados, pegamentos y demás, ya que estos son sus principales herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Alcadio is the owner of a shoe store.  He has been in this business for more than 30 years.  He is married and has two children.

Alcadio is a very hardworking and enterprising person, and has a very good reputation in the neighborhood.  He says that he has very good customers since he is very well known for the good work he does.  Thanks to this, he is helping his family and getting ahead.  

His goal is to continue working and having the means to continue earning the income to cover day to day costs.  He is applying for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of leather, shoe soles, glues and more, since these are the primary tools of his work.

loans.use: to buy leather, shoe soles, glues and more.

loans.name: Sahara

texts.en:
Sahara is 42 years old and married with ten children.

Sahara works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dry goods store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

Sahara has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and reselling dried coconut meat and rice grains.

Sahara aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 50 years old and married with six children. The family lives in CPG, Bohol. For ten years now, Leonarda and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business as the source of their income.

Leonarda is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters. This will help her husband to improve his catch and allow them to sell more fish in the market. Leonarda is optimistic that this loan will help her realize her dream of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and floaters.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sauda works hard to support her family.

She has a rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling gasoline. Sauda is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the past, Sauda has sustained her business activities through 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Necifina

texts.en:
Necifina is a hardworking and enduring person. She is married and raising three children. Her husband operates a motorcycle transportation business, while she works fattening hogs for sale and caring for their home. Necifina and her husband help each other to provide their children a comfortable life. 

Necifina is asking 11,000 PHP to buy new tires, renew her husband's driver's license, and buy feed for her pigs. She hopes to improve both her own and her husband's business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, renew her husband's driver's license, and buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, 34, raises livestock for a living. She works hard to improve her standard of living. 

Rosemarie is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and chickens. She will continue raising livestock because she was only able to attain a low level of education, which does not allow her to pursue other types of business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and has children.  She works hard to support her family.  She has a fish business in the Philippines. 

Virginia is requesting her 22nd loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mercy has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

Mercy has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and soap to sell in her general store business.

Virginia has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish and rice.

Virginia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and soap to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gloria Regina

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es transportista, tiene 6 hijos, vive en el municipio de Victoria. Gloria tiene 5 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de mercadería, como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y golosinas como churros y otros. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y tiene buena demanda. Ella ha solicitado este préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras porque necesita surtir de más mercadería nueva para vender. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en: Gloria, 39, is married and her husband works in transportation.  She has six children and lives in the municipality of Victoria.  Gloria has had her own business for five years; she sells merchandise like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, packaged snacks, etc.  The business is home-based and has good demand.  She’s requested this 15,000 Lempira loan because she needs to stock up on new merchandise to sell.  Her dream is that her business grows and to be able to help her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes, shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
In order to meet the challenge of financial difficulties, Christy aims to improve her small variety store and generate more income. Christy is 26 years old, married, and has three siblings. Two of them are presently in grade school, and Christy's family wants them to continue their studies so that they can earn degrees. 

To this end, Christy is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy stock for her store such as snack foods, beverages, noodles, canned goods, soaps, eggs, soft drinks, and seasonings. She hopes that her business will continuously grow and become more profitable in order to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children ages nine, seven, and four. They live in CPG, Bohol, Philippines. For six years, Letecia and her husband have operated a motorcycle transport business.

Letecia needs a loan to buy fuel and spare parts, such as tires, nuts, and bolts, for her business. This will help her and her husband maintain the good working condition of their motorcycle.

Letecia hopes to make her business a success and plans to invest in a new venture to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ana lleva 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería como ropa, carteras, lociones, cremas, zapatos, sandalias, y otros. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa donde atiende a sus clientes todo el dia. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para capitalizarse y es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar 5 fardos de ropa de segunda americana para vender. Su meta es aumentar las ventas y con las ganancias va comprar un portón para su casa.
texts.en: Ana, 30, is a single mother living in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula.  Ana has been selling merchandise like clothes, purses, lotions, creams, shoes, sandals, etc. for ten years.  Her business is home-based and she tends to customers there all day.  She’s decided to request a 15,000 Lempira loan to use as capital to buy five bales of second-hand American clothes to sell.  Her goal is to increase sales and to use profits to buy a gate for her house.

loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand American clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.es: Emelda, de 40 años, esta casada y tiene 6 hijos , con quienes vive en su casa de material noble , la cual fue construida con mucho esfuerzo . Emelda tiene como fuente de ingresos económicos la venta de productos  regionales, desde muy temprano se dirige al puerto principal de la ciudad en busca de los mejores plátanos, limones, granadillas, coconas,entre otros que considera comercial . Realiza sus ventas en el frontis de su vivienda en donde instala una mesa con todo lo que tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo 8 meses y le esta yendo muy bien.Durante el tiempo que lleva realizando está actividad ha aprendido muchas cosas ya que las experiencias le han enseñado a ser más cuidadosa con algunos productos y a poder invertir más en otros. Espera seguir trabajando mucho ya que su máximo anhelo es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, además desea poner un almacén en la ciudad donde pueda comprar y vender productos al por mayor.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo .Con el monto solicitado comprará frutas y verduras como plátanos, aguaje ,naranjas, maíz y frijoles en sacos .
texts.en:
Emelda, 40, is married and has six children; she lives with them in a house made of substantial materials that was built with much effort.  Emelda’s source of income is selling regional products.  She heads out to the city’s main port early in the morning to look for the best bananas, lemons, sweet granadilla and coconas, among others she feels sell well.  She sells from her front porch where she sets up a table with everything she has available to offer her customers.  She’s been doing this work for 8 months and is doing very well.

In the time she’s been working she’s learned many things because experience has taught her to be more careful with certain products and to be able to invest more in others.  She hopes to continue working hard because her greatest wish is that her children complete their schooling; she also would like to open a store in the city where she can buy and sell at wholesale.

On this occasion, she’s asking for an 800-sol loan and is grateful to all those who make access to this financing possible because she will feel surer of making progress with her work.  She will use the requested amount to buy fruit and vegetables like bananas, aguaje fruit and oranges as well as sacks of beans and corn.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Milton Orlando

texts.es: Milton, tiene 30 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de San Jose Comayagua con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura anteriormente cultivaba maíz, frijoles y hace 12 años tiene su propio cultivo de café. Produce café en pergamino y lo vende a los intermediarios de la zona. Su finca la ha mantenido mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, el que esta solicitando es el séptimo préstamo y es por 5,500 lempiras, con el cual va comprar abono y pago de limpieza de la finca para mejorar y sacar mejor producción. Su plan es darle buen mantenimiento y mantenerla cultivada su finca para sacar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Milton, 30, is married and has three children; he lives in the municipality of San José Comayagua with his wife and three children.  He’s spent his entire life working in agriculture.  He used to grow corn and beans but for the last 12 years has had his own coffee crops.  He produces coffee in parchment and sells it to local middlemen.  He’s kept his farm going thanks to various loans.  The one he’s asking for now is his 7th and it’s for 5,500 Lempiras he’ll use to buy manure and to pay to clear his land to improve and obtain better crop yields.  His plan is to provide good care and continue growing crops on his farm to provide income for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay to clear his fields.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. They live in Ubay, Bohol. 

Leonila earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Leonila is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 49 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Elmira works very hard to provide for them.

For five years, Elmira has run a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, sugar, milk, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Elmira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock her general store.

loans.name: Edgard Antonio

texts.es:
el señor edgard antonio vive en un barrio al norte de la  cuidad de managua se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable en su trabajo y su hogar, actualmente trabaja en una institución desempeñándose como operador de limpieza.

el señor esta solicitando a kiva y ceprodel un financiamiento para cubrir primeramente  gastos de estudio de  sus hijos que estan en edad escolar y comprales uniforme y todos los utencilio que ellos necesitan para asistir a la escuela . 

edgard esta agradecido con ceprodel y kiva por que con los crédito obtenido ha mejorado su casa. y esto lo hace sentirce bien por que  a podido darles un hogar acogedor a la  familia
texts.en:
Edgard Antonio lives in a neighborhood in the northern part of the city of Managua. He is known for being an honest person in both his work and his home. Currently he works as a cleaner in an institution.

Edgard is requesting a loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL to pay school fees for his school-age children and to buy them uniforms and any other equipment or supplies they need to attend school.

Edgard is grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva for previous loans with which he improved his home. These improvements make him feel good because he has been able to provide a cozy home for his family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his school-age children and to buy them uniforms and any other equipment or supplies they need to attend school.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura,  tiene un hijo y vive en el Municipio de Victoria, Yoro.
Doña María Elsa,  hace 11 años que estableció un negocio de pulpería. Ella ofrece productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, maíz, harina, manteca, lácteos, etc. Ella  es una señora muy reconocida en la zona cuenta con sus propios clientes. Inició este negocio con la visión de crecer y tener sus propios ingresos que le permitieran ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Ha decidido solicitar un segundo  préstamo a ODEF por 12,000 lempiras para compra más  productos alimenticios como   frijoles, maíz, churros, arroz, harina, azúcar, manteca, lácteos etc. Con esto aumentar su inventario y sus ingresos.
Su meta es crecer económicamente y mejorar el local donde tiene ubicado el negocio.
texts.en:
María Elsa, 56, is married.  Her husband works in agriculture and she has a son and she lives in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro.  María Elsa opened a grocery store 11 years ago.  She sells basic staples like beans, rice, corn, flour, lard, dairy products, etc.  She’s a very well-known lady locally and she has regular customers.  She started the business with the intention of growing and earning her own income to help her husband with household expenses.

She’s decided to ask for her second ODEF loan.  It’s for 12,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy more food items like beans, corn, snacks, rice, flour, sugar, lard, dairy products, etc. to increase her inventory and her income.  Her goal is to grow economically and to make improvements to the locale her business is located in.

loans.use: to buy food items to stock her store.

loans.name: Herliet

texts.en:
Herliet is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined woman. 

Herliet operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a densely populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the business. 

Herliet will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy meat to sell. 

Herliet’s business goal is to run two more butcher shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land with profits from the business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to previously pay a loan of KES 50,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 56 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ester has a native bag-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 60,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials to make native bags.

Ester has been in this business for fifteen years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to save up for the future and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make native bags.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Marciano es vendedor de productos  de primera necesidad al interior del departamento  se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 8 años, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela y es muy conocido por ellos.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buenas referencias en el barrio. Comenta que su meta es tener una gran despensa y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, harina, huevo, etc. Ya que son los productos que más salida tienen y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes y pedidos.
texts.en:
Mr. Marciano sales food staples in the Paraguayan department of Ñeembucú, he has been dedicated to this activity for more than 8 years. This is why he already enjoys of a very good customer base that has gotten to know him very well.  
He is very hardworking and enterprising, with excellent referrals in his neighborhood. His goal is to grow his business into a mini-market and to keep working the same way as he has until now. 
He requests this credit to purchase staple merchandise for his business such as sugar, flour, eggs, etc. All of this due to the fact that these are the products that are sold the most, therefore he wants to be able to fulfill his clientele requests.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ann Ngirote

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined woman.

Ann operates a retail service business where she provides M-pesa service (mobile phone-based money-transfer service). She has been involved in this M-pesa business for two years, after engaging herself previously in a business of timber sales. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the business. 

Ann will use the KES 30,000 loan to add M-pesa float (electronic credits). 

Ann’s business goal is to run another M-pesa retail store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land for her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay a previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from CPG, Bohol. Lolita has operated a welding shop together with her husband for several years now. 

Lolita is asking for a loan to buy equipment for their welding shop like a compressor, drill, and welding machine. With this, they will be able to improve and cater for more customers in their welding shop. Lolita has hopes of making their welding shop a success.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her welding shop like a compressor, drill, and welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Holger Anibal

texts.es:
Holger tiene 50 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Holger trabaja en la agricultura en la siembra de maiz en terrenos cerca de la casa. El credito solicita para la comprar se semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a suplir las necesitades en los cultivos, los desafios que enfrenta son la variacion del clima, y las enfermedades de los cultivos.

El sueño es tener dinero para realizar un viaje en avion. En los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el campo y recordar la infancia.
texts.en:
Holger is 50-years old, married and lives with his wife and their children in the city of Chimbo, Bolivar Province.

Holger works in agriculture.  He grows corn on land that is nearby his house.  He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer for his crops.  The loan will help him to get the things he needs for his crops.  The challenges he faces are variations in the weather and crop disease. 

Holger's dream is to have enough money to take a trip on a plane.  In his free time, he likes to walk through the country-side and reminisce about his childhood.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a 61-year-old married woman from Alicia, Bohol. She has two grown children. She has been engaged in the farming business for 20 years now. She raises rice plants. Usually she earns 4000 PHP a month. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a driver.

Teofila is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, plant medicine,and seedlings. Fertilizer and plant medicine are used to make the crops grow faster and healthier.  Through this loan, she will be able to buy these to raise good and healthy crops. 

In the future, Teofila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, plant medicine, and seedlings

loans.name: Dúo La Familia Group

texts.es: Dúo la Familia este grupo esta integrado por la señora Lesbia ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, esta contenta porque espera que por medio de ustedes ella pueda optar al credito,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo.
texts.en: Lesbia is a member of this group.  She has been a farmer for several years and is happy because thanks to you she will be able to get this loan.  She is asking for this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 30-year-old, married man. He has two children, two and four years old. He describes himself to be an honest man. 

He operates a retail store where he provides secretarial services, such as typing and printing. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a potential business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Patrick will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a photocopier. His business goal is to run a big company within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Patrick also works as a priest at his church.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier for his business.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es: Gerson tiene 48 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive en un barrio de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposa e hijos. Don Gerson, trabajo por varios años en la empresa privada y hace un año quedo sin empleo y decidió establecer su propio negocio. El brinda el servicio de llantera y lavado de autos. Este negocio lo tiene en un local alquilado. Y ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar llantas para vender, y poder tener inventario y variedad que ofrecer al cliente. Su objetivo es lograr tener una calidad de vida mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Gerson is 48 years, married, and has two children. He lives in a neighborhood of San Perdo Sula with his wife and children.

Don Gerson worked several years at private business. A year ago, he became unemployed so he decided to establish his own business. He provides tire replacement and car wash services. This business is situated at a rented location.

Gerson decided to request a loan of 20,000 HNL in order to buy tires to sell and restock his inventory. This will enable him to offer variety to his customers. His goal is for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires to sell in his business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Antony is married and has four children, ages 5 to 9 years. He describes himself to be an honest and warm man. He operates a rental housing business where he provides housing accommodations. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a busy market along a highway and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be delay of payment from customers. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the rental houses. His business goal is to operate three more rental houses within five years. In addition, Antony runs a retail business where he sells soft drinks.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of rental houses

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 49-year-old mother who sells tobacco and beetle nuts in the market to supplement her husband's income. She aims to make the business profitable in order to earn sufficient income for her family's necessities and to pay for the education of her youngest child. 

Due to inadequate capital, Esther is asking for an additional 10,000 PHP to buy more tobacco and beetle nuts to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy tobacco and beetle nuts to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, sardines, detergent, and other groceries. 

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel (with his child) is a married man. He has one son who is five years old. He describes himself to be an understanding and honest man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items such as flour, cooking oil, soap, etc . He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located at a densely populated area and his primary customers are local residents from the environs. 

Samuel describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy household items to sell. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to repay a loan of Kes 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell

loans.name: Lynda

texts.en:
Lynda is a 52-year-old  woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in making and selling handcrafted fashion accessories. This is the source of her income. Lynda is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for making fashion accessories: mahogany pods, coco beads and wooden beads, etc. With this, she will be able to make and sell more accessories thus allowing her to earn more.

In the future, Lynda has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for making fashion accessories: mahogany pods, coco beads and wooden beads

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is 41 years old and is married with five children. She has a sari-sari (convenience) store business where sells biscuits, soy sauce, breads and a variety of other items. She is requesting a loan 8,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, vinegar and spices. She hopes to earn more and be able to save and sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, vinegar and spices

loans.name: Lora

texts.en: Lora is a 27-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. For 10 years he has been in the photography business. He started as a hired camera man after dropping out of school and later bought his own full-fledged studio. The seasonal nature of the business is a great challenge to him. His desire is to migrate to digital services and diversify his business to include farming. Lora intends to use the loan to buy a digital camera.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera for his photography business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 66-year-old married woman with eight children, ages 15 to 35 years. She describes herself to be a humble and optimistic woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for over 20 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate vegetables to sell. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to sell more produce within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 41 years old and married with seven children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jennifer has a business making and selling native bags in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Jennifer has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making her native bags.

loans.name: Rafael Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Rafael Alberto vive en la ciudad Managua, se desempeña como instructor de arte plástica con más de seis año, en el centro de capacitación profesional, donde él enseña su habilidad a persona con espíritu de superación, labora desde la ocho de mañana hasta la cinco de la tarde para llevar el sustento a su familia.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para gastos  escolares tales como uniforme, zapato, mochila, cuaderno  y el resto lo invertirá en compra de materiales de construcción tales como cerámica boom, para poner piso ya que es de tierra su vivienda. 
 
Este financiamiento  le servirá  para darle a su hijo una mejor educación para el futuro, con esta oportunidad que  le ofrecerá  kiva y Ceprodel quedaría muy agradecido, ya que es el único sostén de su hogar.
texts.en:
Rafael Alberto lives in the city of Managua and has worked as an instructor of plastic arts in a professional training center for more than six years. He teaches his skills to people with a strong desire to better themselves. Rafael works from eight in the morning to five in the evening to provide for his family’s livelihood. 

Rafael is requesting this loan through CEPRODEL to pay for school expenses such as uniforms, shoes, backpacks and notebooks. He will use the rest to buy construction materials such as tile to install a floor in his house, which is made of earth.

This loan will help Rafael give his son a better education and future. Rafael is very grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for this opportunity and their support.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses such as uniforms, shoes, backpacks and notebooks and to buy construction materials such as tile to install a floor in his home.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad hubicada al sur del país vive la señora Rosa, ella tiene la edad de 68 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se encuentra casada con el señor Marcos que se dedica a la albañileria, ellos tiene 1 hijo que se encuentra casado. Su poblacion se caracteriza por estar en una zona cañera y alli se encuentra el Ingenio la Margarita uno de los principales productores de azucar y brinda fuentes de trabajos a la zona.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de Antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tostadas, gorditas, enchiladas, platanos) desde hace 10 años porque quiere apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, ademas de que quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su esposo.

Ella realiza la venta de sus antojitos en Mexicanos desde la comodidad de su hogar, pone por las tardes pone sus negocio en marcha preparando sus alimentos para posteriormente esperar a sus clientes para realizar sus ventas.

Doña Rosa necesita esta inversion para la compra de tomate, chiles, cebolla, ajo, queso, crema, masa, carne, tortillas, col, frijol, platano, aceite, gas para posteriormente poner en marcha su negocio.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio mejore y pueda tener una vida prospera.

Doña Rosa es uno de los integrantes del Grpo Las Flores  el cual esta integrado por 10 mujeres, las demás integrantes del grupo son:

Claudia venta y elaboracion de tejidos
Irene venta de pollo 
Maria Isabel venta de abarrotes 
Epifania venta de cosmeticos 
Lucia venta de cosmeticos 
Adahi venta de cosmeticos 
Raquel venta de pan 
Ambrosia venta de antojitos 
Erika venta de tacos
texts.en:
Rosa lives in a community located in the south of the country. She is 68 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school. She is married to Marcos, who works in construction. They have one married son. Their town is in an area of sugarcane production. Ingenio la Margarita, one of the main sugar producers, is based there and offers a source of employment for the area.

Rosa has been selling Mexican antojitos (corn-based dishes such as empanadas, tostadas, gorditas, enchiladas, and plantains) for ten years, because she wants to support her husband with their expenses. She also wishes to have a better quality of life for her and her husband.

She sells her dishes from the comfort of her home. In the afternoon, she starts to open up her business by preparing the food. Later, she waits for her clients and makes sales.

Rosa needs this loan to buy tomatoes, chilis, onions, garlic, cheese, cream, corn paste, meat, tortillas, cabbage, beans, plantains, oil, and gas in order to kick off her business.

She hopes that with this investment, her business will improve and she will be able to have a prosperous life.

Rosa is one of the members of the Las Flores Group, which is made up of ten women. The other members of the group are:

Claudia makes and sells fabric
Irene sells chicken
Maria Isabel sells snacks
Epifania sells cosmetics
Lucia sells cosmetics
Adahi sells cosmetics
Raquel sells bread
Ambrosia sells antojitos
Erika sells tacos.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chilis, onions, garlic, cheese, cream, corn paste, meat, tortillas, cabbage, beans, plantains, oil, and gas.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
Don Jose, tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y un hijo en una colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula.
Don Jose, tiene su propio taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos, este lo tiene en su casa y brinda el servicio de pintura y reparación de golpes de todo tipo de vehículos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad. El ha decidido obtener este préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para comprar unas láminas y reparar la galera donde tiene el taller y poder tener mejores condiciones de trabajo y brindar buen servicio. Ya que su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y lograr que su hijo estudie una carrera técnica.
texts.en:
Don Jose is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and child in a neighborhood on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula.

Don Jose has his own auto body and paint shop that is located at his house. There he provides paint and dent repair services for all types of vehicles. He has been in this line of work for 15 years. Jose decided to obtain a loan of 12,000 HNL in order to buy metal sheets so that he can repair the workspace of his shop. This will allow him to have better working conditions so that he can provide good service.

His goal is to grow his business so that he can help his son study for a technical degree.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets so that he can repair the roof of his workshop.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Alfa y omega es el nombre del grupo integrado por 7 personas alegres, trabajadoras y honestas cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con la intención de tener una mejor calidad de vida: Santa Rosalia venta de cosméticos, Lucinda papelería, Monserrat venta de calzado, Esperanza venta de abarrotes, Cristina servicio de taxi, Gabina venta de calzado. Este grupo esta ubicado en una región cañera donde la principal fuente de trabajo es la siembra y recolección de caña de azúcar.
Doña Lucinda es   una de los integrantes de este grupo. Ella tiene la edad de 58 años, ella estudio la secundaria y este casada con don Juan. 
Ella platica que durante mucho tiempo ha sido comerciante pero hace poco tiempo logro establecerse, rento un local en el centro de su comunidad en el cual vende papelería, regalos y juguetes.
Ella realiza esta actividad ya que desea tener una mejor calidad de vida y poner contribuir con los gastos de su hogar.
Ella dice que poco a poco a ganado clientes ya que tiene buenos precios y atiende su negocio de manera muy amable esto ayuda a ganarse a los clientes y que sus ventas aumenten.
Un prestamo de Vision Fund  le ayuda a comprar variedad de lapices, lapiceros, sacapuntas, hojas blancas, hojas de color, pegamento, papel bond, cartulinas, tijeras, colores, plumones para resurtir su papelería y algunos regalos como carteras, osos de peluches, chocolates y perfumes.
Doña Lucinda dijo "me gustaría ver en un futuro mi negocio mas grande con un mayor surtido, también con mucho clientes se venda la mercancía. Me gustaría darles las gracias ya que con su apoyo no podríamos ver crecer nuestro pequeños negocio".
Otros factores que le ayudan a tener Buena venta a que su negocio esta en una buena ubicación y vende productos que siempre están saliendo.
texts.en:
Alfa y Omega is the name of this group, which is made up of seven happy, hardworking, and honest people. Each of them has undertaken a business activity with the goal of having a better quality of life: Santa Rosalia sells cosmetics, Lucinda has a paper store, Monserrat sells footwear, Esperanza sells groceries, Cristina has a taxi service, and Gabina sells footwear. This group is located in a sugarcane region, where the main source of employment is planting and harvesting sugarcane. 

Lucinda, 58, is one of the members of this group. She is has a secondary school education and she is married to Juan. She says that she has been a businesswoman for a long time, but she only managed to establish herself a short time ago. She rented a space in the center of her community where she sells paper goods, gifts, and toys.

She has this business because she would like to have a better quality of life and to contribute to her home expenses.

She says that she has gained clients little by little, because she offers good prices and looks after her business with a very friendly manner. This helps her to gain clients and increase her sales.

This loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy an assortment of pencils, mechanical pencils, sharpeners, white paper, colored paper, glue, bond paper, poster boards, scissors, colors, and felt-tip pens to re-stock her business, as well as some gifts such as wallets, teddy bears, chocolates, and perfume. 

Lucinda says, "In the future, I would like to my business to be larger and have a better inventory, and to sell merchandise to many clients. I would like to thank you because without your help, we could not grow our small businesses."

Other factors which allow her to have good sales are the good location of her business and the fact that she constantly sells new products.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of pencils, mechanical pencils, sharpeners, white paper, colored paper, glue, bond paper, poster boards, scissors, colors, and felt-tip pens.

loans.name: La Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
La Virgen de Guadalupe es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 5 personas cada una de ellas con una actividad económica: Laura brinda servicio de transporte, Eugenia venta de pollo, Maria Manuela venta de tacos, Eulalia venta de tortillas y Petra artículos par el hogar. Ellas decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo ya que en la casa que se reunen hay una imagen muy bella de la virgen. Este grupo esta  ubicado en la comunidad de Vicente Camalote, en el cual la principal fuente de empleo la brinda un Ingenio productor de azúcar 
llamado "La Margarita".

Doña Eugenia tiene la edad de 35 años,solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Oscar con el cual tiene 4 hijos. Ella platica que desde hace 14 años, ella trabaja para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que cada dia la situcacion economica esta mas dificil y el dinero no rinde, doña Eugenia realiza venta de pollo destazado todos los dias por las mañanas.

Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que se siente un poco independiente ya que gana su propio dinero y ha hecho buenas clientas, amigos con el paso de estos años.

Ella dice que su trabajo inicio desde muy temprano ya que tiene que madrugar para matar los pollos y aliñarlos para posteriormente ponerlos a la venta, también nos dice que hay tiempos donde se vende bien que es ahorita esta zafra (cuando los ingenios trabajan en la producción de azúcar) ya que hay trabajo y la gente tiene un poco mas de dinero.
Un préstamo de Vision Fund le ayudara a comprar pollos para continuar con sus ventas.
Ella espera poder brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida con sus ganancias y hacer crecer su negocio día a día. Ella dijo  
"Gracias por el apoyo que nos dan y a nosotras y tambien es una nueva oportunidad de salir adelante"
texts.en:
La Virgen de Guadalupe is the name of this group, which is made up of five members. Each of them has their own business: Laura has a transport service, Eugenia sells chickens, Maria Manuela sells tacos, Eulalia sells tortillas, and Petra sells home goods. They decided to give this name to their group because there is a beautiful image of the Virgin in the house where they meet. This group is located in the community of Vicente Camalote, where the main source of employment is a sugar production company called "La Margarita."

Eugenia is 35 years old. She only studied in primary school, and she is married to Oscar, with whom she has four children. She says that she has worked to help her husband with their home expenses since she was fourteen, because the financial situation is worse every day and there is not enough money. Eugenia sells sliced chicken every morning.

What she most likes about her business is that she feels a bit independent, because she earns her own money and she has made good clients and friends over these years.

She says that her work begins very early, because she has to wake up at dawn to kill the chickens and season them in order to sell them later on. She also tells us that there are certain times when sales are good. Now, for example, it is the sugarcane harvest season and the companies are working to produce sugar. Therefore, there is work and people have a bit more money.

This loan from Vision Fund will help her to buy chickens to continue with her sales.

She hopes to offer her family a better quality of life with her income and to grow her business day by day. She says, "Thank you for the support that you give us. This is a new opportunity for success."

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Iris Marisela

texts.es: Iris, tiene 40 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 7 hijos, y reside en el municipio de Yoro. Ella tiene 15 años de tener su propio negocio  en su casa. Iris compra y vende carnes, ofrece carne de res, de cerdo, mondongo, chicharrones, chorizo etc. Este negocio lo ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. El que solicita actualmente es por 10,000 lempiras, siendo el sexto ciclo, con el cual va invertir en la compra de carnes para vender. Su plan es que su negocio vaya en crecimiento e ir  aumentando las ganancias. Su idea es darles una mejor vida a sus hijos y comenzar a implementar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Iris, age 40, is a common-law relationship with her partner. They have seven children and live in the town of Yoro.

For the past 15 years, Iris has managed her own business from her home. She buys and sells meat including beef, pork, tripe, pork rinds, chorizo sausage, and other products. Her business has remained stable as a result of investing several loans. She is requesting her current loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL. This will be her sixth loan cycle and she will invest in the purchase of meat to sell.

Her plan is to grow her business and increase her earnings. Among her ideas are to provide a better life for her children and to start another business.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase water, bottles and stoppers for her business of purifying water under the Salvavidas label.

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en: A 42-year-old married mother of seven  from Ubay, Bohol, Ma. Elisa has had a rice farm for several years now. She helps her husband in tilling it. Ma. Elisa is applying for a loan to buy additional fertilizer in order to improve the farm. In the future, she hopes to expand it and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a married woman. She has four children between the ages of 12 and 22. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides manicures, pedicures, and hair services such as blow drying, plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a residential area, and her primary customers are students and ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be frequent power outages. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy beauty products. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her second loan after successfully repaying a loan of 20,000 KES.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita is in the business of selling vegetables and fish. Because it is her only source of income, she works really hard to make it as viable as possible. With the help of her husband, she is improving her business and thus their living standard.

In order to keep improving, Anacita is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy cabbage, squash and fish to resell. She hopes for higher income to follow.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, squash and fish to resell.

loans.name: Adina

texts.es: Adina, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Adina se dedica  a su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y lleva 5 años de tenerlo. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 11,000 Lempiras para comprar harina de maíz que es el insumo principal para la elaboración de tortillas y con una parte va ampliar un apartamento de su casa construirá una pared y para eso va comprar unos bloques y cemento. Su plan es mantener bien el negocio ya que de allí cubre los gastos del hogar y de estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adina is 31 years old and a single mother with three children. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

Adina has her business of making and selling corn tortillas. Her business is in her home and she has been in this line of work for five years. She has decided to request a loan of 11,000 HNL so that she can buy cornmeal, which is the main ingredient for making tortillas. A portion of the loan will be used to expand part of her house by building a wall. For this reason, she needs to buy some blocks and cement.

Her plan is to maintain a successful business so that she can cover her household expenses and pay for her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal for making tortillas and to acquire blocks and cement for expanding her house.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, esta casada con Henry quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 4 hijos . Juntos habitan cómodamente su hogar construido a base de material noble .La actividad a la que se dedica Sofía es la venta de verduras frescas , Cuenta con una furgoneta para el transporte y realiza su venta de manera ambulatoria en el mercado principal de la ciudad y en algunos casos por zonas alejadas como asentamientos humanos o cacerios . Brinda una buena atención a los clientes lo que le ha ayudado a ganarse su confianza. Hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien se encarga de conducir la furgoneta mientras que ella atrae a los clientes con su potente voz. Lleva realizando esta actividad más de 1 año y le va muy bien. Le gusta este negocio pues genera el ingreso económico que necesita su familia y además porque se siente cómoda desarrollando una actividad laboral con la cual se siente una persona productiva . Considera éste negocio rentable por las ganancias que obtiene razón por la cual desea continuar en este camino. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento y asi pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado comprará verduras frescas como lechugas, tomate, papá, cebollas y otros para continuar vendiendo por las calles de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sofía, age 31, is a hard-working and diligent woman.  She is married to Henry, who works in transportation and is the father of their four children.  They live together comfortably in their home, which is made from sturdy material.

Sofía sells fresh vegetables.  She has a truck for transportation, and she sells in an itinerant manner at the city’s main market.  Sometimes she sells in remote areas like settlements and hamlets.  She offers her customers good service, which has helped her to gain their trust.

She currently has the support of her husband who is in charge of driving the truck while she attracts customers with her strong voice. She has been doing this work for over one year, and it is going very well for her. 

She likes this business because it generates the income her family needs.  She also likes it because she feels comfortable developing a work activity that makes her feel like a productive person.  She feels that this business is profitable because of the income that she gets.  That is why she wants to continue on this road.

She will now request a loan for 1,000 soles.  She is thankful to all those who make her loan possible so that she is able to solidify her plans. She will use the loan to buy fresh vegetables like lettuce, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and more in order to continue selling on the streets of the city.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Valentina

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el sector suburbano de San Pedro Sula. Hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de mercadería como ropa nueva variada, vende camisetas, cortinas, ropa de cama y otras que le piden. La mercadería la vende en su casa. Su negocio lo ha mantenido estable mediante la inversión de varios préstamos, actualmente esta solicitando un séptimo préstamo el cual es por 8,000 lempiras y lo utilizara para surtir de más ropa nueva para obtener mayores ganancias. Su meta a corto plazo es utilizar las ganancias es arreglar el techo de su casa.
texts.en:
Dona María is 48 years old and a single mother with four children. She lives in a suburban section of San Pedro Sula.

For the past five years, María has been selling merchandise such as various types of new clothing, T-shirts, curtains, bedding, and other items that are requested. She sells the merchandise from her home. Her business has remained stable as a result of investing several loans. María is currently requesting her seventh loan, which is in the amount of 8,000 HNL. The money will be used to restock with more clothing so that she can generate more profits. Her short-term goal is to use her earnings to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en:
Friday, a 33-year-old married father of four living in Kasese, Uganda, has been operating a retail shop for three years. He got his start-up capital from his previous employment as a shop attendant. Customers not paying on time are his main business challenge. His personal goal is building a permanent house, and his business goal is moving his business to a more permanent location.

Friday intends to use this loan to buy beans, sugar, maize flour and groundnuts. He used his previous one to buy a deep freezer.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, maize flour and groundnuts.

loans.name: Nancita

texts.en:
Nancita is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business making and selling native mats in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years.

Nancita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy materials needed to make native mats.  In the future, Nancita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to make native mats.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio desde hace un año y antes se dedicaba solamente a cuidar a su familia.

Ella vende maíz, el cual lo cultiva su propia familia. Entonces parte de la cosecha es destinada a la venta y la otra para el consumo de su familia. El préstamo que esta solicitando  Fundacion Campo, es para comprar frijoles, azúcar, arroz, entre otros productos de la canasta básica. Debido a que los clientes le demandan estos productos, por que ella solo vende maíz y desea instalar una pequeña tienda de productos básicos. Para poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos, para su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha is 43 years old, married, and has five children. She has been working in business for the last year. Before that, she was dedicated to looking after her family. 

She sells corn which is grown by her family. Therefore, part of their crop is destined for sale, and the other part is consumed by the family. The loan Bertha is asking for from Fundacion Campo will be used to buy beans, sugar, rice, and other basic food products that her customers are asking for. Right now Bertha only sells corn, but she wants to open a small store where she can sell basic products in order to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, and other basic products

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 26 years old and married, with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Irene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more stocks to sell.

Irene has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as biscuits, rice, soap, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Pastor Dario

texts.es: Don Pastor, tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en San Pedro Sula con su familia. El tiene experiencia  como chef la cual adquirió cuando trabajaba en uno de los hoteles de la ciudad, ahora ya tiene 3 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de venta de comida. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y atiende a sus clientes por la tarde y  noche. Vende chuletas y carne  a la plancha. Ha obtenido varios préstamos en ODEF para mantener su negocio. Actualmente solicita el séptimo préstamo para comprar los insumos necesarios al por mayor y ahorrarse gastos por compras y va comprar unas laminas de zinc para arreglar el techo de su casa. Su plan a futuro es tener su casa remodelada.
texts.en:
Don Pastor is 58 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his family in San Pedro Sula.

Pastor acquired his experience as a chef by working at one of the hotels in the city. Three years ago, he established his own business where he sells food. The business is located in his home and he attends to his customers in the afternoons and evenings. Pastor sells chops and grilled meats. He has obtained several loans from ODEF in order to maintain his business.

Pastor is currently requesting his seventh loan so that he can buy necessary supplies in bulk, which will help him save on his expenses. He will also buy zinc sheets so that he can repair the roof of his house. His plan for the future is to have a remodeled house.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk for preparing his dishes and to acquire zinc sheets for repairing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 30-year-old mother who has two children. They live happily in a village and plant and harvest rice and vegetables to sell. Because of financial insufficiency, Elizabeth engages in buying and selling AVON products and fish in the village to supplement her husband's income. She aims to make the business profitable in order to generate sufficient income. 

She is requesting additional capital of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more stock of Avon products and fish to sell. She hopes that her loan will be a great help that will allow her to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products and fish to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn sells fruits and vegetables. She is able to cover her daily needs through her business. She is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy vegetables such as string beans, eggplants, and tomatoes so that she can increase her income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase  vegetables such as string beans, eggplants. and tomatoes.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, a 38-year-old married  mother of three children ranging in age from 6 years to 12 years, describes herself as an optimistic and determined woman. For 11 years now she has operated a retail shop selling household items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. Her enterprise is located in a residential business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Caroline will use this Kes 50,000 loan, her second with SMEP DTM, to buy more household items to sell. Her goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more household items to sell.

loans.name: Frech

texts.es:
Frech es un hombre muy entusiasta y trabajador, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, por sus atractivos turísticos, su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, tuna, entre otros. Cuando Frech tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión al lado de su familia y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el Arroz con Pollo; el solo tuvo estudio secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería, por ello trabaja muy duro para darle a sus hijos una buena educación para que sean mejores que el.

Con mucho entusiasmo Frech trabaja en su cultivo de Tuna y venta de cochinilla, la tuna es una fruta que crece en una planta que se parece a un cactus, asimismo en este tipo de plantas vive un insecto el cual es la cochinilla, el cual utilizan las empresas de cosméticos, entre otras para dar color a los productos; ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajadora y tiene el apoyo de su esposa.

Frech está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá dar mantenimiento a su cultivo como abonos, fertilizantes entre otros y poder infestarlo con mas cochinilla ya que estos animalitos viven en esta especie de fruta, con esta mejora podrá aumentar sus ingresos y tener más producción de cochinilla con lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo y poder seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y ser una buena agricultora”.
texts.en:
Frech is a very enthusiastic and hard-working man who lives in the city of Nazca, a city that is characterized by its warm climate, by its tourist attractions, and its agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton, corn, and cactus fruit, among others. When Frech has free time he likes to watch television with his family and also likes to prepare one of his favorite dishes, chicken with rice. He only attended secondary school, but he would have liked to have studied nursing. Because of this he works very hard to give his children a good education so that they will be better than he is.

With a lot of enthusiasm, Frech works on his cactus fruit crop and the sale of cochineals. Cactus fruit is a fruit that grows in a plant that looks like a cactus. In these types of plants there also lives an insect known as the cochineal, which is used by cosmetic and other businesses as a dye to color to their products. He dedicates 10 hours a day to his business; he believes that his business is going well because he is very hard-working and has the support of his wife.

Frech is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help they have given him he has been able to do maintenance on his crop with fertilizers and to infest the crop with more cochineals, as these little animals live in this type of fruit. With this improvement he will be able to increase his earnings and produce more cochineals, which will allow him to keep growing and keep fighting every day to make his greatest dream a reality: "To give his children a good education and to be a good farmer."

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cochineal infestation

loans.name: Romulo Javier

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Ingenio, ciudad con un clima muy caluroso y poseedor de atractivos turísticos muy bellos e impresionantes, como por ejemplo la Iglesia de San Jose que data del tiempo de la colonia española y presenta tallados en madera muy hermosos, vive Romulo, quien tiene 64 años de edad, cuyo platillo favorito son los Chicharrones y en su ciudad es uno de los platillos típicos; Romulo es un hombre muy trabajador y desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma. 

Día a día Romulo trabaja como obrero agrícola y también tiene una parcela en la que actualmente ha sembrado tuna, el cual es una especie de cactus que tiene frutos de varios colores y son muy agradables, asimismo los ha infestado de cochinilla, la cual es una especie de insecto que vive en este tipo de plantas y del cual se obtiene una especie de tinte natural; él cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo porque le gusta lo que él hace.

Romulo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando el podrá cubrir los gastos para infestación de la cochinilla, la cual consiste en colocar insectos en las plantas de tuna, de esta manera podrá tener más crias de cochinilla y tener una mejor cosecha; así el podrá tener mejores ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar su calidad de vida y sembrar otro tipo de cultivos”.
texts.en:
The city of Ingenio has a hot climate and many beautiful and amazing tourist attractions, like the San Jose Church that dates back to the Spanish colonial period with many beautiful wood carvings.  

Romulo lives here.  He is sixty-four years old.  His favorite dish is fried pork rinds and in his city, this is one of the typical dishes.  Romulo is a very hardworking man and since he was very young, he has learned to earn a living with sweat on his brow.  His parents had few economic resources and he needed to support them.  Because of this, he could only study up to his last year in high school, but he would have liked to study a career in Agricultural Engineering.

Day to day, Romulo works as an agricultural worker.  He also has a plot of land where he presently has planted prickly pear, a species of cactus that grows fruits of many pleasant colors.  Additionally, cochineal have infested his crop; this is a species of insect that lives in this type of plant and has a natural coloring.  He believes that he is moving forward with his work because he is responsible and above all, because he likes the work that he does.

Romulo is very thankful to the Kiva loaners.  Thanks to their help that they are offering, he will be able to cover the cochineal infestation expenses, which includes placing other types of insects in the prickly pear plants.  In this way, he will be able to have more cochineal offspring and to have a better harvest.  He will thereby be able to have a better income and to continue fighting to be able to realize his greatest dream: "to improve the quality of life and to plant other types of crops."

loans.use: to handle the cochineal infestation of his crop.

loans.name: Ejercito Mexicano (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Elizabet tiene la edad de 26 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Rafael con el cual tiene 2 pequeños hijos.
Ella es integrante de un grupo llamado Ejercito Mexicano y esta integrado por 4 personas y decidieron llamarlo así ya que es el nombre de la calle donde  se reúnen, así fuera fácil identificarlos. Este grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad  de cerro Mojarra  la capilla en la cual hay dos fuentes de empleo una es la pesca y la segunda la siembra y cultura de caña.

 Elizabet platica que ella junto con su esposo tenían algunos ahorros los cuales querían invertirle en un negocio que a futuro les diera mas ganancias así que se pusieron a platicar y decidieron invertirlo en la cría de borregos, ellos ya tiene un año realizando esta actividad y poco a poco su población de borregos va creciendo.
Ellos ven sus ganancias cuando realizan la venta de algunos de sus borregos, elizabet dice que su actividad requiere de tiempo y dedicación ya que todos los días saca a pastorear sus borregos desde muy temprano hay que llevarlos a tomar agua y después meterlos al corral, esto también implica realizar la limpieza a los corrales diario.
Elizabet esta mas contenta ya que gracias esta actividad podrá brindarles a sus hijos en un futuro la posibilidad de continuar estudiando.
Un prestamo de Vision Fund le ayudara a comprar de vacunas, desparasitantes y alimentos para sus borregos.

ella y su grupo agradecen el apoyo que se le ha dado con estos prestamos para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Elizabet is twenty-six and has only a junior high school education.  She's married to Rafael, with whom she has two little children.  She's a member of a group called "Ejercito Mexicano" [Mexican Army], made up of four people who decided to give it that name because it's the name of the street where they meet so it's easy to identify.  The group is located in the community of Cerro Mojarra (La Capilla) where there are two sources of employment: fishing and growing sugar cane.

Elizabet says that she and her husband had some savings that they wanted invest in a business that would provide them more income in the future, so they decided to raise young sheep.  They've been at it for about a year and their herd has been growing little by little.

They'll make their profit when they sell some of the sheep.  Elizabet says that the business requires time and dedication because they have to pasture the sheep very early every morning.  Later they have to water and corral them, which means they have to clean the corrals every day.

Elizabet is most happy because, thanks to the business, she'll be able to continue to send her kids to school in the future.  A Vision Fund loan will help buy vaccines, antiparasitics, and food for their sheep.

She and her group are grateful for the support for their businesses have gotten from these loans.

loans.use: to pay for vaccines, antiparasitics, and food.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is 21 years old and newly married. They are currently residing in a rural community together with their parents. 

As a way of generating income, Cindy runs a variety store, while her husband manages their farmland. Cindy planned to improve her business to increase her income. Due to financial insufficiency, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of snack foods, noodles, seasonings, soaps, canned goods, eggs, frozen foods and soft drinks to sell. 

Cindy believes that she will be able to improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of snack foods, noodles, seasonings, soaps, canned goods, eggs, frozen foods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Lorena

texts.es: Nancy, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el sector suburbano de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace 4 años donde vende comidas como baleadas, pastelitos, tajadas, tacos y otros. El negocio lo tiene en una cafetería de la escuela de la colonia y sus clientes son los niños de la escuela. Ha solicitado varios prestamos en ODEF para  su negocio, el préstamo que solicita actualmente es el numero 14 y es por 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de comidas. Su meta es mejorar su vivienda y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in a suburban section of San Pedro Sula.

For the past four years, she has managed her own business of selling food such as “baleadas” (the Honduran version of a burrito), turnovers, fried plantains, tacos, and other items. Her business is located at the local school cafeteria and her customers are the children at the school. Nancy has requested several loans from ODEF for her business.

The loan she is currently requesting is her 14th transaction and is in the amount of 15,000 HNL. The money will be used to buy necessary supplies for making her dishes. Her goal is to improve her home and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: 3.13.240.01. Thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình is 63 years old and is married with two children. Her children are grown up, so Bình supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
