Bình works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Bình is the group leader of the 3.13.240.01 Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of four members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

In 2010, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard  is a single man. He describes himself to be a humble and self-sufficient man. He operates a butcher shop  where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located at a ready market  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate meat to sell. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy meat to sell. His business goal is to be the best meat supplier  within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: 3.13.241.06. Thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến has a service business repairing electronics. She is requesting a loan to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell. Yến is 23 years old and she is married and has one child. Yến is the group leader of the 3.13.241.06. Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of three members.  Yến supports one dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Yến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Yến has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yến has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Yến hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase electrical and electronic devices to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old, married and a mother of three children. She lives in Kisauni, Kenya, where she sells fruits and vegetables in her own stall. She lives in a rental house with electric power and tap water. Her major monthly expenditure is school fees.
She has applied for a loan amounting to ksh.15,000 to buy sacks of potatoes and onions. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and onions

loans.name: Ojo De Agua Group

texts.es: Miguel es un hombre trabajador y responsable platica que desde muy joven le agarro gusto por el comercio ya que el desde pequeño le ayudaba a su mama en el negocio de la venta de frutas de temporada. Platica que él es parte de un grupo llamado Ojo de Agua ya que donde se reúnen hacer sus reuniones y cobranzas hay un ojo de agua el cual abástece a su comunidad. Miguel está casado con la señora Heliodora y tiene dos niños los cuales estudian una la preparatoria y el más pequeño, la secundaria. Dice que él tiene con su negocio de venta de frutas y  legumbres desde hace 22 años ya que desde que se caso su mama le ayudo a poner su propio puesto para que  así pudiera mantener a su familia. Platica que el surte sus frutas y legumbres de temporada en la central de abastos de su comunidad y tiene que ir a muy temprana hora para escoger la mejor fruta y la mas fresca para que no la malluguen y la pueda vender a un mejor precio. El sale a vender su fruta en diferentes tianguis y le gusta mucho su trabajo porque tiene la tarde libre para estar al pendiente de la educación de sus hijos y de su familia. Comenta que pide un crédito a VisionFund porque quiere surtir su puesto ya que ahorita se viene la temporada fuerte de ventas ya que la fruta en la semana santa es cuando mejor se le vende como son naranjas, mandarinas, sandias, melón verde y melón chino, piña y también cultiva aguacate el cual corta en dos temporadas que es en febrero y junio, dice que también parte del crédito lo ocupara en la compra de insumos para sus aguacates y chiles manzanos de cultiva. Las otras tres personas se llaman Maribel, Felisa y Juan ellos invertirán sus créditos en sus negocios de venta de perfumería y cosméticos por catalogo y venta de frutas y  legumbres.
texts.en: Miguel is hard-working and responsible.  He tells us that from a very young age he found a liking for business as, as a child, he used to help his mother in her business selling seasonal fruits.  He is part of a group called "Ojo de agua" (natural pool in English) as where the group meets and collects its loans, there is a natural pool that supplies water to the community.  Miguel is married to Heliodora and they have two children.  One is taking preparatory courses for university while the younger is at secondary school.  Miguel says that he has had his fruit and vegetable business for 22 years as, when he married, his mother helped him to set up his own stall, so that he could look after his family.  Miguel buys his seasonal fruit and vegetables in the town's central market.  He has to go very early in order pick the best and freshest fruit, so that it is not bruised, and so he can sell it for a better price.  He goes out to sell his fruit in different markets in the state and he says he likes his a lot as he has afternoon free to look after his children and family.  He says he is applying for a loan with Vision Fund because he wants to stock up his stall as the high season for selling is coming.  Easter week is when fruits such as oranges, mandarins, watermelon, melons and pineapple sell best.  He also grows avocados, which are ready in both February and June.  He also says that part of the loan will be used to buy supplies for growing avocados and hot chili peppers.  The other three members of the group are Maribel, Felisa and Juan.  The will invest their loans in their businesses that do catalog sales of perfumes and cosmetics and selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit and vegetables to sell at his market stall.

loans.name: El Capulin Group

texts.es: Doña Regina tiene 70 años de edad es originaria de una comunidad donde sus raíces son muy arraigadas por que visten y hablan su cultura Mazahua. Ella pertenece a un grupo llamado El Capulin porque donde se reúnen hay un gran árbol frondoso y para que ubicaran mejor el nombre de su grupo le decidieron poner así. Ella desde hace mas de 40 años su mama le enseño el arte de tejer la lana para elaborar creaciones para vestir como son zarapes, cobijas, gorros, bufandas, capas, rebosos de este lindo y muy cálido material ya que en su localidad se cría con mucha facilidad los borregos de los cuales sacan la materia prima para hacer las creaciones en lana. Doña Regina también hace servilletas, manteles, almohadones y los vende en poblaciones aledañas a su comunidad y a veces la invitan a expo ferias en poblaciones donde se exhiben las artesanías de la región. Ahorita ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material ella dice en palabras medias cortadas ya que no sabe hablar muy bien el español dice “necesito un préstamo para comprar material, pronto será la expo feria de Zitacuaro y casi no tengo costuras para vender y quiero comprar estambre, tela, hilos, agujas, ganchos para poder hacerlos y poner a mis nietas para que me ayuden y terminar pronto y aprovechar la expo”. Dice que esta agradecida con lo que está haciendo VisionFund por que a veces discriminan a la gente de la comunidad por su apariencia y no les quieren hacer créditos para mejorar su calidad de vida  y mejorar más que nada sus negocios. los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Aurelia, Juan, Juan H. y Abraham ellos invertiran en sus negocios de bordados de prendas artesanales, en una tienda de abarrotes y en la compra de frutas y legumbres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Regina is 70 years old and is from a community where her cultural heritage is very rooted because they speak her Mazahua language and use traditional dress. She belongs to a group called El Capulin (The Cherry Tree) because where they meet there is a big leafy tree and they decided to name themselves that to better locate the group. More than 40 years ago her mother taught her the art of knitting wool to create clothing like zarape shawls, blankets, hats, scarves, coats, and other shawls of this pretty and very warm material, as sheep are raised easily in her area and from them they get the raw material to make their woolen creations. Mrs. Regina also makes napkins, tablecloths and cushions, and sells them in the areas surrounding her community. 

Sometimes she is invited to expo fairs in areas where regional artisan work is exhibited. She is currently asking for a loan to buy material. She says in words that are half cut off, as she doesn't know how to speak Spanish very well, “I need a loan to buy material, the Zitacuaro expo fair will be happening soon and I barely have anything to sell. I want to buy yarn, fabric, needles and hooks to be able to make clothing, and get my granddaughters to help me  so I can finish soon and take advantage of the expo.” She says that she is grateful for what VisionFund is doing because sometimes people in the community discriminate against her for her appearance; they don't want to give her loans to improve her quality of life and to improve her business above all. The other group members are named Aurelia, Juan, Juan H. and Abraham. They invest in their businesses of artesanal embroidered garments, in a grocery store and in buying fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy yarn, fabric, thread, needles, hooks etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
With the desire to experience a good quality of life, Marites is engaged in a hog-fattening business as a source of income. She has been in this business for five years and is longing for a better income through this business. 

Now, Marites is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicine to nourish her pigs and make them healthy. Hopefully, she can dispose the pigs at a profitable price soon.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 36-year-old woman, married, with two children. She lives in Kisauni, Kenya. She is characterized as being a hard-working, entrepreneurial, and responsible person.

She currently owns and operates a food stall where she prepares and sells meals, ranging from breakfast and lunch to supper and drinks. She is applying for loan amounting to KES 25,000 to buy food ingredients and sacks of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients and sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel earns a living through her hog raising business. She is 37 years old and a mother of five young children.
 Maricel needs a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business, thus allowing her to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and feed for pigs

loans.name: 3.13.243.08.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoa operates a food stall selling cattle meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle to resell.  Thoa is 51 years old.  She is married and has four children. Thoa is the group leader of the 3.13.243.08.Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of three members. Her children are grown up, so Thoa supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thoa has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thoa hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell.

loans.name: 3.6.244.04.thiệu Nguyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiểu is 42 years old and married with two children. Her children are grown up, so Hiểu supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hiểu works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hiểu is the group leader of the 3.6.244.04.Thiệu Nguyên solidarity group, which consists of three members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Hiểu hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

In 2010, Hiểu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana is 49 year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has eight grown children. The eldest is 23 and the youngest is seven years old. She has beeb engaged in the food vending business for 30 years now. She sell cassava cake. This is the source of her income.
Vitaliana is requesting a loan to buy ingredients like cassava, sugar, margarine and oil. This are the ingredients that are used in making cassava cake. Through this loan, she will be able to buy this ingredients and she can start doing her business.
In the future, Vitaliana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cassava, sugar, oil, margarine

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hard-working mother who aims to become successful in the future. She is 41 years old and has only one child. 

She plans to improve her small variety store and increase her income to satisfy the family's necessities and support the education of their child. Due to a financial difficulty, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of beverages, seasonings, soaps, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, and frozen foods to sell. She hopes that, someday, she will make more improvements in the business as she continues to work hard and strive for it.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beverages, seasonings, soaps, canned goods, noodles, snack foods, and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 27 años , esta casada con Segundo con quien tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 4 años, juntos viven en la casa de material noble que construyeron  hace algunos años atrás.La actividad que realiza Liz es la venta de carnes tales como carne de res , carne de chancho , pescado entre otros . Realiza su trabajo en el frontis de su hogar , en donde instala una mesa para exhibir todas las carnes que tiene para preparar diversos potajes del menú diario de sus clientes. Lleva en este negocio 6 meses. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias económicas que le deja  .La necesidad de cubrir las carencias económicas en su hogar,  la llevaron a desarrollar este trabajo y algunas veces le resulta muy agotador ,sin embargo, espera continuar con su negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingreso .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible este financiamiento y así pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado comprará carne de cerdo , carne de res , pescado y pollos para continuar vendiendo en su puesto.
texts.en:
Liz is 27 years old and married to Segundo. They have two children (ages 8 and 4) and live together in a home they built a few years ago out of solid materials. Her business activity involves selling meat such as beef, pork, fish, and other products. She conducts her work in front of her house where she has a table set up for displaying all of the meat she has on hand for preparing different stews that are on her daily menu for her customers. Liz has been in this business for six months. She considers her business to be profitable because of the financial earnings that it generates. The need to cover shortages in her household income has motivated her to develop in her work, sometime leaving her extremely exhausted. Nonetheless, she hopes to continue her business since it is her only source of income.

Liz is taking this opportunity to request 800 PEN. For this reason, she is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can move forward with her plans. The amount she requested will be used to buy pork, beef, fish, and chicken so that she can continue to sell from her stand.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, fish, and chicken.

loans.name: 3.6.245.11.thiệu Nguyên Group

texts.en:
Hoa works in agriculture farming, poultry, and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle, to raise and sell in the future.

Hoa is 34 years old and she is married, with two children. Hoa is the group leader of the 3.6.245.11.Thiệu Nguyên Group, which consists of three members. Hoa supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hoa joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid three loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. 

Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle, to raise and sell.

loans.name: Las Dalias Group

texts.es:
Otro de los integrantes del grupo es Doña Nieves, ella tiene la edad de 84 años, es viuda. 
Doña nieves platica que desde hace mas de 50 años se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de pan, ella tiene su panadería en una pequeña galerita en su casa en la cual tiene su horno y su mesa de trabajo, este pan es ya una tradición entre sus clientes ya que tienen muchos años de consumirlo y se dice que es uno de los mejores de la comunidad ya que es muy rico. 
Cuando ella inicio con esta actividad fue para sacar adelante a sus hijos que eran pequeños y para tratar de darles una mejor vida, actualmente ya todos sus hijos están casados y por medio de esta actividad ella tiene su propio empleo y gana su dinero alimentarse y lo que va necesitando.
La elaboración de su pan le toma tiempo ya que inicia mezclando los ingredientes preparar la masa de la cual formara las figuras del pan, posteriormente pone en charolas y hornea en cuanto esta listo lo pone en canastos para venderlo, ella tiene un par de niños que le ayudan a vender y ella les de un sueldo por su servio.
Ella esta contenta con su panadería ya que gracias a ella ha salido adelante por 50 años y  sigue dándole frutos
Un crédito de Vision fund le ayudara a compra  de harinas, azúcar, sal y levadura para continuar con su elaboración de pan.

Doña Nieves espera que su panadería continué creciendo para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

las demas integrantes del grupo son:
Fabiola Club de nutricion
Jova venta de calzado
Marcela venta de comida 
Imelda venta de comida 
Rosa Maria venta de calzado 
Tania venta de frutas y verduras
texts.en:
Another member of the group is Nieves. She is 84 years old and a widow.  

Nieves says that she has been making and selling bread for more than 50 years now. She has a bakery in a small kitchen in her house that has an oven and her work table. Her customers have been eating her bread for so long that it has become a tradition.  She says that it is one of the best in the community because it is so delicious.

She started this business to provide for her children when they were young and to try to give them a better life. All of her children are married now and this business allows her to provide for herself. 

Making the bread takes time. She first starts by mixing the ingredients to prepare the dough which she will form into loaves of bread. Later, she puts them on trays and bakes them. When they are done she puts them into large baskets to sell. She has a couple of children that help her sell them and she pays them for their service.

She is happy with her bakery and grateful that it has provided for her for 50 years and that she continues to earn a living.
With the loan through Vision Fund she will buy flour, sugar, salt and yeast so she can continue making her bread. 

Nieves hopes that her bakery will continue growing so she can have a better quality of life.

Other group members are:
Fabiola – nutritional supplement sales
Jova – shoe sales
Marcela – food sales
Imelda - food sales
Rosa Maria – shoe sales
Tania – fruit and vegetable sales

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, salt and yeast.

loans.name: Feliz De La Cruz

texts.es:
Feliz tiene 56 años, vive en la cálida ciudad de Nazca al lado de sus esposa y de sus 5 hijos, a los cuales quiere mucho y sobre todo por quienes lucha cada día para hacerlos personas de bien y sobre todo sean mejores que el. Feliz trabaja como Guardián en un colegio de su ciudad, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias pero también tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual siembra café y con el fruto de sus trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos familiares; el cree que le va bien en sus trabajos porque es responsable y porque sus hijos lo impulsan a luchar cada día.

Féliz está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la segunda oportunidad que le brindan su gran apoyo y ahora podrá comprar materiales para el cultivo de café como sacos al por mayor, mantas y podrá cubrir los gastos de transporte de su producto, hacia los mercados y así podrá atender mejor a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para darle a sus hijos una profesión y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Feliz is 56 years old, and lives in the warm city of Nazca with his wife and his 5 children.  He loves his family very much and it is for his children that he works hard each day to help them become good people and above all become better than he is.  Feliz works as a custodian in a school in his city, and works about 12 hours a day, but also has a small parcel of land on which he plants coffee.  With the fruits of his labor he can meet, with much effort, his family's expenses.  He thinks that he does well in his work because he is responsible and because his children inspire him to work hard every day.  

Feliz is very grateful for Kiva's lenders, as this is already the second opportunity in which they have offered him great support.  Now he will be able to buy materials for coffee cultivation, such as sacks purchased in bulk and covers to use in transporting his product to markets in order to better serve his customers.  This will allow him to increase his income and continue working hard to give his children the opportunity to become professionals and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for coffee cultivation.

loans.name: 3.5.237.06.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Túy works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

Túy is 45 years old, and she is married with three children.

Túy is the group leader of the 3.5.237.06.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Two of her children are grown up so Túy supports one dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Túy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Túy has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Túy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Túy hopes for to do well in her business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Gunjlham

texts.en: Mrs. Gunjlham is a 30-year-old female head of household. She lives with her two sons in Ger in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her son Uchralsaihan, age 8, studies at local primary school. Saihanbayar (her other son), age 4, goes to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been working at her sister-in-law's small restaurant for years, and she is now planning to start her own business based on her years of experience. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to rent a restaurant to start her own business. She is hardworking and energetic person who says "I have to work hard to save for their further education and brighter future."

loans.use: to rent a restaurant to start her own business based on her years of experience

loans.name: José Noel

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde la edad de 10 años de edad, aprendió de su padre. Pero también José se ha dedicado a la venta de oro. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  Fundacion Campo, es para comprar leña en mayores cantidades; para luego salir a distribuirlas en los diferentes lugares aledaños en donde vive. Con el dinero, podrá tener disponible más leña para satisfacer la demanda y cubrir otros sectores que por falta de leña no ha podido llegar.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and married with two children. He has worked in agriculture since age 10, learning from his father. He also has worked selling gold.

José is requesting this loan through Fundación Campo to buy firewood in larger quantities. He then plans to go out selling it in the different areas that border where he lives. With the loan, José will have more firewood available to satisfy demand and he will also be able to expand into other areas that he has not been able to reach for lack of supply.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of firewood and expand his sales into other areas.

loans.name: Rulita

texts.en: Rulita, age 52, operates a hog fattening business.  She needs to make her business more progressive in order to gain high income. In order to do this, she is asking 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins. This possibly maximizes and improves her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
El señor Omar es estudiante de Fisioterapia, vive en casa de su madre en la zona de Alto San Pedro. Trabaja como empleado de hospital mientras termina sus estudios de postgrado. 
El solicita el crédito para completar los gastos que requieren este año de estudios y así poder seguir avanzando con su carrera.

El sueño de Omar es poder terminar sus estudios e independizarse para no tener que ser una carga en su hogar.
texts.en:
Omar studies physical therapy.  He lives in his mother's house in the Alto San Pedro area.  He works as a hospital employee while he finishes his graduate studies.  

He's requesting the loan to finish paying for his expenses for his studies this year.  This way he can continue making progress with his education.

Omar's dream is to be able to finish his studies and become independent so he's not a burden on his household.

loans.use: to pay for his graduate studies in physical therapy

loans.name: 01.05.03 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase general household commodities to resell.

Phương is 40 years old, and she is married with two children.

Phương is the group leader of the 01.05.03 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2011, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Phương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase general household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Grupo Los Globos Group

texts.es:
La señora Lazara tiene la edad de 45 años , estudio la primaria y se encuentra soltera, sus hijos ya estan casados y vive en  una zona cañera donde la principal fuente de trabajo se encuentra en el campo en la siembra y recoleccion de caña de azucar.

Doña Lazra  dice que siempre ha trabajado ya para sacar adelante a su familia, ella siempre ha trabajado como comerciente inicio vendiendo topper con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad pero hace un par de años vende ricos tacos de visted y longaniza, ella realiza sus ventas los fines de semana (viernes, sabados y domingos) en un pequeño corredor que tiene en su casa. Doña Lazara nos dice que Gracias a Dios se vende muy bien y que ademas la comida siempre se vende. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de carne, tortillas, cebolla, servilletas, variendad de chiles y refrescos para la preparacion de sus alimentos. Ella espera que su negocio continue creciendo e invertir en la compra de algunas mesas y sillas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
doña lazara diijo "gracias a su apoyo vamos poco a poco vamos haciendo crecer los negocios y tratando de tener una mejor vida saliendo adelante"

Doña Lazara es una de las 10 personas que integran n grupo llamado los globos, ellos dieron este nombre a su grupo ya que asi se llama el barrio donde vive la mayoria de sus integrantes. Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Azucena venta de abarrotes 
Israel servico de albañileria
Dolores venta de tortillas
Irene venta de ropa 
Juan Carlos venta de calzado
Misael venta de ropa 
Carolina venta de bisuteria
Luz del carmen venta de calzado 
Maria de Lourdes venta de manualidades
texts.en:
Lazara is a 45-year-old woman with a primary school education.  She is currently single, and her children are now married.  She lives in an area where sugar cane is grown, and the primary source of income is from the sowing and harvest of this crop.

She reports that she has always worked in order to provide a better life to her family.  She has always made her living as a vendor.  She started out selling Tupperware with her friends and neighbors but within a couple of years she was selling delicious sausage tacos.  She sells her tacos on Friday, Saturday and Sunday out of a small corridor that she has in her home.  She tells us that thanks to God, her sales are very good, and she always sells out of her food.

She needs this loan in order to buy meat, tortillas, onions, a variety of chili peppers, soft drinks and napkins.  She hopes that her business continues to grow and that she can invest in some tables and chairs so that she can provide better service to her customers.  She says "Thanks to your support we will be able to grow our businesses little by little and to have a better life going forward."

Lazara is one of ten members of the group "Los Globos".  They gave this name to their group since this is the name of the neighborhood where the majority of the members live.

The rest of the members are:

Azucena - sells groceries 
Israel - has a bricklaying business
Dolores -sells tortillas
Irene - sells clothing 
Juan Carlos - sells footwear
Misael  - sells clothing 
Carolina - sells jewelry
Luz del Carmen  - sells footwear
Maria de Lourdes - sells crafts

loans.use: to buy meat, tortillas, onions, a variety of chili peppers, soft drinks and napkins.

loans.name: Moisesa

texts.en: Moisesa is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children. Moisesa is engaged in buying and selling of various farm and sea products like bananas, seashells, and others. Moisesa works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially the schooling of her children. Moisesa is asking for a loan to buy additional products to sell in the market like bananas and other farm products as well as seafood. With this, she will be able to sell more to the market thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell in the market like bananas and other farm products as well as seafood

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El comité “MUJERES LUCHADORAS DE SAN ISIDRO” se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene  24 integrantes y todas ellas ya realizan actividades productivas. Todas se esfuerzan esperanzadas en brindar un futuro distinto y mejor a sus familias.
Lorena, una de las miembros de este grupo se destaca por su trabajo y lucha diaria en todo lo que hace, y por medio de la venta de platería que ella hace está saliendo adelante.  Lorena desde  muy joven que trabaja y quiere seguir haciéndolo, ya que sabe que es la única forma de seguir y tener lo que su familia necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas en plata, ya que tiene pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con sus clientes, además de eso también podrá ofrecerles mayor variedad para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras de San Isidro [Women Fighters of San Isidro] Group is in its third loan cycle of the women entrepreneurs program of Fundación Paraguaya. It is made up of 24 members, all of whom are working at productive activities. All of the members are putting a lot of effort and hope into bringing different and better futures to their families.

Lorena, one of the members of the group, stands out for her daily hard work in all she does. She is getting ahead by selling silver products. Lorena has worked from a very early age and wants to continue working because she says she knows that it is the only way to move forward and provide what her family needs.

Lorena is requesting this loan to buy silver jewelry. She already has orders from customers that she wants to fill. Moreover, with the loan she will be able to offer a greater variety of products in her business.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: San Agustin Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado SAN AGUSTIN ACTIVAS está en su ciclo 1  donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Estan trabajando con las 10 señoras para la eliminación de pobreza haciendo las primeras encuestas y a mas de una le falta superar la linea de pobreza.
Carmen, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de verduras y también de remedios. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que con su esfuerzo quiere salir adelante y es por eso que trabaja arduamente. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio grande para poder seguir trabajando y dando a su familia todo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras y con eso poder cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group SAN AGUSTIN ACTIVAS is in its first cycle where everyone works and helps each other to come out ahead. They are working with 10 ladies to eliminate poverty. The first surveys found more than one below the poverty line.

Carmen, one of the members, sells vegetables and medicine. She is a very hardworking person and entrepreneur that with her efforts wants to come out ahead and that is why she works arduously. Her dream is to be able to have a big business to be able to continue working and to provide everything for her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetables and thus be able to fulfill her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: 01.04.01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu  has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase general household commodities to resell.

Thu  is 54 years old and she is married with two children. Thu  is the group leader of the 01.04.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of eight members. One of Thu's children is grown up so she  lives with one dependent. in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thu  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thu  has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thu  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thu  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thu  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase general household commodities to resell.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
El señor Herminio tiene 69 años de edad, es casado vive con su esposa y una hija, en total tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, que ya son independientes.
Herminio cuenta que desde joven trabajó en una estación de Estación de Servicios como playero, actualmente ya jubilado. Tras años de ahorro pudo construir su casa y allí montar un pequeño negocio, que es una despensa, y gracias al buen trato pudieron formar su clientela, gracias a ello pudieron ir creciendo ofreciéndoles a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos. Dice Herminio que todo lo que tiene es con mucho sacrificio y fruto de su trabajo y el de su familia.
El solicita de este crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, frutas, verduras y demás, para que con ello siga dando una buena atención a sus clientes y ofrecerles buena variedad como siempre lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Herminio is 69 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter. In total, he has three adult children, who are now all independent.
Herminio worked since he was young as a gas station attendant, and now he is retired. Through years of saving, he was able to build his house and start a small convenience store. Thanks to the way in which he treats his customers, he has been able to build a loyal clientele. He has been able to grow his business and can now offer his customers a wider variety of products. Herminio says that everything he has now he obtained through a lot of sacrifices and hard work from both him and his family. 

He is requesting this loan to buy food, drinks, fruits, vegetables, and more, so that he can continue offering a good service to his customers, and to continue offering them a wide variety of goods as he has always done.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, fruits, vegetables and more for his convenience store.

loans.name: Berlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Berlie works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Berlie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Berlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 27 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chona is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Chona has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling generic medicines.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Caaguazu Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Caaguazú Poty está en su ciclo número 6to. del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, de 16 integrantes; 2 señoras  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Catalina, quien se dedica a la venta de verduras en su pequeño puesto. Ella cuenta que su grupo la ha ayudado mucho y que también las capacitaciones y el seguimiento que se les hace es muy bueno. Catalina es muy emprendedora, y con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y quiere seguir invirtiendo y trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de variadas verduras, como ser locotes, tomates, cebollas, y demás, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y teniendo los ingresos que necesita para el día a día de su familia.
texts.en:
The Caaguazú Poty group is in its sixth loan cycle with the women’s committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. The group is doing a poverty elimination survey – of the 16 members of the group, two were found to be below the poverty line.

One of the members of the group is Catalina, who works selling vegetables from her small stand. She says the group has helped her very much, and that the training and supervision that is given is very good. Catalina has a very entrepreneurial spirit, and with a lot of effort she is getting ahead. She wants to continue investing and working like she has been doing. 

She is requesting this loan to buy various vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, onions and others. In this way she will continue selling and have the income she needs for her family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy various vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, onions and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase sheets, blankets, quilts, and more products to sell

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is 35 years old and comes from Kakamega county which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is a married man and  they are blessed with three children whose ages are 10, seven and four years old.

Japheth is a plumber and also owns a plumbing supplies shop. He has been doing this business for the last five years  with a monthly income of KES. 40,000. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to purchase more stock of plumbing materials like pendulums and plumbing rods. He will use the anticipated profit to open a bigger plumbing supplies stall.

His dream is to be a leading plumber in town. He hopes to provide adequately for his family.

loans.use: to purchase pendulums and more plumbing rods for resale

loans.name: Wina

texts.en: Wina is 30 years old and married to a farmer named Michael Joseph. Currently, she is in the business of hog fattening and she needs additional capital to buy feed  to nourish them and medicine for the hogs.  A loan amount of P5,000 will be a great help in her business. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a 44-year-old woman from Ubay, Bohol. She runs a tailoring shop at her place, and has been catering to tailoring requests from her customers for more than 10 years now. 

Nila is asking for a loan to buy more cloth and thread and also to buy additional groceries for her store like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread, soap and toiletries. 

Nila believes that this loan will allow her to improve her business to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and thread for her tailoring service, and also to buy additional groceries for her store like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Ronelda

texts.en:
Ronelda is earning an income through her hog fattening business. She patiently cares for her hogs to make them healthy. 

To help achieve this, she is requesting financial support in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins. She hopes that her wish for a loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo la alegría esta trabajando con entusiasmo para poder crecer cada una en sus respectivos trabajos. Son 10 mujeres muy capaces, que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que pueden.
La Sra. Nilda es una de las integrantes, que ha mostrado muchas ganas de salir adelante y trabajar, entre sus quehaceres se puede comentar que ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías en maderas, como ser tallados y demás. Es una persona muy talentosa, y con este trabajo es como ayuda a su familia.
Esta solicitando de este crédito para la compra de maderas, para que ella de esa manera siga haciendo sus artesanías, y también con ello tenga los medios para seguir ayudando a sus parientes.
texts.en:
Every member of the communal bank La Alegría (Joy) is enthusiastically working to grow their businesses, which help them get ahead and give their families what they need. Nilda, a member, is determined to move forward and work. One of her activities is making wood carvings. She is talented, and this work helps her family out.

Nilda is applying for a loan to buy woods so that she can continue making her crafts and helping her relatives.

loans.use: to buy wood to carve.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número  1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y tienen como meta el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino en lo personal.
Rigoberta es parte de este grupo, y ella se unió en busca de un mejor bienestar para ella y su familia, ya que quiere ayudarlos a salir adelante y que no pasen por ninguna privación. Tiene una despensa, con la que surte a las personas de su barrio con todos los insumos de primera necesidad, y con esto tiene una forma de sostener los gastos de la casa y la familia.
Solicita de este crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de panificados, lácteos, bebidas, carnes, verduras, productos a granel y demás, productos que la ayudarán a seguir creciendo como microemprededora y a darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadoras [Working Women] Group is in its first loan cycle of the women’s committee program. The group is located in the city of Caaguazú.  They are learning to work together, and their goal is both the financial and personal growth of each member.

Rigoberta is a member of this group. She joined the group in order to improve her and her family’s welfare. She wants her family to get ahead and not suffer any hardships. She runs her own small grocery store from which the people of her neighborhood obtain their basic grocery necessities. With her store, Rigoberta is able to pay some of the household expenses of her family.

Rigoberta is requesting a loan to buy baked goods, dairy products, drinks, meats, vegetables, products in bulk and other grocery products. These products will help her continue to grow as a micro entrepreneur and give her family all that they need.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, dairy products, drinks, meats, vegetables, products in bulk and other grocery products.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 43-year-old married woman. She has five children who are all still schooling. She lives in a rental house with electric power and tap water. She owns a charcoal stall where she buys and sells firewood and charcoal.

She has requested a loan amounting to Ksh. 20,000 to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Vevencio

texts.en:
Vevencio is a 48-year-old married man from Anda, Bohol. He has eight children. The eldest is 22 and the youngest is one year old. Vevencio is a laborer. He has been in this business for 15 years now. This is his way to earn a living. He earns 5000 PHP in a month. 

Vevencio is requesting a loan to pay school expenses and fees for his children who are currently studying. By the use of this loan, he will be able to pay all the due fees and tuition of his children.

In the future, Vevencio hopes to expand his business. He wants all his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay school fees and  expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare his farm and buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a 45 year-old married woman and a mother of two children from CPG, Bohol.  Nonita operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community.  Nonita is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, Nonita will be able attract and cater more buyers in her store.  

In the future, Nonita hopes to make her business sustainable and more productive.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell, like canned goods, candies, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 38 years old and has three school-age children. Due to the high cost of school fees, she engages in buying and selling fruit in the market to generate additional income. She previously aimed to acquire more kinds of fruits to sell but she did not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000.00 to buy more stocks of fruit like mangoes, oranges, calamansi and bananas to sell. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits like mangoes, oranges, calamansi and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Tutor Jaya Group

texts.en:
Widya is a 28-year-old young woman. She lives with her husband who works as a construction laborer. Their oldest child attends Senior High School and her second daughter is in Elementary School. 

Widya opened her own hair salon and she only received orders for bridal make-up. Widya borrowed from VisionFund Indonesia because she has a plan to open a service, not only for make-up, but for hair care also. She will use this loan to buy hair scissors, hair clips, and hair curlers. In the future she has plans to increase her available inventory and buy new inventory. She enjoys this business because she already has seen her mom in this business since she was a child. She can get 150,000 IDR for every month.

loans.use: to buy scissors, hair clips, and hair curlers

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Rosita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and her general store. Rosita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fruit and vegetable to sell.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to finish paying for her children's education in college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Aigun

texts.en:
Aigun is 30 years old. She lives in a small village in Sagarejo District with her husband and two children. Aigun requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business startup, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 15 hens and 6 turkeys. In addition, her husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Aigun requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Aigun will purchase sheep. After purchasing the sheep, she will be able to expand her livestock and increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for her new livestock business

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en: Lucas is grateful for the previous loan, as it enabled him to expand his business. He now wants to include groceries in his shop and is requesting a loan of ksh.50000 to buy sacks of potatoes and onions. This will increase his income and hence improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and onions for his shop.

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
Raymund is a 38-year-old married fisherman from C.P.G, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than seven years now. 

Raymund is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine for his fishing boat. With this, he will be able to go back to fishing and improve his business. 

In the future, Raymund has hopes of making his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a boat engine.

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.ru:
Анатолий  - фермер. С 2009 года занимается выращиванием клубники, картофеля и кукурузы.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга и сын, которому 19 лет, он работает слесарем в газовом хозяйстве.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания молодой капусты.
Анатолий с супругой решили приобрести опрыскиватель для сада, мотокосу для уборки сорняков и окучник для мотоблока.
В планах на будущее:  посадить абрикосовые деревья в своем саду, и поставить теплицу для выращивания клубники.
В личных планах: достроить дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования опрыскивателя, мотокосы и окучника.
texts.en: Anatolly is a farmer.  Since 2009, he's grown strawberries, potatoes and corn.  His wife helps him with the farm work while his 19-year-old son works as a mechanic at a service station.  The business is expanding with the planting of young cabbage.  Anatolly and his wife decided to buy a garden sprayer, brush cutters to clear the fields and а plow attachment.  In the future, they plan to plant apricot trees in their garden and build a greenhouse to grow strawberries.  Their non-professional plans include building a house.  They need your help to finance the sprinkler, brush cutters and plow.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El comité San Pedro nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que trabajaba en la misma zona que estas mujeres. Ellas se unieron y se fijan como meta el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
La Sra. Sirsa, una de las miembros, trabaja en la costura, es una persona muy creativa que sabe y conoce de su trabajo. Cuenta que lleva ya un tiempo haciéndolo y que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que siempre le trae trabajos para hacer y es gracias a esto que está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, y así seguir con sus confecciones y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Pedro group was started with the management and support of another group that worked in the same area as these women. The women joined together and set their goal as both the economic and personal growth of each member.  

Sirsa, one of the members of the group, is a seamstress. She is a very creative person who knows all the aspects of her work. Sirsa says she has been sewing for some time now and has established a very good following of customers. They are always bringing her work to do, and she says that it is thanks to this that she is getting ahead.

Sirsa is requesting this loan to buy fabrics and thread, and to continue making garments and filling her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos. Desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar fuertemente en la agricultura y en la ganadería, también aprendió a trabajar en la albañilería. A los 20 años de edad, aprendió el oficio de sastre y es en esa labor que trabaja hoy en día. Confecciona pantalones, blusas, camisas, entre otras prendas más. Sin dejar de lado la agricultura y la ganadería, siempre trabaja en este rubro pero en pequeña escala. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando  Fundacion Campo, es para comprar dos vacas y una maquina industrial, para elaborar los uniformes escolares de unas escuelas públicas y demás trabajo que le llega de otras personas. Él aprovechara un terreno que posee para que las vacas pasten ahí, además de satisfacer la demanda de confección de prendas de vestir. Su sueño, es establecer un local para instalar ahí su taller de sastrería y comprar un carro, ya que debe desplazarse a lugares muy lejanos.
texts.en:
Juan, 36, is married and has five children. He lives with his wife and five children. As a child, his parents taught him to work hard in agriculture and livestock farming, as well, he learned bricklaying. At 20 years of age he learned how to be a tailor, which is his job today. He makes pants, blouses, shirts and other articles of clothing. He hasn't left farming behind as he continues at a smaller scale.
The loan he is requesting from Fundacion Campo is to buy two cows and an industrial sewing machine to make private school uniforms and any other work that comes his way from others. He'll use the small parcel of land he owns to lead the cows to pasture as well as satisfy the demand for tailored clothing. His dream is to own a place for his tailor shop and buy a car, as he has to move around to faraway areas.

loans.use: buy two cows and an industrial sewing machine to make private school uniforms and any other work that comes his way from others

loans.name: Martha Ilia

texts.es:
Martha es una humilde mujer de origen campesino, habita en la linda ciudad de Estelí, es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores, profesionales e independiente.

Martha se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora y con mucho amor a su familia actualmente es trabajadora de una institucion estatal desempeñándose como conserje por más de 29 años trabajando para esta empresa, es así que Martha siendo una madre soltera ha podido darle una mejor forma de vida ya que logro con su esfuerzo que todos sus hijos se profesionalizaran.

 Martha solicita un crédito que lo  va a invertir para pago de mano de obra ya que está realizando la construcción de un cuarto de habitación en su vivienda, a si poder darle una mejor condición a su vivienda y comodidad a su familia.

Ella manifiesta sentirse alegre por el apoyo que le puede brindar por que hará realidad sus proyecto personales.
texts.en:
Martha is a humble woman from the country. She lives in the pretty city of Esteli and is single with four grown children who are living independently and working as professionals. 

Martha is characterized by being a hardworking woman who loves her family a lot. Currently she is working on an estate as a porter. She has been working for this company for more than 29 years, and that's how she has been able to be a single mother. She has been able to create a better life for herself through her efforts and by making sure all her children are well employed.

Martha is asking for this loan so she can put it towards the payment of the manual labor she will need to construct a living room in her home. This would help her improve the condition of her home and her family's comfort.

She has become very happy because of the support that Kiva has given her because it makes her personal projects possible.

loans.use: to improve her living space and to pay for the labor it will take to do so.

loans.name: Aghamali

texts.en:
Agamali is 62 years old, married, and the father of three adult children, ages 29, 32 and 35. His eldest son is married and lives separately, but works together with his father. Agamali lives with his wife and two children. His wife is provided with a retirement pension.

The family's activity and source of income for the past 30 years has been cattle-breeding. They have been selling milk and selling cattle for meat. There is a strong demand for their products that makes growth in their business. Yet, they work hard, both to keep good service and especially to meet the demand for their products.

This is the sixth time that Agamali is requesting a loan from VFAC. He has always repaid the loans without delay. Now he is requesting a loan to buy two refrigerators, which will be located in his and his son's houses. There, they will keep the milk products. Refrigeration will help them not to decline in the summer, when the weather is hot.

loans.use: To buy two refrigerators, for keeping milk products in the summer.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda, aged 26, is operating a hog fattening business as a source of income. She is patiently doing such activities because she wants to slowly uplift their poor living conditions. For now, to increase her income, she is asking a loan of P5,000 to buy feed and vitamins to make her hogs healthier and bigger.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira is a 47-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has six children between the ages of 6 and 23.  All of them go to school.

Sabira runs a fish-selling business and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2500 SSP to purchase fish and other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Sabira would like to expand her   business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Sabira says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan   through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Walter Osmar

texts.es:
Walter tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo, por el cual lucha cada día, para brindarle lo mejor que pueda. Walter,  es una persona con muchos deseos de superación. Desde muy pequeño empezó a trabajar en las labores agrícolas junto a su padre. Pero desde hace unos 15 años, aprendió la actividad de destazar cerdos, reses y diferentes animales de consumo humano. Es muy reconocido en el lugar, pues también presta sus servicios a otras personas que lo buscan para destazar. Todos los días se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para iniciar su jornada laboral. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  Fundacion Campo, es para comprar teja, arena, hierro, cemento y pago de mano de obra. Para construir un muro de contención a la vivienda que recién acaba de construir de bahareque y barro. El muro de contención es necesario, ya que le brindara seguridad a su hogar y el resto del crédito será para comprar cuatro cerdos para destazo. Walter, podrá cumplir uno de sus mas grandes sueños y es vivir en casa propia en compañía de su esposa e hijo, debido a que todo este tiempo ha estado alquilando.
texts.en:
Walter is 28 years old and married with one child. He lives with his wife and his small son, for whom he fights every day to provide the best he can.

Walter has a strong desire to get ahead.  At a very early age he began to work with his father in agriculture. But at age 15, he learned how to butcher pigs, cattle and other animals for human consumption. He is well known in his area, and he also offers his services to other people who seek him to butcher animals. Every day he rises at 4 a.m. to start his workday.

Walter is requesting this loan through Fundación Campo to buy tile, sand, iron and cement and to pay for the labor to build a retaining wall for the home that he recently built of adobe and earth. He says that the retaining wall is necessary to provide security for his home. Walter will use the rest of the loan to buy four pigs to butcher. With the loan, Walter will fulfill one of his greatest dreams, which is to live in his own home with his wife and son, as up until now he has been renting.

loans.use: to buy tile, sand, iron and cement and to pay for the labor to build a retaining wall and to buy four pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Karin Dayane

texts.es:
Karin  de 32 años, es originaria de la Ciudad de Somotillo, es una joven emprendedora, responsable, de buenas costumbres, viuda, dedicada a su trabajo, estudios y a su pequeño hijo.

 a pesar de todos los inconvenientes que ha tenido ha podido salir adelante para su bienestar y el de su hijo, actualmente esta culminando su carrera de Administración de Empresa, por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un préstamo para el pago de los aranceles de su Monografia y/o tesis y poder terminar con éxito su carrera.
texts.en:
Karin, 32, is originally from the city of Somotillo. She's a young entrepreneur, responsible, well mannered, widowed and dedicated to her work, her studies and her young son. 

Despite all of the challenges she has faced, she has been able to move forward for her well-being and her son's. She is currently finishing her studies in Business Administration and is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to pay the fees of her monograph (one-topic essay) and/or thesis so she can graduate successfully.

loans.use: pay the fees of her monograph (one-topic essay) and/or thesis so she can finish her studies in Business Administration.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo, de 60 años,esta divorciado desde  hace muchos , pero tiene 7 hijos , actualmente el vive solo en su casa propia , la cual termino de construir a base de esfuerzo y dedicación.El trabajo de Adolfo está orientado a la reparación y mantenimiento de motos y mototaxis. Tiene su taller instalado en su hogar y ahí se encarga de arreglar todos los vehículos que a diario le entregan sus clientes para dejarlo en optimas condiciones. Lleva 15 años en esta actividad y trabaja junto a  2 mecánicos que le ayudan a abastecer las necesidades de su clientela. Tiene mucho acceso al público ya que se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad.Le gusta mucho su trabajo, no en vano lleva tantos años en este rubro , lo que le ha  permitido ganarse el respeto de sus clientes . Espera implementar su taller con muchas más herramientas y asi obtener un mejor resultado. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200 soles para la compra de repuestos que usa en la refacción de vehículos como embrague, cadenas, rodajes, llantas , entre otros , por lo tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible  este financiamiento ya que le ayudará a aumentar su calidad de trabajo.
texts.en: Adolfo is 60 years old.  He has been divorced for many years but he has seven children.  Currently, he lives in his own home which he finished building due to his effort and dedication.  Adolfo repairs motorcycles and motorcycles taxis. His workshop is located at his home.  Every day, his customers bring in their vehicles and he is responsible for repairing all of them and leaving them in optimal condition.  He has been engaged in this activity for fifteen years and works with two mechanics that help him meet the needs of his customers.  He has good access to the public as he is located in a busy area of the city.  He enjoys his work very much, and being in this business for so many years has not been in vain because he has earned the respect of his customers.  He plans to implement his workshop with many more tools and in this way, obtain a better result.  At this time, he is requesting S/. 1200 soles to purchase spare parts such as clutches, tire chains, wheels, tires, and others that are used to repair vehicles.  He is very grateful to all the people that make this financing possible because it will help him improve the quality of his work.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for vehicles.

loans.name: Marlin Soriek

texts.es:
Marlin de 39 años, soltera, es originaria de la Ciudad Somotillo, se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, honesta, responsable, dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, desde hace unos años se hizo responsable de sus dos Hermanos debido al fallecimiento de sus padres.

 ella ha sabido mantener a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, uno de sus hermanos esta en segundo año de la carrera Ingeniero Civil. 

 por lo que se presenta a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para pagos de aranceles del primer y segundo semestre, para que este culmine su segundo año de su carrera y pueda seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marlin, 39, is single and originates from the city of Somotillo. She is hard working, honest and dedicated to her work and her family. In the last years, she became responsible for her two brothers after her parents died. 

With much effort and great care, she's been able to maintain her family. One of her brothers is in his 2nd year of Civil Engineering and this is why she is requesting a loan. 

She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to pay tuition and 1st and 2nd semester fees, so he can finish his second year of school and continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay University tuition and 1st and 2nd semester fees.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is a 40-year-old widow who lives with her son in Ger, in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her son, Tamir, is 14 years old and studies at a local secondary school. 

Oyunchimeg has been working at various fields for years until now. 

She is now starting her own business of running a grocery store in a rental place. For years, she has also been helping her sister to run her grocery store during her free time, so she has experience in the business. 

Oyunchimeg is now requesting MNT 2,000,000 to purchase a starting inventory for her grocery store business. She is a hard-working, welcoming, and communicative woman.

loans.use: to purchase a starting inventory for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 35 años, es una mujer emprendedora y amable, esta casada con José y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 10 y 6 años de edad, juntos viven en su casa propia la cual es fruto de su esfuerzo.El trabajo de Karina consiste en vender abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad como cereales, arroz, pan, huevos, aceite, leche y otros. Compra cada 3 días al por mayor en el mercado principal de la ciudad obteniendo sus productos a precios cómodos lo cual le ayuda a obtener algunos centavos adicionales como ganancia. Tiene su bodega en un reducido espacio de su vivienda, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace 2 años y desde que empezó siempre ha trabajado sola.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da independencia para hacer otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que siempre hay personas que quieren ir a solicitar algún producto al crédito y al momento establecido para pagarle, no lo hacen, por ese motivo prefiere vender  al contado. Espera hacer crecer aun más su negocio y lograr tener una tienda mas amplia para seguir trabajando con mejores resultados.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, algunas verduras, huevos y leche ya que estos productos tienen mayor demanda y a su vez agradece a las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de contar con un capital de negocio .Con el préstamo solicitado comprará
texts.en:
Karina is 35 years old and is a kind and enterprising woman. She is married to José with whom she has three children aged 15, 10, and six. They live in their own house which was the result of their hard work. 

Karina works selling groceries and staple goods such as cereal, rice, bread, eggs, oil, milk, etc. Every three days, she buys her supplies at wholesale in the main city market where she can purchase the goods at affordable prices. This helps her to make a few more cents profit on them. She has her store in a small section of her home. She has been running her store for two years, and has worked on her own from the beginning. What she likes about her job is that it gives her the opportunity to carry out other tasks. What she doesn’t like is that there are always people who want to buy products on credit, and that don’t pay her when they are supposed to. This is why she prefers to receive full payments in cash. 

She hopes to grow her business even more and have a bigger store so that she can be more successful. She is currently requesting 1000 soles to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, vegetables, eggs, and milk, as these are the products that are in the highest demand. She thanks the people who are giving her the opportunity to borrow money for her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her convenience store.

loans.name: Vasta

texts.en: Vasta  used the loan to buy beer and chairs for her bar.She is a fifty-four-year-old married woman with seven children, living in Kasese, Uganda.She has been in the bar business for two years and within this period she has been able to attract very many loyal customers. Her hardships are limited seats and also inadequate capital to purchase drinks since the demand is very high. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is expanding her business into new markets. Vasta intends to use the money to buy beer and soda, and to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy beer and soda, and to pay school fees

loans.name: Mlombole Group

texts.en:
Mlombole is a group of ten farmers from Kakamega South District represented by Marble. The group has eight women and two men. Marble is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Marble first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Marble joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to use increased profits to send her children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Marble was only able to harvest three bags of maize per ½ acre but, after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 7.5 bags per ½ acre. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to invest in livestock.

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Marble’s group will receive five acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Victoriosas nace gracias a la gestión de la Señora Hilda, quien se convirtió en su presidenta. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo y se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
La Sra. Hilda, es casada tiene 36 años, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y por sobre todo muy optimista e inculca a las integrantes de su comité a salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de helados y también tiene una mercería con todo tipo de productos. Cuenta Hilda, que gracias a que tiene siempre muy bien surtido sus negocios es que está saliendo adelante y creciendo como microempresaria.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados y también de algunos artículos de mercería, ya que así podrá tener bien surtido su negocio y seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The community bank Mujeres Victoriosas was started thanks to the initiative of Hilda, who became the president of the group.  This group is located in the city of San Lorenzo, and its principal goal is to facilitate the personal growth of each member.  They are recognized locally as hardworking and dedicated women.

Hilda is 36 years old and is married.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  Above all she is optimistic, and she strives to instill this optimism in the group's members to motivate them to get ahead.  She sells ice cream and also has a men's furnishings store with all types of products.  She reports that she always keeps her businesses very well stocked and is this able to get ahead and to grow as small business owner.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy ice cream and also some men's furnishings, as this will allow her to keep her businesses well stocked and continue to offer her customers the variety that they have come to expect.

loans.use: to buy ice cream and men's furnishings.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: Griselda, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, esta casada con Elvis quien es obrero y padre de sus 3 hijos. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa la cual compraron con mucho esfuerzo.La actividad que realiza Griselda es la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños de diversos modelos . También vende productos de belleza como esmaltes, labiales, lociones , entre otros , tambien tiene una vitrina de exhibición en donde muestra sus artículos. Todos estos productos son adquiridos por catálogos y los vende  entre sus amigos, familiares y vecinos a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial logrando ganarse su preferencia. Se inició hace 5 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su hija.Antes de empezar con esta actividad tenía fuertes problemas económicos ya que no podía encontrar trabajo dentro de su profesión y necesitaba un ingreso económico para seguir solventando la educación de sus hijos ya que el dinero obtenido por el trabajo de su esposo no era suficiente . Afortunadamente, se arriesgó a ejercer esta labor y sus ganancias económicas le han permitido mejorar su situación económica. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500 soles para la compra de polos, pantalones, blusas, camisas , etc . A su vez está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con su trabajo y asegura que será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Griselda, 40, is a hard-working, diligent woman, married to a laborer husband Elvis with whom she has three children. They comfortably live together in a house that they bought after much hard work. Griselda sells different styles of clothing for women, men and children. She also sells beauty products, like nail polish, lipstick, lotion and other. She also has a glass display case where she displays her articles. All of these products are acquired by catalog and she sells to her friends, acquaintances and neighbors, whom she attends kindly and cordially, winning over their business. She started her business five years ago with the help of her daughter. Before starting her business, she was in major financial trouble, not able to find work in her field and not able to pay for her children's educations, as her husband's income wasn't enough. She took a big risk starting this business and fortunately her income from it has helped her improve her financial situation. She is requesting a loan of 2,500 PEN (approx.
