US $975) to buy t-shirts, pants, blouses, shirts, etc. She is happy to know she has financial support that will allow her to move forward in her work and she promises to be punctual with her payments.

loans.use: buy clothing.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 34-year-old married man with one child. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a stationery shop and repairs computers and photocopiers. 

Insufficient electricity supply in the area affects his business operations. His dreams are to buy a generator or solar system to help him run his business efficiently and to restock his stationery shop. 

Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy box files and paper to sell.

loans.use: to buy box files and paper to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 54 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad. Él vive solo con su esposa. Él es taxista desde hace 16 años; por lo que su clientela es bastante grande. Trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  Fundacion Campo, es para instalar un molino eléctrico de una tolva; brindar este servicio a la comunidad en donde vive, debido a que en ese lugar no hay un molino. Por lo que, el negocio es bastante rentable para Jorge y su familia. Su propósito, es comprar otro molino y ampliar el servicio para generar ingresos que le permita mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jorge is 54 years old, is married and has three adult children.  He lives only with his wife.  He has been a taxi driver for 16 years; thus his client base is substantial.  He works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

He is seeking a loan from Fundacion Campo in order to set up an electric mill and bring this service to his community, since there is no mill in the area where he lives.  Thus, the business is fairly profitable for him and his family.  His longer-term goal is to buy a second mill and expand his services so he can generate income that will enable him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to set up an electric mill and bring this service to his community, since there is no mill in the area where he lives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for banana, pork, sugar, cooking oil, gas and other ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Carlos Enrrique

texts.es:
Carlos Enrrique es originario de la ciudad de Sebaco su estado civil es soltero y tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Este joven se caracteriza por ser una persona honrada, trabajadora, y responsable. 

Actualmente se desempeña como fontanero de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace más de dos años, con el salario obtenido lo destina para los gasto del hogar de su familia. 

por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como ladrillo, hierro y cemento ya que está realizando mejora en su vivienda.

Carlos se siente feliz con este apoyo ya que manifiesta que con su salario realizar esta mejora en su vivienda se le hace más difícil ya que asume otros compromisos, pero a la misma vez agradece a kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que así dará una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Enrique is from the city of Sebaco. He is unmarried and has a school age son. He is known to be an honorable, hard-working, and responsible person.

He has been working for two years as a plumber in a company that gives maintenance to aqueducts and sewer systems. He uses his wages to provide for his family. 

He is requesting a loan to buy construction supplies, such as bricks, iron, and cement because he wants to improve the family home.

Carlos is happy to receive this support as he cannot afford to make these improvements with his salary alone, as he needs to use that for other expenses. He thanks Kiva for the support offered to him which will allow him to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and iron to make home improvements

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen is 33 years old, married but has no children. They live in a rural community where she runs a small variety store while her husband manages their farm land. They aim to improve the business and increase their income to satisfy their basic necessities and save for their future. To improve the business, Aileen is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more stocks of rice, sugar, oils, feeds, soft drinks, seasonings, soaps, snack foods, canned goods and noodles to sell. She is hoping that, someday, she will make the business more viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, sugar, oils, feeds, soft drinks, seasonings, soaps, snack foods, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Zuleyma Abigail

texts.es:
Zuleyma tiene 22 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio, posee un cafetín al interior de una escuela, en donde vende pupusas, panes, soda, frescos, etc. Esto del negocio ya es hereditario, ya que su madre siempre se dedico a esto. Antes Zuleyma, salía a vender frescos, enchiladas, entre otros productos de casa en casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  Fundacion Campo, es para comprar azúcar, refrescos, galletas, dulces, insumos para elaborar los alimentos, entre otros productos más para vender en su cafetín. Todo esto lo hace con la intención de aumentar sus ventas, para que sus ingresos sean mejores y le permitan construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Zuleyma is 22 years old. She has a partner and two children. She works as a shopkeeper and has a small cafe inside a school where she sells stuffed tortillas, breads, soda, fruit drinks etc. 

This business has been passed down through the family. Her mother has always had this business. Previously Zuleyma would go out to sell fruit drinks and enchiladas, amongst other products, from house to house.  

She is asking Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy sugar, soft drinks, biscuits, sweets and supplies for making food as well as other products, to sell in her cafe. 

She is doing this with the aim of increasing her sales, to improve her income so that she can build her own shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft drinks, biscuits, sweets and supplies for making food, as well as other products to sell in her cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy irrigation equipment

loans.name: Jenniffer

texts.en:
Jenniffer lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. She has 8 children and has been doing this work for 13 years.  Her primary income sources in addition to her salary are selling milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Earning from agriculture!"  Her biggest challenge is, "Price fluctuations for the farm produce, poor weather for farming and lack of funds to boost farming."  One of the cows on the farm has been named Tetah." 

Jenniffer will use the loan to buy a water tank which will help store water for her dairy animals.

Jenniffer was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "I joined Juhudi through a friend."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She responded, "How i could acquire agricultural assets through micro finance."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees for her children. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Jennifer replied 'Will acquire a water pump for irrigation.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jenniffer owns the following: cow, poultry, bicycle,  but does not own: pig, water pump, motorcycle, automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit stand business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fruits such as apples, oranges, grapes, jackfruit and mangoes to sell in her fruit stand business.

Rowena has been in this business for 16 years. Rowena also earns income from selling rice and farming coconut.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy fruits such as apples, oranges, grapes, jackfruit and mangoes to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Josué Tomas

texts.es:
Josué habitante de la linda ciudad de Estelí, su estado civil es acompañado, profesión docente de educación superior, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por dos hijos y su compañera de vida, sus hijos ambos en edad escolar, Josué se identifica por ser un profesional respetuoso, honesto.

Josué se desempeña como docente de estudio superior en una prestigiada universidad el cual se siente orgulloso por ser facilitado de conocimiento y portador del desarrollo de la juventud del país.

solicita un crédito que lo va destinar para la compra de piso cerámica para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, así darle una mayor presentación y comodidad a su vivienda.

 Expresa su gratitud y manifiesta sentirse motivada con kiva por el apoyo que se le brinda mediante los financiamiento ya que han sido de gran impacto en su familia ya que por medio de este servicio ha podido solventar algunos gasto universitario y ahora la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Josué lives in the beautiful city of Estelí. He's in a common law relationship, he is a professor, his family nucleus comprises his two children and his life partner. His two children are school aged. Josué is identified as an honest, respectful professional. 

Josué is a professor at a prestigious university and is proud to be a facilitator of knowledge and bearer of the development of youth in the country.

He is requesting a loan to buy a ceramic floor for his house, so he can upgrade his home, making it more beautiful and comfortable.

He expresses his gratitude to Kiva and feels motivated by the support he will receive through the loan, which will have an impact on his family. He'll be able to afford some university expenses and improve his home.

loans.use: buy a ceramic floor, so he can improve his home.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which hosts a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has two children and has been doing farming work for five years. Her primary income sources are eggs, crops, transportation services, and personal business.She will use the loan to buy a pump and a power generator.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'The profit gained from farming investment!' Her biggest challenge is: 'Pests and diseases.' The animal on the farm is named: 'Kanini.'

Florence was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'The interest rate for Juhudi is bearable.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required micro-finance training session: 'Juhudi Kilimo field loan officers visit the clients to help them manage the groups and repay the loans promptly.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Florence replied: 'Better education for the children.'

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Florence owns the following: 'poultry, pump, bicycle,' but does not own: 'cow, pig, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD,' but does not have: 'electricity.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a pump and power generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been blessed with four children. She operates a grocery store and has been in this business for the last twelve years. She also practices poultry farming. She is a very hard-working and self-driven woman. Faulu Kenya has helped her educate her children up to a college level. 

She hopes to be wealthy and to have achieved her objectives in the future. She requires a loan of 42,727 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Cristyan  Ramón

texts.es:
Cristyan Ramón  es originario de la  bella ciudad de Sebaco ubicada sobre la carretera panamericana en la parte  norte de Nicaragua, su estado civil es soltero tiene 32 años de edad, un hijo en edad escolar.

Actualmente Cristyan se desempeña como fontanero o plomero de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace dos años trabaja de lunes a viernes, y los fines de semana los destina para realizar sus estudios universitario.

solicita un crédito para solventar pago de matrícula, mensualidad y otros gastos universitarios. 

Este joven se siente motivado y con la visión de poder concluir sus estudios superiores y poder desarrollarse como todo un profesional y a la misma vez.

agradece de antemano a kiva y ceprodel por el apoyo que le puedan brindar a través del financiamiento ya que es una manera de aportar al desarrollo de la familia de escaso recurso económico
texts.en:
Cristyan Ramón, 32, is a single father of one child. He originates from the beautiful city of Sebaco, located on the Panamerican highway in northern Nicaragua. 

Currently, Cristyan works as a plumber for a sewage and plumbing company, an activity he's been doing for 2 years, working Monday to Friday. On the weekends, he studies for his university classes.

He is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition, monthly fees and other university expenses.

This young man feels motivated and has the vision to finish his university studies and develop into a professional, all at the same time. 

He is thankful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support he'll receive through this loan as it's a way to help a family of few economic resources move forward.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Sitti Hawa

texts.en:
Sitti Hawa is 46 years old and married with five children.

Sitti Hawa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, snack foods, eggs, etc.

Sitti Hawa has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Sitti Hawa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, snack foods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Martha Socorro

texts.es:
Martha tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos.  se dedica a la crianza de aves y ganado de repasto. Lo aprendió de su madre, pues desde muy chiquita veía a su madre criar animales de corral y ella grande siguió sus pasos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  Fundacion Campo, es para comprar una ternera y sácate para alimentar todo el ganando que posee. Pues, necesita proveerse de alimento para estos meses que son secos, además de contar con mas animales para la producción de leche y venta de novillos.
texts.en: Martha is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She rears poultry and grazing cattle. She learned how to do this from her mother who used to raise animals. She watched her mother work from a very young age, and later followed in her footsteps. She is requesting the loan from Fundación Campo to buy a calf and fodder to feed all her cattle. She needs food for herself during the coming dry months as well as more animals for milk production and cattle sales.

loans.use: to buy a calf and fodder to feed her cattle.

loans.name: Wendy Lisseth

texts.es:
Wendy tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella trabaja como asesora de crédito y también a la crianza de ganado de repasto. Es una persona que desde pequeña empezó a trabajar en el campo, gracias a sus padres. Por eso, hoy en día es dueña de sus propios animales que le producen leche y vende los terneros que produce. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  Fundacion Campo, es para comprar dos vacas y para terminar de cancelar un terreno que adquirió. Siendo la propietaria del terreno podrá construir su propia casa y tendrá más animales para obtener más leche.
texts.en: Wendy is 23 years and is the mother of a son. She works as a loan assessor as well as a cattle raiser. From a young age she decided that she wanted to work in farming, thanks to her parents. She now has her own animals which produce milk, and she sells the calves that they have. She is reqesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy two cows and to pay off what she owes on a piece of land that she bought. Once she owns the land, she will be able to build her house on it, as well as having more cows to produce more milk.

loans.use: to buy two cows and to make the final payment on a piece of land that she bought.

loans.name: Ceciel

texts.en: Ceciel is a hardworking person who is very dedicated to her business. She has a piggery business and has been in operation for more than a year. She is very keen to increase her sales and income to improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Hopefully, they will be well-nourished and she will be able to sell them for a higher price.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en: Oyunbileg is a 39-year-old female head of family and lives with her daughter in Ger, in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Her daughter Chuluunchimeg, age 16, goes to the local secondary school. The borrower has been running her small cafeteria since 2008. She serves organic food to her customers. She is now requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of meat to serve her customers with organic meals. She is a hardworking and patient woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of meat to serve her customers with organic meals

loans.name: Rahmonberdi

texts.ru:
Рахмонберди добрый трудолюбивый и ответственный  молодой мужчина.  Он  женат, отец троих детей.  Рахмонберди с семьей  живет в далеком горном районе.   Жена домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей.  Рахмонберди уже более 15 лет занимается откормом скота и знает все о преимуществах этого дела.  В местности, там где он живет этот вид деятельности является очень актуальным.  Рахмонберди  покупает молодых телят на скотном рынке и через некоторое время откормив их, продает за выгодную цену.  Этот бизнес является единственным доходом  семьи и он старается развивать его.  Рахмонберди давно хотел купить автомобиль, так как мечтал об этом всю свою жизнь. У него есть накопленные денежные средства но на авто не хватает. Сейчас планирует увеличить поголовье своего скота и  на приобретенную прибыль купит машину. 
На полученный кредит Рахмонберди планирует купить скот.  Он очень надеется, что  этот год будет очень удачным и он сможет осуществить свою давнею мечту.
texts.en:
Rahmonberdi is a kind, hardworking and responsible young man. He is married and is the father of three children. Rahmonberdi and his family live in a remote, mountainous region. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of their children. For over 15 years, Rahmonberdi has been fattening up cattle and knows all about the advantages of this business. In the region where he lives, this type of business is very important. Rahmonberdi buys young calves at the livestock market and, after fattening them for a little while, sells them for a favorable price. This business is the family's only source of income and he strives to expand it. Rahmonberdi has wanted to buy a car for a long time; he has dreamed about it his whole life. He has savings, but not enough for a car. Now he plans to increase his number of cattle and with the acquired profit, buy a car. 

With the received loan, Rahmonberdi plans to buy cattle. He really hopes that this year will be a lucky one and that he will be able to fulfill his longtime dream.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina, 60 years old, is married to a tricycle driver. They have two children. They reside harmoniously in the village of Union. Severina has managed a piggery business for almost three years, and earns an income of 3,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per hog. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase feed for her hogs. She hopes that her loan request will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is a farmer from Bohol, a province in the Philippines. Roel works hard to support the needs of his family, especially the schooling of his six children. Roel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his rice field. With this, he will be able to improve his harvest and yield.

In the future, Roel hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 34 years old. She is a hardworking entreprenuer. She is married and blessed with two children and lives together with them in Kisauni Kenya. She lives in a house she built herself, which has electric power and tap water. Her main monthly expenditure is school fees.

Naomi owns a business selling water. She has been doing this for the last two years. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy a water tank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 40-year-old married man and father of three children. He has been working in the construction business since 1992.  He specializes in painting homes and making cement decorations. His business is going just fine because of the good reputation he has in his region and because of the excellent experience he has.

Husein is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to build a stone fence at the borders of his land, to prepare it for planting and to benefit from its production.

This is his seventh cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good history of paying back his loans. He claims that Al Majmoua loans developed and  improved his business a lot and that his wife encouraged him to apply for Al Majmoua loans at the beginning.

He hopes to keep expanding his business more and more in the future, and to recruit people to help him in taking on more than one project at the same time.

loans.use: To build a stone fence at the borders of his land

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 34 year old hard working lady. She lives in Kisauni, Kenya with her family. She has two children and a husband. They live in a rental house with tap water and electricity. She has a grocery business which she has been operating for the last two years.
 
She has requested a loan amounting to ksh 10000 to buy sacks of oranges and mangoes. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of oranges and mangoes.

loans.name: Gulsifat

texts.en:
Gulsifat is 47 years old. She is divorced and has three children who are adults. She has always tried to provide her children with good living conditions, but it has been very difficult for her to earn money. Her ex-husband does not help her with money. Her children are adults now, but their incomes are small. 

Gulsifat can sew, and wants to organize a new business sewing women's dresses in the national style. With this goal, she took a course for women in how "To get ahead" and learned some business skills. Her children will help her with the business. She is asking for a loan of 1,700 USD to buy some sewing machines for the new business.  This loan will help her find a new source of income and in this way improve her family's living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy some sewing machines for her new business.

loans.name: Monhmandal

texts.en: Mrs. Monhmandal is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband, Erdenebat, aged 36 runs a business selling animal pelts in the local market. Her daughter Zolzaya, aged 15, studies at a specialty training school. The borrower has been helping her husband to run his business. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000MNT to purchase noodle making equipment in order to start her own business of producing organic noodles. She is a hardworking and well-experienced woman.

loans.use: to purchase noodle making equipment to start her own business of organic noodle producing

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Margaret is 17 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Margaret has been working hard to manage her business, which sells firewood. 

To help expand her business, Margaret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell, and will help Margaret generate greater profits. Margaret hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Margaret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pigs and goats to re-sell.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Annet is 24 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her salon, which sells hair products . 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy other kinds of hair products for the salon to attract more clients. This will help Annet generate greater profits and improve the business. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to open a boutique. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy hair products for the salon to attract more clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Lona Kuyani

texts.en:
Lona is a 42 year old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 6 and 20.  All of them go to school.
Lona runs a fish selling business, and has been doing so for 5 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is requesting a loan of 2000ssp to purchase fish and other things. Besides this business she has no other source of income.
In 5 years lona would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.
Lona says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
As a marriage parent of five children, Solita works hard to support her family.

She sells home products to customers in the Philippines. Solita is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Solita has sustained her business and utilized 30 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help attain her dream to build and expand her business with the goal of securing a good future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 48-year-old married man and father of three children.  His specialty is tailoring and sewing.  He has been in business since 1999. 

His business is going on just fine, but he needs an external push to help make sure he meets his customers' needs.

This will be Bassam's fifth loan through Al Majmoua.  Bassam is in good standing and has a fine pay back history.  His previous loans helped him diversity his product offerings.  He is seeking another loan for the same purpose.  

He hopes to expand and develop his business, to make sure that his family members have better, healthier and satisfying lives.

loans.use: to diversity his product offerings.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 42 years old.  She has four children whom attend school. They live together in Kisauni, Kenya with her husband.  

Her major monthly expenditure is school fees.

Gladys owns a grocery stall where she has earned a living for the past two years.  She seeks a loan of ksh.50000 to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 29 years old, married and has two young children.  Rosalyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling various items and goods to the people in her place. 

Rosalyn is requesting a loan to buy additional groceries like canned goods, candies, biscuits, coffee, soda and beverages, soap, shampoo and more. 

Through this loan, Rosalyn will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers in her store.  In the future, Rosalyn hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her store.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

Ma. Fe has been farming sugarcane for four years and earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.

She is working tirelessly to reach her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborer's salaries and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rona Jean

texts.en:
Rona Jean is 38 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rona Jean is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rona Jean has been raising pigs for 10 years and also she earns additional income by working in a general store.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her sugarcane.

loans.name: Monhzul

texts.en:
Monhzul is 36 years old and she lives with her husband and three children in her father-in-law's apartment in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 

Her husband Odgerel, age 39, is currently unemployed, stays home and takes care of their newborn baby boy, Telmen who is one year old.

Her daughter Zolzaya, age 19, goes to university and her son Gereltsetseg, age 10, attends a local school. 

Monhzul has been working in various fields over the years and has been on maternity leave.  Now she is starting her own food business in rental place on a hospital's first floor. 

She is requesting a 2,000,000MNT loan to purchase equipment and inventory for her new cafeteria business. She is a hardworking, positive and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and inventory for her new cafeteria business.

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Phelister is a 35 years old lady.  She is married with four children aged 8,10,12 and 14 who attend school; two boys and two girls.  They along with her husband live in Kisauni, Kenya, in a rental house.

Her major monthly expenditure is school fees and food. She owns and operates a charcoal stall.  She has requested a loan amounting of ksh.40000 to buy sacks of charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 37 years old and married with two children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, spices, snack foods, etc.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has run her general store for 10 years and earns an income from food vending.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, spices, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 30 years old, married with one child. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting squash for sale in the local community to earn a living.  She had been in business for over three years and earns 9,000PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC and has been a member since 2011.  Now she is requesting a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family.  She is married and runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Gina requests a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.  She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is a 55 year old married man from Ubay, Bohol. He has three grown children. He makes eyeglasses.  Jaime has been in this business for 20 years. It is his source of income.

Jaime is requesting for a loan to buy lens and frames for eyeglasses.  Through this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs to stay productive.

In the future, Jaime hopes to expand his business. He also wish to have another business.

loans.use: to buy lens and frames for eyeglasses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to resell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 34 years old and married with three children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a cucumber retail business to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than four years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. She has requested a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is 29 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than two years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like coffee, sugar and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like coffee, sugar and canned goods

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny de 30 años, soltera y con la responsabilidad de madre que le otorga su pequeña Arlieta de 3 años.
Posee una vivienda construida a base de madera la cual construyó con el fruto de su esfuerzo.Tiene por oficio las actividades agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao orgánico en una parcela que adquirió desde hace 7 años.Aprendió el oficio gracias a sus padres quienes desde niña la instruyerón en dichas labores.
Se siente a gusto con su trabajo puesto que siempre cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros del lugar ,quienes estan presentes en todas actividades colectivas que requiere el mantenimiento de cacao orgánico.
Actualmente se encuentra a mitad de la campaña productiva por el cual requiere contar como es de costumbre con jornaleros quienes espera la apoyen en el segundo deshierbo de campaña para el cual acude a su entidad financiera y asi contar con el capital necesario para poder contratarlos.Tiene como objetico a largo plazo la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble y posteriormente iniciarse en otro rubro económico como lo es la tienda de abarrotes .Para esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y contratar personal para el segundo deshierbo de la campaña agrícola.
texts.en:
Marleny, 30, is single and responsible as a mother to her 3 year old daughter, Arlieta. She has a wooden house built as a result of her efforts. She works in agriculture producing organic cacao trees in a plot of land that she acquired 7 years ago. She learned how to do this thanks to her parents who taught her since she was a child. 

She feels comfortable with her job because she can always count on the support from the local day laborers, who are present in all the collective activities required for the maintenance of organic cacao. She's currently in the middle of production which requires day laborers to help with the second harvest. This is the reason why she has approached her MFI to have the necessary capital for hiring day laborers. 

Her long-term goal is to build a house with solid and high-quality materials. She then wants to start another economic venture, such as a grocery store. At this time, she needs 1,000 PEN to hire personnel for the second harvest of her agricultural year.

loans.use: to pay for personnel.

loans.name: Linojo Group

texts.es:
Linojo
Es un grupo nuevo y está conformado por cinco integrantes mujeres ellas mismas eligieron el nombre del grupo y lo eligieron porque es el nombre de un té que ellas conocen y lo utilizan para remedios caseros. Doña Celedonia tiene 42 años de edad es una mujer soltera solo tiene un dependiente el cual es su papa. Doña Celedonia tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 15 años la inicio porque vivía solo con sus padres que ya eran personas mayores de edad para Doña Celedonia eran su responsabilidad cuidarlos y darles lo que necesitaban vieron muy viable establecer una tienda en la comunidad porque muchas veces las personas tenían que caminar mucho para poder comprar algo de comida, algún refresco o algo que se les antojara, solo que ahora Doña Celedonia platica: “Antes vendíamos muy bien ahora las ventas han bajado mucho pero porque ya otras personas también ya pusieron sus misceláneas” La señora Celedonia le preocupa esta situación porque actualmente tiene a su papá enfermo y si las cosas siguen a si el día que llegue a enfermar su papá no tendrá para sus medicamentos Doña Celedonia lo único que quiere es que sus ganancias aumenten un poquito solo para tener para los medicamentos de su papá el día que llegue a enferman, esta vez está solicitando el crédito para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes comprara leche, pan, huevo, azúcar, sal, refrescos, aguas, frituras, detergentes etc. Doña Caledonia y las otras integrantes están agradecidas con el crédito  porque podrán invertir sus Benita invertirá en guajolotes y alimento para los mismos, Maricela y Josefina invertirán en bonetería y Sofía invertirá en pollos.
texts.en:
Linojo is a new group made up of five female members who they themselves chose the name and they chose it because it's the name of a tea that they know and use for homemade remedies. 

Celedonia is 42 years old and is a single woman. She has only one dependent, her father. Celedonia has a grocery store which she opened 15 years ago because she lived alone with her elderly parents. It was Celedonia's responsibility to take care of them and give them what they needed. They saw that it was very viable to establish a store in the community because often people had to walk far to be able to buy food, drinks or snacks. Now Celedonia talks: “Before we sold a lot now sales have lowered by a lot because other people have also opened up corner shops”. Celedonia worries about this because now her father is ill and if things continue this way if the day comes that her father gets worse they will not have money for medication. The only thing that Celedonia wants is that her profits increase a little only to have money for her father's medicine for when he gets ill. 

This time she is requesting a loan to supply her grocery store. She will buy milk, bread, eggs, sugar, salt, refreshments, water, fried snacks, detergents etc... Caledonia and the other members are thankful for the loan because they will be able to invest it. Benita will invest in turkeys and feed for the turkeys, Maricela and Josefina will invest in a sewing supply store and Sofia will invest in chickens.

loans.use: to buy sugar, drinks, juices, salt, bread and milk.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Emelito

texts.en: Emelito is 21 years old and married with two children. He lives in Tukuran, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. To make a living, he operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. He has been with his business for over two years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. Emelito joined GDMPC in 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new motorcycle tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new motorcycle tires.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur in the Philippines. She owns a business selling crabs in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over three years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in2008, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional styrofoam. Jessica plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional styrofoam.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur in the Philippines She owns and operates a crab-selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over four years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. Zenaida joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional styrofoam. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional styrofoam.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago, de 38 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su primo. La actividad que realiza Santiago es el alquiler de servicio de Internet. Tiene su local establecido en su hogar y diariamente abre sus puertas para recibir a estudiantes y público en general , actualmente tiene 6 computadoras  a disposición de sus clientes quienes pagan un monto determinado por el uso del servicio. Trabaja solo y ocasionalmente le ayuda su primo. Lleva en este negocio 5 años y le va bien. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le ha permitido tener ingresos económicos sostenibles con los cuales puede pagar los gastos de su hogar y mejorar su situación financiera, lo que no le gusta de su trabajo es que la señal muchas veces sufre algunos contratiempos o fallas en la conexión perjudicando el rápido acceso a las páginas de internet , sin embargo no se amilana ante nada y sigue adelante, ahora espera mejorar la infraestructura de su local .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de madera, clavos, ocre para piso y algunos conectores eléctricos  con la finalidad de mejorar la red en su establecimiento,  a su vez agradece la ayuda financiera que le brinda MFP , para poder seguir cumpliendo sus metas.
texts.en:
Santiago is 38 years old, single, and without children.  He lives in his own house with his cousin.  

Santiago works renting internet services.  His business is set up in his house and every day he opens his doors to receive students and the public in general.  Currently he has 6 computers for use by his customers, who pay a determined sum to use the service.

He works alone, but sometimes his cousin helps him.  He has been with this business for 5 years and it is going well for him.  What he likes about his work is that it has allowed him to have sustainable income, with which he can pay the household bills and improve his financial situation.

What he doesn't like about his work is that often the internet connection slows or fails, which is detrimental to the fast access of webpages.  Nevertheless, he isn't daunted by anything and pushes forward.  Now he hopes to improve the infrastructure of his business.

At this time, he is asking for 2,000 soles ($775) to buy wood, nails, concrete dye, and electric cords with the aim of improving the internet connection of his establishment.  In turn, he is thankful for the financial help that MFP is offering so that he can keep fulfilling his goals.

loans.use: buy wood, nails, and electric cords.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Patricia Del Carmen habita en un barrio de Managua desde hace cuarenta y cinco año, es madre soltera con un hijo a su cargo, labora de secretaria con más de diez año de servicio para dicha institución del estado .Patricia del Carmen ha trabajado desde muy joven para sacar adelante a su hijo con el estudio universitario.  

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para pagar mensualidades  y comprar una computadora que le urge para poder realiza su tarea.

 Esto permitirá mejorar el nivel de vida para su familia. 

Esta muy agradecido con  Ceprodel  y kiva , ya que "dice: que aparte que se le atiende bien también son bajos los intereses, y quiere seguir siempre trabajando con la institución si dios le presta más vida para seguir adelante con sus sueños".
texts.en: Patricia has lived in a barrio in Managua for 45 years. She is a single mother with a son under her care, and she has worked as a secretary for more than 10 years for a government institution. Patricia has worked since she was very young to make headway so her son could go to college. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner CEPRODEL to pay tuition and purchase a computer her son can use for his homework. This will allow her to improve her family's living standards. She is very grateful for Kiva and CEPRODEL for the good service and low interest rates you're providing, and she wants to keep working with together in the future, God willing, to pursue her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for college expenses.

loans.name: Dúo Sembrando Con Amor Group

texts.es: Dúo Sembrando Con Amor.este dúo esta conformado por la señora Rogelia de 43 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos desde hace varios años, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos ya que el capital que tiene no le alcanza para comprar suficiente hilo para elaborar los tejidos ya que gracias a Dios sus clientes han aumentado considerablemente espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
This duo, "Sembrando con Amor" (Spreading Love), is made up of 43-year-old Rogelia.  She has worked making traditional garments for several years.

She is asking for this loan to buy raw materials to make clothing, since the money that she has isn't sufficient to buy enough thread to make the fabrics.  Thanks to God, the number of customers she has has increased greatly.

She hopes that you can help with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional garments.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Ángela vive en Guayaquil, tiene 35 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo cosméticos a sus amistades con el pasar del tiempo se dio cuenta que podría independizarce vendiendo sus productos. Aprovechó la oportunidad para vender a demás clientes y comenzo como vendedora de cosmeticos, ya que le gustaba lo que hacia. 

En la actualidad realiza su trabajo sola de 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 18:00 de la tarde, lo que más le compran sus clientes son perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc. Todo de uso personal.+

Lo que podría traerle dificultad en su negocio es el clima y la delincuencia, no está casada pero tiene un hijo de tan solo un año que no estudia aun, el cual es el esfuerzo para seguir adelante en lo que hace.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere siempre estan junto a su  familia y poder tener un bonito local bien ubicado para así poder dar empleo a otras personas que lo necesitan y de igual manera poder sustentar su hogar y recurrir con los gastos del mismo.
texts.en:
Ángela, age 35, lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business by selling cosmetics to her friends.  As time passed, she realized that she would be able to become independent by selling her products.  She took advantage of the opportunity in order to sell to other customers, and she started as a cosmetics salesperson.  She did this because she liked what she did.

She now works alone from 9:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening.  The things that her customers buy the most are perfumes, creams, and deodorants, etc.  They buy everything for personal use.

The things that could be trouble for her business are the climate and crime.  She is not married, but she does have a child who is only one and does not go to school yet.  Her child is what pushes her to get ahead in what she does.  

She wants to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, and deodorant.  In the future she always wants to be together with her family.  She also wants to be able to have a nice place that is well located.  This way she will be able to give employment to other people who need it.  She will also be able to feed her household and cover its expenses.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and deodorant.

loans.name: Jessica Maurixi

texts.es:
la Sra.Jessica vive en Guayaquil, tiene 30 años de edad. Ella antes de empezar su negocio se capacitó en un curso técnico y luego comenzó a vender sus productos a sus amigos. Le gusta ser muy cretiva e imnovadora en lo que hace.

Ella realiza su trabajo sola desde las 10:00 de la mañana hasta 17:00 de la tarde.
la dificultad que tiene es a la delincuencia y a los altos cosatos de los materiales que necesita para la elaboracion de sus mercaderías.

No esta casada, no tiene hijos, se mantiene sola y así lucha cada día para su sustento, y para poder seguir adelante. 

Quiere comprar con el prestamo fomix. Ella sueña con tener una familia con dos hijos,tener una casa terminada, poder tener un local comercial en el cual pueda distribuir sus artículos y poder dar empleo a la gente que lo necesite.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessica lives in Guayaquil and is 30 years of age.  Prior to starting her business, she underwent training by taking a technical course.  She later began selling her products to her friends.  Jessica enjoys being creative and innovative in her work.  

She works alone from 10:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.  Her main difficulties are dealing with crime and the high cost of materials that she uses in producing her merchandise.  Jessica is not married and has no children.  She only has herself to support, so she strives each day to get ahead.  

Jessica will use her loan to buy craft foam.  She dreams of having a family with two children and a finished house.  In addition, she wants to have a retail shop where she can sell her goods and provide jobs to people who need them.

loans.use: to buy craft foam.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil. El empezó un negocio de venta de calzado desde los 15 años de edad, la actividad la aprendió desde que era joven del papá. Esta elaboración de calzado la realiza solo y la comercialización o venta del zapato lo realiza con sus familiares.

El cliente tiene una discapacidad que es Poliomielitis es una enfermedad que destruye las neuronas, causa debilidad muscular, afecta principalmente al sistema nervioso y esto le impide movilizarse mejor.

El cliente se encuentra separado de su esposa pero tiene a su cargo a su hijo que estudia en una escuela fiscal, su hijo es su esfuerzo para seguir trabajando y no darse por vencido.	

El cliente solicita de este préstamo plantillas, telas, hilos, para así obtener mayores ingresos de dinero y para mejorar el cambio de vida tanto de él como la de su hijo.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. He started a shoe sale business at the age of 15 since he learned this trade from his father. The borrower works alone making shoes and then markets and sells his goods with the help of his relatives.

The borrower has a disability as a result of poliomyelitis, a disease that destroys the neurons and causes muscular weakness. It primarily affects the nervous system and impedes any improvement in mobility.

The borrower is separated from his wife, but he takes care of their son who is attending a state school. His son gives him the strength to continue working and not quit. He is requesting a loan to buy insoles, fabrics, and thread. This will enable him to generate more income so that he can improve the way of life for himself and his son.

loans.use: to buy insoles, fabrics, and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil, tiene 37 años de edad. Empezó su negocio vendiendo Yambal, después vendió ropa, analizando un poco el mercado opto por vender productos de temporadas ya que eso le genera mas ingreso, le gusta la venta y relacionarse con las personas.

Ella hace su trabajo sola y empieza desde las 10.00 de la mañana y termina a las 20:00 de la noche, el negocio es de venta de artículos de temporadas.

Su dificultad es la enfermedad que tiene el cual no le permite en ocasiones laborar ya que su enefermedad es que una paciente PVVS(paciente viviendo con VIH), y la delincuencia. Es soltera y tiene una hija de 10 añitos  ella estudia en escuela fiscal.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar camisas, globos, pistolas de agua para el carnaval ya que ya es temporada de playa. Su sueño es que se pueda mejorar su salud y que DIOS le dé la oportunidad de seguir viviendo y poder compartir junto a su hija , poder tener una casa propia , tener una cadena de locales de artículos de temporadas y asi dar empleo a otras personas con la misma situación que ella.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil; she’s 37-years-old.  She started her business selling Yanbal products and then started to sell clothes.  Analyzing the marketplace a bit she decided to sell seasonal goods because that generates more income.  She likes selling and relating to people.  She works alone starting at 10 in the morning and ending at 8 at night.  Her business is seasonal goods sales.   Her challenges are the illness she has which sometimes keeps her from being able to work; the illness she has is PVVS (patient living with HIV) and crime.  She’s single and has a ten-year-old daughter attending public school.

She wants to use the loan to buy shirts and squirt guns for carnival since the beach season has begun.  Her dream is that her health improves and that God gives her the opportunity to continue living and sharing with her daughter.  She’d also like to have her own house and to have a chain of seasonal goods shops to employ other people in the same situation as her.

loans.use: to buy shirts, balloons and squirt guns.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío de 27 años esta casada con José de 29 años, y juntos tienen un niño de Frank de 9 años . Ambos poseen una vivienda construida a base de material noble donde comparte sus vivencias familiares.Inicialmente se dedicaba a la producción integral de cacao orgánico en parcelas arrendadas para posteriormente  dedicarse a la venta de frutas al por mayor.Lleva casi 5 años en el negocio y con el tiempo ha logrado captar clientes en la ciudad capital de su región quienes por su puntualidad le realizan constantes pedidos como plátanos, mango, piña y papayas. De esta manera es como ha logrado consolidar su actual negocio como un buen sustento de su economía familiar.Le agrada su labor puesto que viaja constantemente para supervisar que las frutas lleguen en buen estado a su destino lo cual implica dedicarle el tiempo completo. No obstante al transportar sus productos por carreteras no asfaltadas son propensas a detenerse en algunos tramos a causa de los derrumbes y demás problemas que comúnmente poseen los caminos rurales.
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apunta apuntan a la compra de un vehículo propio para así seguir desempeñando su labor y reduciendo los costos que le generan el pago a tranportistas.Requiere para esta ocasión contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de frutas regionales al por mayor tales como platanos , naranjas , aguajes , entre otros para asi poder obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rocío is 27 years old and is married to José, who is 29 years old.  Together they have a 9-year-old son, Frank.  They have a house made of good-quality materials, where they share their family experiences.

Initially, she worked growing organic cocoa on rented plots.  Subsequently, she started to work selling fruit wholesale.  She has been in the business for almost 5 years and with time has been able to gain customers in the capital city of her area.  Due to her punctuality, she constantly gets orders such as bananas, mango, pineapple, and papaya from them.  It is in this way that she has been able to establish her current business as a good source of income for her family.  She likes her work, since she constantly travels to make sure that the fruit arrives in good condition at their destination.  This means that she dedicates all of her time to her work.

However, due to transporting her goods via unpaved roads, they often are detained in certain places due to landslides and other issues that are common in rural roads.

Her long-term goals point towards buying her own vehicle.  In this way, she will be able to continue carrying out her work and reduce the cost that is generated by paying drivers.

At this time, she needs 2,000 sols ($775) to buy local fruit wholesale, such as bananas, oranges, aguaje, and others to in this way obtain better profits.

loans.use: buy fruit.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Lorena vive Guayaquil, tiene 31 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo AVON y YAMBAL  pero después cambio de negocio y empezó a vender zapatillas y con este negocio pudo seguir adelante ganando así mejores ganancias para los gastos de su casa, le gusta vender artículos.

Ella realiza su negocio sola desde 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 18:00 de la tarde vendiendo sus zapatillas. Le teme a la delincuencia ya que ella gana mucho y teme que le roben.

No está casada, no tiene hijos por lo tanto se mantiene sola pero espera en un futuro tener su  propia familia. Quiere poder casarse y tener hijos y trabajar para ellos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar zapatillas poder tener suficientes ingresos y tener su casa propia y una boutique para poder exhibir sus productos y dar trabajo a personas que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Lorena, age 31, lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business selling Avon and Yambal products.  However, after changing her business she started to sell shoes.  She was able to get ahead with this business by earning better income for the household expenses.  She likes selling goods.

She works in her business alone from 9:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening selling shoes.  She is afraid of crime.  This is because she earns a lot, and she is afraid they will rob her.

She is not married, and she has no children.  For now, she supports herself.  However, she hopes to have her own family in the future.  She wants to be able to get married, have children, and work for them.

She wants to use the loan to buy shoes.  She wants to be able to have enough income and to have her own house.  She wants to have a boutique in order to display her products and to give work to people who need it.

loans.use: to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Jessenia Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Jessenia vive en Guayaquil, tiene 24 años de edad. Empezó su negocio vendiendo bajo pedido a los amigos el producto en fomix, después pudo elaborar almohadas y además compro para conseguir más clientes y poder distribuir sus productos.

La dificultad para el cliente son los ladrones y las personas que no cancelan. La cliente no está casada, tiene un hijo de 2 años.

Su sueño es seguir junto a su hijo y poder tener una casa propia, crecer su negocio aportar a su economía que no les falte nada y ponerle ánimo a su vida. Por eso quiere invretir en el prestamo con fomix y almohadas para mejorar sus ingresos y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jessenia, age 24, lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business selling ‘fomix’ [craft foam] products by order to her friends.  Later, she was able to make and buy pillows in order to get more customers and to be able to distribute more products.

The difficulties that she has are thieves and people who do not pay.  She is not married, and she has a two year old child.

Her dream is to continue together with her child, to be able to have her own house, to grow her business, to contribute financially so they are not in need, and to brighten up her life.  Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy fomix and pillows in order to improve her income and to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy 'fomix' [craft foam] and pillows.

loans.name: Bella Matilde

texts.es:
La Sra. Bella vive en Guayaquil, tiene 49 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio preparando meriendas bajo pedidos a sus amistades después le recomendaron que porque no hacia comida para los demás clientes o personas, fue cuando se animo y comenzó a vender meriendas y postres, le gusta mucho lo que hace.

Este trabajo lo realiza sola desde las dos de la tarde hasta las diez de la noche, teme mucho a la delincuencia pese que su venta es muy efectiva y teme que le vayan a robar.

Ella no está casada, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, y estudia en una escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo quiere poder comprar más utensilios para su negocio como una parrilera, cocina, viveres para hacer las comidas. En el futuro quiere seguir adelante junto a su familia, tener un lindo restaurante de comida, dar trabajo a los demás y poder contribuir en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Bella, 49, lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business making lunch to order for acquaintances.  They then suggested she start to make food for other customers and people and she was encouraged to do so; she started to sell lunches and desserts and she likes what she does very much.  She works alone from two in the afternoon until ten at night.  She’s very concerned about the crime rate because her sales are very good and she fears being robbed.

She’s not married but has a 10-year-old son who attends public school.  She wants to use the loan to buy utensils like a grill and stove and to buy foodstuffs to make the meals for her business.  In future, she’d like to continue moving forward with her family and to have a nice food restaurant to employ others and be able to contribute towards her home’s economy.

loans.use: to buy grills, cookware and raw materials.

loans.name: Lidia Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia vive en Guayaquil, tiene 36 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo planes de celular y luego decidió por el negocio de venta de recargas del saldos a telefonos celulares; ya que eso se vendía mas actualmente vende agua, colas, jugos. Recalca que le gusta el negocio de ventas.
	
La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia ya que por su barrio es muy peligroso, no está casada y no tiene hijos se mantiene sola y sola lucha día a día por seguir adelante.

Con la ayuda de Dios quiere casarse tener hijos, con el préstamo quiere comprar saldo para recargas y bebidas para vender, y asi poder tener un local comercial en el cual pueda colaborar con empleo a otras personas, tener su casa propia y que su futura familia no sufra económicamente.
texts.en:
Lidia, 36, lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business selling mobile phone calling plans and then decided to go into the business of selling mobile phone recharges because they sell better; she also sells water, colas and juices.  She stresses that she likes working in sales.  The difficulty she has is crime because her neighborhood is very dangerous.  She’s unmarried and has no children.  She’s her only source of support and strives daily by herself in order to continue forward.  With God’s help she hopes to marry and have children.  

She wants to use the loan to buy phone recharges and beverages to sell so she can have a commercial enterprise where she can hire others, have a house of her own so her future family will not suffer economically.

loans.use: to buy more phone recharges and to buy more beverages.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
Juan  vive en Guayaquil, tiene 47 años. Empezó su profesión como taxista hace 11 años atrás, recalca que le gusta su trabajo y que asi puede llevar bien con los pasajeros y así poderles contar mis vivencias.
El trabajo lo realiza solo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, trabaja en un taxi amarillo de una cooperativa.

La dificultad que tiene son los cambios de clima, la delincuencia teme que le roben. El cliente tiene una enfermedad que se está haciendo tratar día a día.

No está casado, no tiene hijos, es un hombre soltero que cada día lucha para así mismo. Con el préstamo quiere poder comprar accesorios para el carros y poder renovar la licencia que esta a punto de caducar, y asi con eso en el futuro poder tener un carro nuevo en el cual pueda trabajar y poder generar trabajo a las personas que lo necesitan, tener una familia y sobre todo una casa propia.
texts.en:
Juan, 47, lives in Guayaquil.  He started his profession as a taxi driver eleven years ago.  He stresses that he likes his work and gets along well with passengers and is able to share his life story with them.  He works alone from seven in the morning until seven at night; he works in a yellow cab belonging to a cooperative.  The difficulty he has is weather changes and crime; he fears being robbed.  He has an illness that he’s receiving daily treatment for.  He’s unmarried and has no children.  He’s a single man who strives daily for himself.

He wants to use this loan to buy auto accessories and to renew his driver’s license that’s about to expire.  In future, he’d like to be able to have a new car for work and to be able to generate employment for people who need it, to have a family and above all a house of his own.

loans.use: to renew his driver's license and to buy more spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Dúo Gracias Y Bendicion Group

texts.es: Dúo Gracias y Bendicion, este grupo esta conformado por el señor neftali de 30 años de edad, el se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años ya que de esta forma el a podido sacar adelante a su familia, el ya ha tenido un credito anterior el cual cancelo sin ningun atrazo, ahora el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de arina,huevos,margarina,tec, para la elaboracion de pan y luego venderlo, espera que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: This group consists of Teresa and Neftali, a 30-year-old man who makes a living baking and selling bread. He has dedicated himself to this activity for a number of years and in this way has made headway for his family. He had a previous loan that he paid off without any delay. Now he is requesting this loan to purchase flour, eggs, margarine and butter to bake bread to then sell. He hopes once again you can help him with a loan.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, margarine and butter to make bread.

loans.name: Mercedes Beatriz

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes vive en Guayaquil, tiene 35 años de edad. Ella empezó esta actividad haciendo dulces como: cocadas, maní dulce para sus hijos en casa, pero con el pasar del tiempo junto a su esposo se especializaron y ahora venden estos dulces en los buses, escuelas, colegios y desea seguir adelante.

Este trabajo lo realiza junto a la ayuda de su esposo (quien aparece en la foto) de 7:00 de la mañana hasta 19:00 de la noche. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia en los buses y el permiso del municipio para vender mas generalizadamente en la ciudad.

Tiene dos hijos uno de 8 años de edad y el otro de 4 años de edad y ambos estudian en una escuela fiscal.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando con su esposo en la venta de dulces, tener una casa propia y contribuir en la economía de su hogar, tener vendedores para la distribución de sus dulces y sobre todo disfrutar junto a su familia dándoles un mejor vivir a su hijo. Por eso con el prestamo quiere comprar harina, leches, y otra materia prima para hacer mas dulces y asi cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 35 years old and live in Guayaquil. She has two children, one of which is 8 years old and the other is 4. Both go to a public school. 

She started this business making sweets like cocadas [coconut candies] and candied peanuts at home for her children. However, with the passage of time, she started to specialize in this with her husband and now they sell these sweets on buses, in schools and high schools. She wants to continue doing this. 

She carries out this work together with her husband (pictured) from 7:00 in the morning until 7:00 at night. Difficulties that she encounters are crime on the buses and acquiring a permit from the municipality to sell more broadly in the city. 

Her dream is to continue working with her husband selling sweets, have her own house, and to contribute to her household finances. She would also like to have salespeople to distribute her sweets to. Above all she wants to enjoy her family and give her child a better life. This is why she wants to buy flour, milk, and other basic ingredients to make more sweets and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase flour, milk, and other basic ingredients.

loans.name: Luz De Campo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Luz de Campo está conformado por 10 integrantes, nueve mujeres y un hombre. Madres y padres responsables con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Malpaisillo es un lugar que se caracteriza por sus artesanías y es agrícola. Estas personas han demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo estudiar una carrera, por falta de recursos económicos. Lo cual luchan diarios para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
La  coordinadora del banco comunal es Tomasa del Socorro, y tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía como productos elaborados de barro, como casa de barro. Adornos de cocina, floreros, mariposas de adornos, alcansillas,  saleros, pimenteros. La rutina de trabajo de Socorro es salir a trabajar de forma ambulantes unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, con más productos artesanales. Para que en un futuro no muy  lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Luz de Campo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The Luz de Campo group consists of 10 members: nine women and a man. They are parents who are responsible for 20 children. They are natives of Malpaisillo, which is located in the western part of the country and is known for its handicrafts and its farming. These people have demonstrated responsibility with making their payments on time. Sadly none of them could study for a degree because of a lack of resources, so they fight every day to provide a better future for their children. The coordinator of the group is Tomasa, who makes a living selling crafts like items made from clay, kitchen decorations, vases, decorative butterflies, and salt and pepper shakers. Her work routine is to go out for some 10 hours a day offering her products to steady customers and would-be clients. She plans to use the loan as working capital to stock her business with more crafts so in the not-too-distant future she can have more income. Luz de Campo is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have means to a decent living.

loans.use: to purchase craft supplies like clay items, kitchen decorations, vases, decorative butterflies, and salt and pepper shakers.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is 35 years old, married and has two children attending elementary school. She sells fruits and vegetables to gain profits for her family. She aims to improve her sales; that is why she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy tomatoes, eggplant, fish and dressed chicken to resell for profits. This will surely help increase her sales capacity. Additional revenue will be used for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, eggplant, fish and dressed chicken to resell for profits.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 40 years old and married with four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a crab business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over five years and earns 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2008, and she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional styrofoam for the crabs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional styrofoam for the crabs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 42 years old and married with two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over five years and earns 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC this year, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 43 years old and married with three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Nora owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over three years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nora has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Delfina works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Delfina is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Delfina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 28 years old and has one child. Her husband is a farmer, and they live happily in a rural community. Due to financial difficulty, she aims to improve her small variety store by increasing her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. Since she doesn't have enough capital, she is asking for an additional 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, rice and vegetables to sell. She believes that her loan will help her to make an improvement in the business, and she's hoping that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, rice and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 54 years old and married with one child. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over eight years and earns 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee and canned goods.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 23 years old and single. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over two years and earns 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011, and she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Eddy Moises

texts.es: Eddy, un joven de 25 años de edad, es originario de la ciudad de Managua, soltero , el estudiante de la carrera de Administración de Empresas . Él se gana la vida trabajando en una zona franca, el dinero que gana lo invierte en sus estudios y aportar con los gastos de su hogar. Él está en su último año de la carrera y necesita pagar el curso de titulación que es para lo cual utilizara el financiamiento. Se siente muy satisfecho de culminar sus estudios superiores ya que ha sido un camino lleno de mucha sacrificios para cumplir una de sus metas más anhelada, le agradece a su madre por ayudarlo con lo poco que tenía  para que el lograra estudiar en la universidad.
