Uno de sus proyectos es tener su propia empresa y desarrollarse plenamente como profesional y continuar especializándose con un Post grado para fortalecer a un más su título.
texts.en:
Eddy is 25 years old and comes from the city of Managua. He is single and is pursuing a degree in Business Administration. He earns a living working in an Export Processing Zone. The money he earns is used to pay for his studies and living expenses. He is in the last year of his degree and he needs to pay for the accreditation course required to earn his degree. He will use the loan to pay for the course.  

He is very pleased to be completing his higher education, which has been one of his most desired goals. It has been a journey filled with many sacrifices. He thanks his mother for helping him with the little she had to enable him to enter university.

One of his plans is to have his own business and to fully develop as a professional. He would like improve his qualifications by continuing on to specialize with a Post-graduate degree.

loans.use: to pay for an accreditation course.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is 47 years old. She lives in Gardabani District with her husband, Tengiz, her 15-year-old son and her retired father. Nunu requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business startup, but without any success. Her loan request was always rejected because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the monthly salary of Tengiz, who is working as a driver for a private company, and the small pension of Nunu’s father. It is hardly enough for food for a four-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nunu requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Nunu will purchase a milk cow and pigs. She will milk the cow and make dairy products for selling. Also, after several months, she will sell piglets with a price markup at the local market. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow and pigs.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 5 years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of  20,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, shampoo, soap, rice and other items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, shampoo, soap, rice and other items to sell.

loans.name: Segundino

texts.en:
Segundino is a 57-year-old married man from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. He is a fisherman, and he is also engaged in making fishing boats. Segundino is applying for a loan to buy materials for making fishing boats, like plywood, nails and paint. With this, he will be able to make more fishing boats, which he can sell to the fisherman in his place.

In the future, Segundino has hopes of making his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials for making fishing boats, like plywood, nails and paint.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 50-year-old Palestinian married man and the father of eight children. He has been working in selling used hardware since 21 years ago. In 2007, he started his own business to improve his living conditions and increase his income to provide his family a better life. 

Mohamad is applying for his third loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business capital with used hardware to expand his business. He buys old used items and sells them to the recycling market at a good price. This is a hard and tough business, but Mohamad has grown used to it.

Mohamad is looking forward to expanding his business in the future through renting a piece of land and spreading all of his merchandise on it in a well separated way to make his items clear to sell to specific dealers.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with used hardware items to expand his business.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 24 years old and has one child. She is raising hogs to sell upon achieving their desired weight. She has been in her business for over a year in order to acquire profits. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy feed for the hogs' sustenance. This will help improve sales and income as well. 

Someday, she hopes to keep raising healthy hogs and save funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs' sustenance.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She lives in Kisauni, Kenya, a town in coastal Kenya. She lives in a rental house using solar energy and tap water. She has a charcoal stall where she buys and sells firewood.

She has for a loan amounting to 30000 KES to buy sacks of charcoal and firewood. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She stopped her education at grade 8 but she says she is good at managing business. She is married and has four children aged between six and 21; they are all in school and live at home. 

For the past eight years she has been selling soft drink and cold water in her community; she has a lot of customers and makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drink and cold water for her business. She hopes to improve her business and send her children to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drink and cold water for her business

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a 39-year-old married man with five children aged between two and 14 years old. He owns a retail shop selling industrial goods and has been in operation for two years earning an income of KES8,000.

He has a first loan of KES100,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to buy sugar, fresh bread and soft drinks for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay back the loan and plough back into the business. His dream is to invest in business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fresh bread and soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 38 years old, is married and has three children.

Divina works hard to provide for her family. She runs an electronic re-loading store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more loads to sell.

Divina has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her electronic re-loading store for six years and also earns an income from direct selling Natasha, Avon and SME.

Divina aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more loads to sell at her electronic re-loading store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Dúo El Socobal Group

texts.es:
DUO EL SOCOBAL:
El duo el Socobal esta formado por la señora Marta de 23 años de edad ella vende comida en su colonia y maíz ya que cuentan con sus clientes, y que ademas de darles buen servicio les dan buen producto, ella se dedica a esta activida ya que es la unica forma que tiene para el sostenimiento de sus familia como también de apoyo a sus esposos y la educación de sus hijos,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad, y para la compra de maiz, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
"El Socobal Duo": 

One of the members of El Socobal duo is Marta, who is 23 years old and sells food and corn in her neighborhood, as she has her customers there. In addition to give them good service, she also gives good products. She is engaged in this activity because is the only way she can support her family as well as her husband and the education of her children. 

She is requesting this loan to buy staple food products and corn. She hopes to get the help for the loan she requested.

loans.use: to purchase food products and corn for sale.

loans.name: Hamest

texts.en:
Hamest is from Noramarg village in the Ararat region of Armenia. She is married and lives with her husband (in the photo) and father-in-law.

Together with her husband, Hamest runs a farm, which currently includes a cow, a pig and 20 chickens. She cultivates tomato as well as owns a plot of land where she grows peaches, apricots, cherries, plums and apples.

Hamest works hard to gather a good harvest. Her husband helps her to sell the gathered harvest in the local market to provide income. This agricultural income is hardly enough for covering her family's daily costs.

Hamest has applied for this loan to buy two bulls and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help her to expand her agricultural business and gain additional income.

The loan is very important for Hamest and her husband to gain additional income and ensure a better life for their family.

loans.use: to buy two bulls and forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria's group consists of 12 members.  Their names are Berlinda, Mary, Portia, Mary, Patience, Elizabeth, Hannah, Augustina, Charles, Benedicta, Mary, and Victoria.  They sell bread, sugar, biscuits, maize, jewelry, cooking utensils, tiles, charcoal, eggs, cloth, earrings, cutlery sets, vegetables, and fish.

Victoria is 38 years and has been selling cooking utensils for 15 years.  She is married to Emmanuel, a 40-year-old businessman.  She buys from a market in the capital and sells in the Teshie community.  With this 500 GHS loan, her 2nd from ID Ghana, she will buy more goods to sell to customers. 

The entire group needs an amount of 5,050 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more bowls, plates, cutlery, cups and other cooking utensils to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a 57-year-old, married woman and a mother of four grown up children. She is from CPG, Bohol, Philippines. Sylvia has generated income by running a sari-sari, or variety store, for more than 10 years. Sylvia hopes to expand her business but lacks the capital to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, such as rice, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, seasonings, chips, snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this additional stock she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as rice, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, other seasonings, chips, snack foods, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah's group is comprised of 6 hard working women.  Faridah is 19 years old and lives in Fortportal, Uganda.  For the past 3 years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her vegetable business.

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy additional foods, such as raw bananas, to expand her business.  This will help Faridah to generate greater income and profits.  Faridah hopes that in the future she will become self-reliant. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ashrf

texts.en: Ashrf is a 25-year-old, single man who lives in a rented house in Hodeida, Yemen.  He works very hard and is completing his studies with great effort and dedication.  Recently, he is employed at an airport. He works around 12 hours a day with a low salary.  He said that without sacrifice, there is no reward and if one wants to get ahead, you have to do what you can.  He applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy bedroom furniture.  With this loan, he will live in comfort.  He hopes to own a house.

loans.use: to buy bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista's group is comprised of six hard working women. Teopista is 18 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells sugar, rice and flour. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to look after her family and to add more commodities to her shop to help Teopista generate greater profits. Teopista hopes that in the future she will be able to better meet customers' needs. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to look after her family and buy more commodities, such as sugar, rice and flour, to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old. He is married and is a very hard working gentleman. 

He practices horticultural farming and has been in this business for the past ten years. He also practices dairy farming. He is very hard working.

He is requesting a loan of 20,857 KES to construct another greenhouse. Someday he hopes to expand his horticultural business and be successful.

loans.use: to construct another greenhouse

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 39 years old, married and has been blessed with six children. 

She runs a tailoring shop and has been in this business for the past six years. She also relies on her husband's salary. She is very hard working, as she has to provide for her family. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has expanded her business.

Someday she hopes to be a rich woman and own plots of land. She requires a loan of 42,727 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a 40-year-old married man. He has three children aged from two years to fourteen years. He describes himself to be a sociable and faithful man. 

He operates a workshop, where he provides generator repair services. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by his five family members for household activities. 

His business goal is to expand his business within five years. Previously, Oliver managed to successfully pay off his loan of Kes 150,000.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories for her and her husband's tricycle along with paying for maintenance. Her earnings were a big help in meeting their personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells frozen and processed products such as hot dog, stuffed meat and ham. She also has a loading station and a food stall for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to pay for maintenance on their tricycle unit. She will also use the money to buy frozen foods and ingredients for her food stall. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes to have her own house for her family and dreams of having a harmonious relationship with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a mat weaver from CPG, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of eight children. 

Vilma is asking for loan to buy materials for mat weaving ,like straw and romblon "native palm" and to buy additional piglets to raise.

In the future, Vilma hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children and for reinvestment into the same business.

loans.use: to buy materials for mat weaving, like straw and romblon and to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Jumar

texts.en:
Jumar is now 21 years old and still single. Due to financial difficulty, he didn't pursue a college education. Despite this, he helps his parents in generating income to support the education of his younger brother and sister. 

He used to operate a motorcycle transport business in their village to generate income. He planned to continue operating his motorcycle to gain income but he did not have enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and the spare parts needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. 

He hopes that this loan will be a great help for him to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and the spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Sukses Jaya Group

texts.en:
Ida is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ida lives in the village "Pinang Ranti" in the east of Jakarta. Ida was born 53 years ago. She is already divorced and has four children who are attending college and senior high school. Ida sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been for over 10 years. She sells some Muslim fashions, house dresses, blouses, and children clothes.

With the help of this loan, Ida and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Ida will use her share of the loan ( 2,000,000 IDR) to buy batik ( traditional clothes of Indonesia) from another town "Solo", and cover the transportation fees.
She dreams of having a restaurant and to see her first daughter become a nurse.

loans.use: to buy batik (traditional clothes of Indonesia)  and cover the transportation fees.

loans.name: Swalihati's Group

texts.en:
Swalihati's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Swalihati is 17 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past 4 years Swalihati has been working hard to manage her outside catering business.

To help expand her business Swalihati has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil and other products to run the business better. This will help Swalihati to generate greater profits and increase the income level of the family.  Swalihati hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the standard of the business.

Swalihati is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and other products for her catering business.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 48-year-old Palestinian married man, father of four children. He has been working at manufacturing aluminum windows, doors and displays since 1982. In 2000, he started his own business to make sure that his family's income will be increased to cover their expenses and needs.
Mostafa has applied for his first loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for his son's school fees and buy necessary tools to manufacture aluminum products.
He is optimistic about this loan, and is hoping that one day he will expand his factory and move it to a larger location to deliver new requests.

loans.use: To pay for his son's school fees and buy necessary tools to produce aluminum items.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha (with her husband) is a married woman. She has seven children aged from 19 years to 34 years. She describes herself as a determined and hard working woman . 

She operates a retail shop, where she sells household items. Her business is located within a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as having insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the Kes 26,500 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used by her family members and the surrounding community. 

Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She has managed to pay off a previous loan of Kes 20,000.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María es una mujer de sesenta y cinco años, soltera y propietaria de un pequeño taller de costura en general, el cual está ubicado en su casa, realiza costura por encargo y reparación de ropa, pero su punto fuerte es la elaboración de juegos para cama. Inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia desde hace cuarenta años ya que desde muy joven aprendió el oficio y tenía deseo de independizarse. Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio y comprar materia prima tales como telas, hilos, botones, encaje entre otros materiales. Ella quiere mejorar su negocio y en un futuro planea realizar reformas su casa. Ana María se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para superarse en la vida.
texts.en: Ana María is sixty-five years old.  She is single and owns her own sewing workshop, which is in her house.  She does sewing to order and repairs clothes but her best skill is making bedclothes.  She started the business under her own initiative forty years ago.  From a very young age she learned to sew and she wanted to become independent.  She is applying for this loan to invest in her business, to buy basic materials such as cloth, threads, buttons and lace, among other things.  Ana wants to improve her business and in the future she would like to make changes to her house.  Ana is very grateful for the opportunity she is being given to move forward in life.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as cloth, threads, buttons, elastic and trimmings, for making clothes.

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Maria vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como docente de un centro educativo  se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, trabajadora con muchos deseo de superación, Tiene tres hijos.

Claudia  solicita un crédito  a kiva y Ceprodel   para utilizarlo en la  compra de útiles escolares y libros que utilizara sus  hijos y pago de matricula 
  
Para el enriquecimiento de su aprendizaje ya que las metas de doña Claudia  es ver a sus hijos echo un profesional en el futuro

otra parte del crédito lo utilizara para reparar su casa. que se encuentra en deterioro y que con mucho esfuerzo ha ido reconstruyendo
texts.en:
Claudia Maria lives in the city of Managua. She works as a teacher in an educational institution. She is a very determined, hard-working woman with a great personal desire to improve. She has three children.

Claudia is asking Kiva and Ceprodel for a loan to buy school supplies and books for her children and to pay for their enrollment. She wants to improve their learning since one of Claudia's goals is for her children to become professionals in the future.  

She will use the rest of the loan to undertake repairs on her home which has deteriorated and which she has been putting a lot of effort into repairing.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and repair her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of his studies.

loans.name: Gloria Melida

texts.es: Gloria Melida es una mujer de treinta y ocho años, soltera y mamá de dos hijos de 18 y 22 años de edad, el menor de ellos es estudiantes de secundaria, ella es comerciante de mercadería en general  como ropa juvenil y de adultos, prendas, cosméticos, zapatos, entre otros productos que le encargan, este negocio lo inicio desde hace quince años, ella vende de manera ambulante, compra a distribuidores que importan los productos. El negocio lo inicio con la ayuda económica de sus hermanos y poco a poco ha ido mejorando. Solicita el crédito con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio y surtir sus productos. Planea mejorar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar el futuro de sus hijos. Gloria Melida agradece la ayuda que le brindan a los pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobres como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Gloria Melida, 38, is single and has two children, ages 18 and 22, the youngest of which is in high school.  She is a merchant and sells goods in general, such as youth and adult clothing, cosmetics and shoes, along with other items she receives orders for.  She started her business 15 years ago and works as a street vendor, purchasing from distributors who import the products.

She started the business with economic help from her brothers and over time it has improved.  The loan she is requesting is to buy more merchandise in an effort to improve sales and her income so she can provide her children with a better future.  Gloria Melida is grateful for the help given to small business owners with low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothing, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María Inés es una mujer de cincuenta y seis años soltera y madre de cinco hijos de 24, 27, 29 y 33 años de edad todos independientes y quienes brindan ayuda económica a María Inés. Es una mujer, trabajadora responsable, con ganas de superación personal, el cual desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para ganase el sustento de cada día. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega el cual está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Maria es propietaria de una pulpería ubicada en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos de consumo básico. El negocio lo inició hace quince años con la ayuda de su esposo y desde que enviudó ha tenido que trabajar duro para sacar adelante el negocio. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio, ya que dentro de sus planes esta fortalecer la pulpería para en un futuro remodelar su casa.
texts.en: María Inés is 56 years old.  She is single and a mother to five, now independent children, aged 24, 27, 29 and 33 years.  They all provide María with financial support.  She is a hard-working and responsible woman with a desire to do better in life.  From a very young age she has had to work to earn her daily bread.  María is originally from the department of Chinandega, which is in the west of the country.  She has her own grocery store in her house where she sells all sorts of basic products.  She started the business 15 years ago with the help of her husband.  Since becoming a widow she has had to work hard for the business to keep moving forward.  She is applying for a loan to invest in the business as one of her plans is to strengthen it in order to renovate her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, such as beans and rice, oil, everyday products such as soaps, detergents and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth Katherin

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una joven de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Elizabeth no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Elizabeth trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, Elizabeth trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Elizabeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir y uniformes escolares para su venta, de esta manera Eizabeth podrá atender a mas clientes e incrementar sus ingresos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que poco a poco pueda lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 20, is single and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings.  She is a kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who is determined to improve her situation; unfortunately, due to lack of income and the need to work to cover expenses, Elizabeth could not get a teaching degree as she would have liked to.  In her free time she enjoys watching movies and cooking the delicious "Carapulcra" stew to share with family.

On her own initiative, with a lot of hard work and dedication, Elizabeth started her own business selling women's, men's, and children's clothing.  She works every day for approximately ten hours and enjoys what she does.  She believes business is going well because of her low prices and good customer service.

Elizabeth is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she is able to buy clothing and school uniforms to sell.  This means she will be able to attend to more customers and increase her income, so that little by little she can reach her goal of having her own shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing and school uniforms.

loans.name: Emma Nataly

texts.es:
Emma es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeña hija de 6 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeña, ya que ella es madre y padre para su hija; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Emma no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con su pequeña y en algunas ocasiones como buena chinchana cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Emma trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Emma se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra del uniforme y los útiles escolares de su pequeña hija, ya que en pocos días iniciará sus estudios primarios y necesita contar con los materiales necesarios, así pues Emma seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindarle una buena educación a su pequeña y en un futuro no muy lejano desea tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Emma, 22, lives in the city of Chincha with her six-year-old daughter, who she loves very much and is her main motivation in life.  Emma is a kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who dedicates all her efforts to proving for her daughter, since she is both mother and father to her.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of resources and the need to work, she was unable to get an accounting degree as she would have liked to.  In her free time she enjoys playing with her little girl and sometimes cooking a delicious "Carapulcra" stew to share with family.

On her own initiative and dedication, Emma runs a small business selling women's, men's and children's clothing.  She starts work very early in the morning and works about 12 hours a day.  She enjoys her work and believes it is going well because of her low prices and good customer service.

Emma is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy a school uniform and supplies for her daughter who will start elementary school soon and needs school materials.  Emma will continue working and making every effort to give her daughter a good education.  In the not-too-distant future she wants to buy her own home.

loans.use: To buy a school uniform and supplies for her daughter.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umanzi is grateful for the previous loan. Her business grew within a short period of time. She has now decided to include charcoal in her stall that is why she has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to buy charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Jhoanna Smith

texts.es:
Jhoanna es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiata, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Jhoanna no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar vóley con sus amigas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su Madre, Jhoanna trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de postres y dulces, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto trabajando y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Jhoanna se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña vitrina mostradora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder exhibir mejor sus postres, de esta manera Jhoanna seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jhoanna, 20, lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with her small son, who she loves very much and is her main motivation in life.  She is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who works hard to provide for her son, since she is both mother and father to him.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and the need to cover expenses, Jhoanna was unable to get an accounting degree as she would have liked.  In her free time she enjoys playing volley ball with friends and sometimes cooking a delicious "Cau Cau" stew to share with family.

Through a lot of hard work and enthusiasm, and thanks to support from her mother, Jhoanna works as a field hand on a farm in the city.  On weekends, she also has her own business selling desserts and sweets.  She starts work very early in the morning and works about ten hours a day.  She enjoys her work and believes it is going well because she is responsible and provides good customer service.

Jhoanna is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them she will be able to buy a small case to display her desserts which will be very beneficial.  Jhoanna will continue working and making every effort to reach her goal of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: To buy a display case.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. They live in CPG, Bohol, Philippines. Wilfreda is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business.
Wilfreda dreams of expanding her business and saving money for the schooling of her children as well as to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 39 years old and a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Marlon, a businessman and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 50,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Yolanda hopes to expand her business and have more sources of income. She dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en: Justin is a 42-year-old married man. He has 3 children ranging in age from 6 to 15 years old. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a service business where he provides security services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located within a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He will use the KES 41,500 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by his five family members. His business goal is to buy more water tanks within 5 years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for his family of five.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is happy and grateful for the loan you gave to her and it has helped improve her business. With the additional income her child was able to enroll in a private educational academy. She purchased printing/copying papers and cartridges for the business with the first loan.
Regina would like to increase the operations of the business. She is applying for a loan of 64,500 Kenya shillings to buy a larger photocopying machine. She looks forward to being a supplier instead of selling the items as a retailer.

loans.use: to buy a larger photocopying machine.

loans.name: Rosa Escarleth

texts.es:
Rosa Escarleth de  32 años de edad, casada con tres hijos de 10.7,2 años de los cuales los dos mayores están estudiando. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Rosa en sus ratos libre disfruta mucho de la compañia de sus hijos, les prepara comida típica de la región como sopa de leche, cajetas. Rosa se caracteriza por ser una mujer, trabajadora, responsables; que desde temprana edad tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos de su familia. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera por falta de recursos económicos. Pero le hubiera gustado estudiar trabajo social. 
Gracias a su ganas de superación personal. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de colchones elaborados artesanalmente, y de diferentes tamaños de cama como unipersonal, matrimonial, de cuna. En la foto la observamos con un colchon unipersonal. Actividad que la desempeña desde hace 4 años, de forma ambulante y en su casa, la rutina de trabajo de Rosa es de unas 9 horas diaria ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. Actividad que la disfruta mucho, ya que ha sido el sustento de sus hijos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de más colchones. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Rosa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rosa Escarleth, 32, is married and has three children, ages 10, 7 and 2.  The two oldest are in school.  She is from León, in the northern part of the country.  In her free time, Rosa enjoys spending time with her children and preparing regional food such as "sopa de leche, cajetas" (caramel).  Rosa is known as a hard-working, responsible person who always has helped cover household expenses since she was very young.  Unfortunately, she was unable to get a degree due to lack of resources, but she would have liked to become a social worker.

Thanks to her determination to get ahead, she runs a business selling hand-made mattresses in different bed sizes: double, twin or crib.  In the photo we see a twin size mattress.  She has been in business for four years, working both as a street vendor and from home.  Every day Rosa works about nine hours offering her products to fixed and eventual customers.  She enjoys her work as it is a source of income for her family.

The object of the loan is to buy more mattresses so she can increase her income in the near future.  Rosa is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people with low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have decent jobs.

loans.use: To buy mattresses.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 43 years old, is married and has four school-age children. She and her husband plan to educate their children and give them a better life. Due to financial difficulty, Emelinda is engaged in selling fruits and vegetables to supplement her husband's income. She planned to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell but she did not have enough capital. 

Therefore, Emelinda is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. She believes that someday she will improve her business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pablo Francisco

texts.es: Pablo Francisco tiene treinta años de edad es padre de un niño de ocho años que cursa tercer grado de la escuela primaria, él se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte como taxista de la comunidad en la que vive, inicio esa actividad desde hace nueve años, él era cadete y tuvo la iniciativa  de comprar su propia unidad de trabajo, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para poder comprar llantas y repuestos para su vehículo y así dar un mejor servicio a su clientela. Su meta futura es comprar otra unidad de trabajo. Pablo Francisco esta muy agradecido con los inversionistas kiva por el gran apoyo que brindan a los países pobres como Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Pablo Francisco is thirty years old and is the father of an eight-year-old child who is in the third grade of primary school.  

He works as a taxi driver for the community where he lives. He started working this way nine years ago. He was a junior and he took the initiative of buying his own taxi unit. 

He is now asking for a loan to buy tyres and spare parts for his vehicle and in this way provide his customers with a better service.

His future goal is to buy another taxi. Pablo Francisco is very grateful to the Kiva investors for all the help they give to poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy tyres and spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a retail store  where she sells household items such as cooking fat and oil, margarine, sodas, juices, etc. Her business is located within a viable business and her primary customers are local residents.

Lilian describes her biggest business challenge as being insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her four family members. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM after successfully managing to repay a previous loan of KES 60,000.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kitsao is grateful for the loan you lent to him. He purchased materials, sewing threads, needles, etc. from the loan he received. The business has improved and he was able to repay the loan before the expiry of the schedule.

He is therefore applying for another loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy sewing machines and fabrics for the business. This he believes will help him to more reliably provide education for his children.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and fabrics for sewing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopier

loans.name: Nancy Margarita

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposo  y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que con el apoyo de su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Nancy se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Computación, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar deliciosos platillos y postres.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Nancy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de crianza de y venta de cerdos, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede  hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella cree que le va bien por la dedicación y cuidados que les da a sus animalitos.
Nancy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mas cerdos, ya que desea aumentar y mejorar la raza de sus cerdos para criarlos y venderlos a un mejor precio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar su carrera y conseguir un trabajo adecuado para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 20 year old young woman. She lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with her husband and young son, whom she loves and who is her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. With her husband's help, she puts all of her effort into getting her family ahead. Thanks to her hard work, Nancy is studying the technical major of computer science. In her free time, she likes to cook delicious meals and desserts. 

On her own initiative, with much hard work and dedication, Nancy works in her small business raising and selling pigs. She works every day starting in the early morning hours and can work for around 8 hours. She believes that it is going well for her because of the dedication and cafe she gives her animals.  

Nancy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered she will be able to buy more pigs. She wants to increase the number and improve the breed of the pigs she has and sell them at a better price. This way, she can keep working and striving to achieve her dream of graduating and getting a good job to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gorret's Group

texts.en:
Gorret's group is comprised of four hard working women. Gorret herself is 16 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her fresh food stall. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock of fresh food such as sweet potatoes, and will help her to generate greater profits, boost the business and increase her family's income. She hopes that in the future she will be able to be more productive. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fresh food to sell such as sweet potatoes

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, José no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas que deseaba, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Verde para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, José trabaja como recepcionista en una empresa de servicios de su ciudad, él brinda servicios de atención al público y puede trabajar por un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, adicionalmente José tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de patos.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un pequeño corral para sus aves, él comprará madera, palos, cañas, plásticos y bebederos para mejorar su corral, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional y al lado de su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
José is a 20 year old young man. He is single and lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with his parents and siblings. He is a friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who really wants to get ahead.  Lamentably, due to a lack of financial resources and because he has to work to help his parents, José hasn't been able to study computer programming like he wanted, but he would have really liked to. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and on occasions he cooks a delicious arroz verde to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with much hard work and dedication, José works as a receptionist at a service business in his city. He serves the public and can work approximately 8 hours a day. In addition, José has a small business raising and selling ducks.

José is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he can build a small pen for his birds. He will buy wood, posts, rods, plastic and water dispensers to improve his pen. This way, he can continue working and striving to achieve his dream of going to college and getting ahead with his family.

loans.use: to build a pen.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 40 years old, married and has five children.  She owns a tailoring shop and has been in business for the past twelve years.  She also owns rental houses and was previously employed in a firm. 

She describes her business as very busy and her customers are very loyal.  She is very hard working.  Through the many training sessions from Faulu Kenya, she has learnt so much and that include saving for future purposes.  Someday she hopes to channel this to other lines of businesses.  She requires a loan of 20,857 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 33 year old married woman.  She has 2 children, who are 1 and 7 years old.  She describes herself to be an honest and humble woman. 

She operates a retail business where she sells water.  She has been involved in this business for 2 years.  Her business is located within a viable business and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate water for selling to her community.  She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water tank which will be used for storing water for selling to over ten thousand customers.  Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her second loan after managing to pay a previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000.  She plans to purchase bales of firewood for resale.  Mwanamisi dreams of expanding her business to wholesale firewood selling to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bales of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is grateful for his previous loan.  It helped him improve her business.  He has applied for a loan amounting to KSH 50,000 to buy sacks of rice, wheat flour, sacks of sugar.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, wheat flour, sacks of sugar

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en: Mwanangeni is grateful for the loan she is currently repaying with little problems.  She furthermore requested a loan to pay school fees for her children. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Abunzubumw Group

texts.fr:
Vestine est membre du groupe ABUNZUBUMWE, elle est marié , agé de 26 ans et a 2 enfants .le plus agé a 8 ans et le moins agé a 3 ans. selement 1 va à l`école.elle sollicité ce crédit pour louer le champs à cultiver, achat des angrais chimiques et payer le main d`oeuvre.

elle n`attend aucun difficulté pour rembourser cet emprunt. la stratégie pour la croissance de son affaire est de pratiquer l`agriculture moderne et ses ambitions est de dévenir l`agriculteur proffessionnel.
pour sa fammille , c`est le bien être et Eduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Vestine is a member of the Abunzubumw group. She is 26 years old, married and the mother of 2 children, the eldest of whom is 8 years old and the youngest, 3. One of her children attends school. She is requesting this loan to rent a field to cultivate, to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers. She does not expect to have any difficulty in repaying this loan. Her growth strategy for her business is to use modern farming techniques and her ambition is to become a professional farmer. As for her family, she would like to ensure their well-being and take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to rent a field to cultivate, to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of food (beans, rice, palm oil, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Haguruka Ukore /rbv Group

texts.fr:
Jean Pierre est membre du groupe HAGURUKUKORE il est âgé de 32 ans , il a 3 enfants .le plus âgé a 6 ans et le moins âgé a 1 ans. seulemet 2 vont à l`école.. ses niveau d`étude est de 6 eme primaire.

il sollicite ce crédit pour louer le champs à cultiver et acheter les angrais chimiques. il n`attend aucun difficulte à rembourser. ses stratégies pour la croissance de son activité est de pratiquer l`agriculture moderne. ses ambitions pour l`affaire est de dévenir l`agriculteur proffessionnel et pour sa famille c`est le bien être et construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre is a member of the Hagurukukore group. He is 32 years old and has 3 children, the eldest of whom is 6 years old and the youngest, 1. Two of his children go to school. He himself has 6 years of primary level education.

He is requesting this loan so that he can rent a field to cultivate and buy chemical fertilizers. He does not expect any difficulty in repaying this loan. His strategy for the growth of his business is to use modern farming techniques. His business ambition is to become a professional farmer and concerning his family, he would like to ensure their well-being and build his own home.

loans.use: to rent a field for cultivation and buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 70 kgs of chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Girintege Group

texts.fr:
Evelyne fait partie du groupe Girintege et  habite à Cibitoke. Elle a  30 ans et est mariée Ernest, un fabricant de briques.  Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de 1  à  8 ans, dont 2 étudient.
Elle prend soin d'un élève membre de sa famille élargie.

Elle fait le commerce de  vin de banane  depuis 10 ans et de manioc sec.

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour la préparation du vin de banane  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  avoir sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Evelyne is a member of the Girintege group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 30 years old and married to Ernest, a brick maker. The couple have 4 children aged between 1 and 8 together, two of whom attend school. She is also taking care of a student, who is a member of her extended family. 

Evelyne has been selling banana wine and dried cassava for 10 years. This is her 2nd loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of bananas with which to make banana wine for resale, so that she can earn more money. In the years to come, she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas with which to make banana wine.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en: Masika is grateful for her previous loan as it was helpful in boosting her business. She is requesting another loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to pay school fees for her children. She is grateful for the opportunity for her children will study with little disturbance.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Matilda's Group

texts.en:
Matilda, Doris and Peter are the members in this group. They sell soft drinks, soap and firewood respectively. They have been together from 2011 to date. 

Matilda is a 42-year-old trader who is married to Emmanuel, a 50-year-old trader. They have one child. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and doing very well with her business.
 
She operates a drinking bar from Mondays through to Sundays. She has been doing this business for 15 years now. Without ID Ghana’s training on savings she would not have made it this far. 

This is her third loan and she needs GHS 1,000 to buy more drinks to sell to her customers. 

They need a total amount of GHS 1,950 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more coca-cola, fanta, fruit drinks and amstel malt and sell to customers.

loans.name: Majed Group

texts.en:
Rasha is the featured borrower of Majed's group. She joined with her other group members to apply for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Rasha is a 29-year-old married woman, mother of three children (two girls, Lina, 9 and Maria, 4, and a son, Husein, 1 month). She has been working as a tutor for four years to help her husband in making their living and covering their expenses. 

Her loan will be used to pay for her children's school fees and buy necessary diesel fuel to keep warm during the winter season. She loves education and educating people and that's why she hopes to open a special tutoring school in the future. Rasha is the woman seated on the right.

Hala is a 29-year-old married woman, mother of two boys (Samir, 6, and Majed, 2). She has been working since a year ago to help her husband in making their living. Through the loan, Hala will pay her son's school fees. She is seated on the left.

Rodayna is a 22-year-old single woman who has worked in a clothes-selling shop since five years ago. Through the loan, she will try to start a small business of her own in order to open a big clothes selling shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees and buy necessary diesel fuel to keep warm during the winter season.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is grateful for her previous loan. It was of much help to her. 

She has now approached for a loan amounting to KES 40,000 to build her house. She hopes this will uplift her living standards.

loans.use: to build her house.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Sia. She is married and has two children, age 11 and 14 years. 

In 2006, Sia established her provision and alcoholic and soft drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband with domestic affairs. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Sia requires a loan in order to buy beer, stout and soft drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 550,000. 

In the future, Sia plans to expand the shop to accommodate more customers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy beer, stout and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rayisomzita Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADINA est responsable du groupe RAYISOMZITA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 02ans et quelques mois. Deux(02) vont à l’école et elle a  03 personnes en charge.

 Mme vend du sucre, du sel et du savon depuis 11 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les grandes boutiques de son secteur. Ses clients sont celles qui font les jus, les galettes et la bouillie. 

Elle veut s’acheter 05 sacs de sucre de 50kg, 05 sacs de sel de 25kg. 

Elle épargne ses bénéfices afin de renforcer. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité en ouvrant une boutique et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madina is the representative of the RAYISOMZITA group. She is doing well. She is the married mother of three children aged 2 to 13, two of whom go to school. She is supporting three people.

Madina has been selling sugar, salt and soap for eleven years. She buys her stock at the large shops of the area. Her customers are those who prepare juices, flat cakes and porridge.

She wants to buy five 50 kg bags of sugar, and five 25 kg bags of salt.

She saves her profits to bolster her business. She plans to expand her activity by opening a shop, and she wants to support her children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy five 50 kg bags of sugar, and five 25 kg bags of salt.

loans.name: Jose Apolinario

texts.es: José de 40 años de edad habita junto  a su familia, su esposa y sus hijos es un hombre muy emprendedor que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser el principal responsable de que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día. Por sus cualidades sus vecinos lo admiran porque a pesar delas adversidades de la vida siempre se ha trabajado y ha sido responsable con sus hijos y su esposa. José se dedica a la labor de ser agricultor cultiva los principales granos básicos de la zona como son maíz y frijol, y así va sufragando las necesidades de su hogar. José desea seguir cultivando y vendiendo es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como: Semillas, Abonos, Fertilizantes, pesticidas etc. Desea contar con la ayuda y de ante mano deja claro que espera saldar la deuda antes de lo previsto.
texts.en:
José, age 40, lives with his family, his wife, and his children.  He is a very enterprising man.  He has always been known for being the one who is mainly responsible for his household’s daily bread.

His neighbors admire him for his virtues.  In spite of life’s adversities, he has always worked, and he has been responsible for his wife and children.

José is a farmer.  He grows the main basic grains in the area like corn and beans.  That is how he covers the necessities for his household.

José wishes to continue growing and selling.  That is why he approached INTEGRAL to request a loan.  He will use the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and pesticide, etc.  He wishes to have the help.  He leaves it clear in advance that he hopes to get out of debt earlier than anticipated.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like seeds, manure, fertilizer, and pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Hasnaa

texts.en:
Hasnaa, a 43-year-old married mother of three, has owned a convenience store for four years and is working hard to develop and expand her business as much as she can to earn more income. She is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to expand her enterprise and increase her merchandise diversity by moving to a larger store.

Hasnaa is very optimistic that this loan will attract new customers which in turn will enhance her family's social and financial situation.

loans.use: To move to a larger store.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is taking out another Kiva loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to boost her business. Her dream had always been to have a well-supplied general store in order to be able to generate more income and thus be able to have a better quality of life for her and her whole family. With her effort, work and dedication, she has succeeded, reaching her goals without any type of problem. Today, Asha has the shop she dreamed of and she is requesting this loan in order to be able to supply it with drinks, food products, vegetables, milk and more. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to supply her store with stock such as drinks, food products, vegetables and milk.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija has been in business for years, running a charcoal store that is well stocked. She is a person who stands out on account of her desire to work and succeed through her business. She always strives to achieve success so as to help her family. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal so she can satisfy her customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for this opportunity, as it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en: Bibi is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 25,000 to buy more bundles of handbags and clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding her retail shop to a boutique. She thanks Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of handbags and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Migena

texts.en:
Migena is requesting a loan to repair some doors and windows and a loan of 50,000 Albanian Lek will be enough to achieve that.

Migena, in her thirties, is an Egyptian woman who is married and has two children who are attending public school. They live in a major city in southern Albania in their community. While her husband has a job and works every day, she has been a stay-at-home mom for years now since there were no work opportunities for her. Nevertheless, Migena has been enjoying taking care of her family, so far.

“I wish I had a job so I could provide financially for my family, yet, what I have been doing all these years,is been more fulfilling to me and I wouldn’t change that for anything else,” she said smiling.

loans.use: to repair the doors of their family house

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is a 47-year-old married woman, mother of one child. She has been working in the agriculture business for eight years as an additional income business, to increase family's income and improve their living standards. 

Montaha has a cow which is her only business and source of livelihood. She works at selling milk on daily basis to make a daily income.

She is applying for her third cycle loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to exchange her present cow for a small one since the present one has been consumed to the maximum. She will buy another one to increase her production and income.

Montaha is dreaming of having a big farm in the future, that will sure develop her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to replace her present cow and buy a new one

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli is from Stepanavan town. She lives with her husband and son and jointly with them, Leyli is involved in agriculture. They keep livestock which currently includes 2 cows, 2 pigs, 20 chickens and 2 colonies of bees. Leyli also owns a plot of agricultural land where she grows nuts, apples and pear trees. The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local markets. 

The main income of the family comes from agriculture so Leyli would like to expand it. She needs some financial support to purchase a tractor and start cultivating land. This will enable her to grow different types of vegetables and will significantly increase her income. So she has applied for this loan to pay for a tractor.

She hopes that with the help of this loan she will be able to improve her agricultural business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a tractor

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah, a 38-year-old married mother of five, has been operating a food stall for the past 10 years. She also practices farming. A God-fearing, humble and hardworking lady, she describes her business as thriving. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become financially stable.

Lonah is requesting a loan of 20,857 KES to buy more oranges, bananas, lemons, tomatoes, maize and beans. She hopes to be a rich and independent woman.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, lemons, tomatoes, maize and beans.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Hardworking and committed to his work, Kenneth, 33 years old, has owned a chemist (pharmacy) for the past three years. Kenneth describes his customers as very loyal and understanding. He also practices farming.

Kenneth is requesting a loan of 32,298 KES to buy a stock of pain killers, sanitary towels, cough syrups and antibiotics. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money for future purposes. Someday he hopes to own a big farm and be a millionaire.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of pain killers, sanitary towels, cough syrups and antibiotics.

loans.name: Bernice's Group

texts.en:
Bernice's group is made up of four members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2010. Their names are Borkor, Bernice, Henrieta and Joshua and they sell goods such as maize (corn), fabrics and other provisions. ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Bernice is a 32-year-old trader who is a single parent with two children. She has five years experience and works from Monday to Saturday selling materials which are used to make ladies and children's dresses. She is constantly working to improve her business capital. This is her third loan with ID-Ghana and she is requesting an amount of 400 Ghana shillings (GHS) to buy more goods for her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of 1,550 GHS for business expansion and to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more materials to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 23 years old and married. He owns a video shop and has been in business for the past two years. He also owns a retail shop. He describes his business as very busy. He is very hardworking, trustworthy and honest. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has increased his profits, and this has enabled him expand his business. 

Someday he hopes to be a successful businessman. He requires a loan of 37,513 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy two television sets.

loans.use: to buy two television sets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dry-cleaning machine.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice has requested a third loan to help her pay the school fees for her daughter, who is in her fourth year in the secondary school. Her business is doing well, and she is still in the process of expanding it. She hopes to have educated family members who can help her run her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child and to purchase more cooking oil, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Dukore/kigeyo Group

texts.fr:
Innocent( le deuxieme à gauche dans le photos) est membre du groupe DUKORE/ KGY. Il est marié et a 50 ans. il a 6 enfants, le plus agé a 25 ans et le moins agé a 10 ans. parmi ses enfants 4 vont à l`école.son niveau d`éducation est de 6 eme primaire. il sollicite cet emprunt pour louer les champs à cultiver, acheter les fumier et les engrains chimiques , acheter les semences ainsi que payer le main d`oeuvre. les difficultes attendus de non remboursement sont les suivant:
-mauvaise condition climatique, et Epidémie Agricole

les stratégies pour la croissance de son affaire sont d`être ponctuel avec la saison et d`utiliser les engrain chimique et les fumiers pour avoir une bonne récolte.

ses ambitions sont de moderniser ses agriculure et de respecter les récommandation des Agronomes
les ambitions pour sa famille sont de scolariser ses enfants et d`assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Innoncent (second from the left in the picture) is a member of DUKORE / KGY Group. He's 50 years old, married, and has 6 children. The eldest is 25 years old, the youngest is 10. Out of them, four attend school.

Innoncent has a 6th grade education. He's seeking this loan in order to rent fields to cultivate, buy manure and chemical fertilizers, buy seeds, and pay for labor. The difficulties foreseen in repaying the loan are poor climatic conditions and crop epidemics. 

His strategies to grow his business are to be timely with the season and to use chemical fertilizers and manure to obtain a good harvest.

He ambitions to modernize his farming practices and respect the recommendations provided by agronomists. Regarding his family, his ambitions are to send his children to school and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: rent fields to cultivate

loans.name: Dutezimbere Ubuhinzi No. 4 Group

texts.fr:
FAUSTIN est membre du groupe DUTEZIMBERE UBUHINZI No. 4 , il est âgé de 36 ans et a 2 enfants. le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 6 ans. ce deux enfants vont à l`école.il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les angrais chimiques et payer le main d`oeuvre.il n`attend aucun difficulte pour rembourser.

ses stratégie pour la croissance de son activité est de demander d`autre credit pour accroitre son business.
ses ambition dans le business est d`être le producteur des farines de maïs et pour sa famille,c`est eduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Faustin is a member of the Dutezimbere Ubuhinzi No. 4 group. He is 36 years old and has 2 children, the eldest of whom is 10 years old and the youngest, 6. Both of his children go to school. He is requesting this loan in order to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers. He expects to have no difficulty in repaying the loan. His strategy for growth is to request more loans so that he can increase his business. His business ambition is to become the main producer of corn flour and, as for his family, he would like to ensure that his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timber and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 31-year-old wife and mother of two school-age children who lives with her family in Kisauni, Kenya. She stays in a rental house with solar power and tap water. Her major monthly expenditure is the payment of school fees. She owns a food kiosk, which is an important source of income for her and her family. 

Jane is seeking a loan amounting to 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy soft drinks and cakes for her kiosk. She is very grateful for this help.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and cakes for resale.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is 47 years old. She is married and lives in Kareli District with her husband, Grigol, and two children, who go to school. Iamze requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a hectare of agricultural land, where haricot nut trees and cherry trees are grown. Besides thhis, her husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Iamze requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Iamze will purchase a milk cow. After purchasing a milk cow, she plans to produce dairy products and increase the income of the family. A small part of the loan will be used to cultivate the land for sowing seeds. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and cultivate the agricultural land.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a young and hardworking family man aged 25 years old, married to Wanjiru who is a housewife. He is a father of a one-year-old child. He learnt about KADET LTD through a credit officer who is s regular customer in his fruit store. He operates a fruit stall where he specializes in bulk selling of bananas to small scale traders.


He has acquired a first loan of KES. 30,000 which will facilitate him in purchasing a variety of fruits for sale. He hopes to use anticipated proceeds to enlarge his  busy stall.

His hopes and dreams are to raise his family's living standard as well as grow his business to a large scale outlet.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits for resale

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is involved in agriculture. He keeps 2 cows, 6 calves and 10 chickens. Arsen gets milk, which he uses in cheese production. Then he sells the cheese and other milk products in the local markets and gets income. This income is hardly enough for covering family's basic expenses, so it is very difficult for Arsen to save money for the expansion of his farm. 

Arsen has applied for this loan to purchase three bulls and forage for feeding them. This will enable him to expand his agricultural activities and gather higher income.

Arsen hopes that with the help of this loan he will be able to sustain his family and ensure a better future for his family. Arsen is from Urut village and lives with his wife and 28-year-old son.
