loans.use: to pay for three bulls and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase broiler hens, feed and drugs.

loans.name: Basam

texts.en: Basam is a 26-year-old married man, has three children, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a taxi. He saved a small amount of money and borrowed additional money from his relatives to buy the taxi. He works hard to provide his family expenses. He has been offering taxi transportation services to his clients. He applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas nace con la idea de crecimiento que todas las miembros tienen, ya que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto que todas hacen.
La Sra.  Elisa es una de las miembros, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y que lucha por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan. Ella es modista y también tiene una despensa con todo lo que sus clientes necesitan para la casa. Gracias a sus trabajos y al apoyo de su familia y su grupo esta saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, y también insumos para su despensa, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) was born with the idea of growth that all of the members have, as they want to help their families by means of the work as a whole that they all do.

Elisa is one of the members who is a very hardworking person and who fights for her family to be able to give them everything they need.  She is a dressmaker and also she has a small grocery store with everything that her customers need for the home.  Thanks to her work and to the support of her family and her group she is getting ahead.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of cloth, thread and also supplies for her small grocery store, so that in this manner she can continue with her work as she has been doing it and thus help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and supplies for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Lisy

texts.es:
Maria es una vendedora excelente, le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio, ya que sus ventas cada vez estan en mas ascenso. Gracias al crédito anterior con Kiva pudo comprar mas joyas y cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes le habían hecho y también tener mejor variedad para ofrecerles. este muy agradecida por la ayuda que recibió, pues le fue de mucha ayuda.
Solicita nuevamente del crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de más joyas, para poder seguir creciendo como vendedora, y poder seguir ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
María is an excellent saleswoman. Her business is thriving, since sales are continuously increasing. Thanks to her previous loan with Kiva, she could buy more jewelry and deliver all the orders her customers had made. She could also offer more variety. María appreciates the help she received, since it was very useful for her.

She is requesting a loan again, to invest in buying more jewelry in order to continue to grow as a saleswoman and continue helping her family as she has done so far. She appreciates this new opportunity, which will be of great help for her.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 45-year-old wife and mother of four children from Lambwe, Kenya. Her children are aged 18, 16, 14 and eight years old respectively.

Jane has been operating a small green grocer's stall along Homabay highway for the last 15 years, with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is now taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more vegetables to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to support her parents and her family.

She has a dream of expanding her business into a large one.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy electronics spare parts and items like TVs. for sale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon  is 27 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school.  He lives in the town of Koboko  in Uganda. For the past eight years, Simon  has been working hard to manage his retail store, which sells sugar, flour, rice, and other items. 

To expand his business, Simon is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which he will use to stock more goods such as cooking oil and sweets. This loan will help Simon  to generate greater profits and expand his business to the wholesale level. Simon  hopes that in the future he will be able to open a big shop. 

Simon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Simon  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is involved in cattle breeding. He keeps livestock, which currently includes 12 cows and 120 sheep. 

Ruben works hard to sustain his family, which consists of his wife and son. As cattle breeding is the only source of income for Ruben, it is very difficult for him to cover his family's basic costs and save money for feeding the livestock. So, he has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This will enable him to continue his work and he will be able to sustain his family. 

Ruben waits for your financial support and hopes that this loan will give him an opportunity to keep his livestock.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Cristian Noe

texts.es: Cristian, tiene 24 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio del Negrito Yoro con su familia. Hace dos años que Cristian, se ha dedicado al cultivo de sandia  y le ha dado buenos resultados. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 15,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de insumos como abonos para mejorar el cultivo y para pago de mano de obra. Su objetivo es incrementar la producción para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristian is 24 years old, married, and has one child. He and his family live in the town of Negrito Yoro.

For the past two years, Cristian has been growing watermelons and has achieved good results. Whatever he produces is sold at the local market. He is requesting his third loan from ODEF in the amount of 15,000 HNL. The proceeds will be invested in supplies, such as compost, so that he can improve his crop. He will also pay for labor.

Cristian’s goal is to increase his production so that his family can move forward and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his watermelon crop and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Anabel de 26 años de edad vive junto a su feliz familia su esposo y sus hijos. Es una mujer con diversas cualidades entre ellas servicial, honesta, humilde y muy trabajadora, se caracteriza porque en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día, siempre lo ha hecho así y hoy más que nunca no se rinde por sus hijos que son un mayor ilusión en la vida y lo que la impulsan a seguir adelante. Anabel es agricultora de los principales granos básicos de nuestro país, maíz y frijol es lo que ha hecho toda su vida, desea tener los recursos necesarios para esta próxima cosecha que se acerca es por eso que se visitó INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y comprar insumos agrícolas como: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, u otros. Espera contar con la ayuda solicitada así podrá tener una abundante cosecha y seguirá dándole una buena calidad de vida a élla y su familia.
texts.en:
Anabel, age 26, lives with her happy family, her husband, and her children.  She is a woman with diverse virtues among which are being helpful, honest, humble, and very hard-working.  She is known for always bringing home the daily bread.  She has always done so and now, more than ever, she does not give up because of her children.  They are a great joy in life, and they drive her to get ahead.

Anabel is a farmer, and she grows grains that are basic to the country, corn and beans.  She has done this all of her life.

She wishes to have the needed resources for the coming harvest, which is getting closer.  That is why she visited Integral in order to request a loan.  She will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and others.  She hopes to have the requested help.  This way she will be able to have an abundant harvest, and she will continue giving herself and her family a good quality of live.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizer, pesticides, and others.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells the traditional corn and cassava dough, banku, in Ayensudu, near Elmina. Aba has received no formal education. She is a widow and has five children. Aba has been selling her banku recipe for many years now. She is responsible for paying to support herself and her children and save for their future. 

Her loan will be used to buy more corn and cassava to prepare her banku recipe. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her banku-making enterprise and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy more corn and cassava to prepare her banku recipe for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 34-year-old, married woman. She has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a rental house with solar power and tap water. 

She owns a clothes business where she sells second-hand clothes. She has approached Yehu Microfinance Trust with a loan amounting to KES 20,000 to buy bundles of clothes. She is grateful for the opportunity and hopes this will boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fusena

texts.en:
Fusena sells pineapples and watermelons in and around Ayensudu, near Elmina. Fusena has received no formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mechanic in the area. 

Fusena has been selling pineapples and watermelons for some time now. She is responsible for helping her husband take care of their family’s expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of fruit to sell in the market. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her fruit-selling trade and possibly expand into selling an increased variety of local fruits to meet customers' seasonal demands.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of fruit to sell in the market.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 47 years old, married and blessed with six children between 28 and 11 years old. She owns a retail shop selling industrial goods and has been in the business for 12 years, earning an income of KES. 8,000.

She is now requesting her first loan of KES. 35,000 with KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to pay school fees for her school-going children and also add more stock of tea leaves, and washing detergents to sell.
The anticipated profits from the business will be used to pay the loan. Her dream is to venture into a new business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and add tea leaves and washing detergents to retail shop stock.

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
Perpetuo Socorro,  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que su actual directora Maria contacto con la asesora y decidieron formar un grupo, hoy se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto  en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Maria se dedica  a la  venta de comida en su copetín, ella comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y apreciadas por sus clientes y así es que está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y el día de mañana tener un gran restaurante o salón donde poder ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para sus alimentos, como ser carnes, verduras, condimentos, y demás para poder seguir dando una buena comida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Perpetuo Socorro” is the name of an outstanding group of women that was formed in the city of Itá, thanks to its current director, Maria. She contacted an advisor and then decided to form a group. The group is now working on its fourth loan cycle of the program in a cooperative and unified manner.

Maria sells food at her snack bar. She says that she generates very good sales since her foods are very rich and well-appreciated by her customers. As a result, she is able to move forward and help her family. Her goal is to continue working until one day she is able to have a large restaurant or a banquet hall where her customers will be more comfortable.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies for her snacks such as meat, vegetables, condiments, and other items. This will enable her to provide good food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy building materials like iron, corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house to live in.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells cooked rice in Ayensudu, near Elmina. Grace received a middle school education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. Grace has been selling cooked rice for some time now. She is responsible in helping her husband pay their children's school fees and taking care of other general family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity of rice and other ingredients necessary to cook and sell rice in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop her food preparation business further.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of rice and other ingredients necessary to cook and sell her rice in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for cultivation and buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Swali

texts.en:
Swali is 48 years old and lives in Koboko, Uganda. He is married and has 6 children,  4 of which are currently in school. For the past 30 years, Swali has been working hard to manage his livestock. 

To help expand his business, Swali has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy animal feed, and that will help Swali to generate greater profits and improve his family’s standard of living. Swali hopes that in the future he will be able to start a butcher shop.

Swali is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Swali who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es: Jose, tiene 36 años de edad, soltero, tiene un hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de la Masica, Atlántida junto a su madre. El tiene 15 años de administrar una cafetería en uno de los institutos del municipio, cuenta con la ayuda de una empleada quien elabora varia comida como ser pastelitos de carne, baleadas, tajadas con carne, refrescos, jugos, galletas, churros, etc. Sus clientes son los alumnos del colegio. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo es que de 25,000 lempiras con el cual va surtir de refrescos y jugos para su negocio. El espera que su negocio crezca y obtener más ganancias para cubrir con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old, single, and has one child. He lives with his mother in a neighborhood in the town of Masica, Atlántida.

For the past 15 years, Jose has managed a cafeteria at one of the schools in town. He has the help of one employee who prepares various foods such as meat turnovers, baleadas (the Honduran version of a burrito), and fried plantains with meat. Jose also offers soft drinks, juices, cookies, donuts, and other items. His customers are students of the school.

He is requesting his second loan in the amount of 25,000 HNL. The proceeds will be used to restock his business with soft drinks and juices. Jose hopes to grow his business so that he can generate more earnings to cover his family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina de 44 años de edad ella es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 6 años y gracias a Dios le a ido bien, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas pollos pequeños para la crianza ya que el anelo de ella es tener muchos pollos para agrandar mas su granja, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito que solicita.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 44 years old and originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. She has been raising chickens for six years and is doing well thanks to God.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy more young chickens to raise. Her wish is to have more chickens so that she can expand her farm. Maria hopes that the loan she requested will be of help.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Araba sells the traditional Ghanaian corn dough, kenkey, in Ayensudu near Elmina, and has done so for some time now. Her husband is a farmer. Araba uses her income to support her husband in paying their family's general living expenses. Araba will use the loan to purchase more corn to prepare her kenkey recipe. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to increase her capital base and secure her business now and in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to prepare kenkey.

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.ru:
Баходир трудолюбивый,ответственный и пунктуальный мужчина в возрасте 35 лет.  Он женат имеет 3 детей. Бахадыр занимается куплей продажей скота. Этим видом деятельности начал заниматься   10 лет назад.  Он очень ценит свою работу так как этим зарабатывает на хлеб.  В начале своей деятельности Бахадир  имел только двух  баранов, откормив продал за хорошую цену и был очень рад. Таким образом он   увеличивал  свой товарооборот. Бахадыр уже знает все преимущества этого дела.  
 За счет увеличения  дохода  Баходир смог  также купить  магазин в центре села. Там его жена торгует    продуктами  питания. Это их дополнительный доход.  Но основной доход у них от откорма скота. Поэтому Бахадыр обратился в организацию Арванд за кредитом, чтобы приобрести скот и развивать свой бизнес по животноводству.
 Он очень рад,что существуют такие организации как Арванд с помощью которых люди нуждающиеся в финансовой поддержке могут осуществить свои планы.
texts.en:
Bahodir is a hard-working, responsible and punctual 35-year old man. He is married and has three children. Bahodir busy and resells cattle. He has started this business 10 years ago. He values his work as it allows him to support himself. At the beginning, Bahodir had only two sheep; after fattening the animals, he sold them at a good price and was very glad to do so. In this way, he kept increasing his sales volume. At present Bahodir already knows how to manage the business to his advantage. 

After increasing his revenues, Bahodir has been able to buy a store in the middle of his village. His wife sells food products in this store. This is an additional source of income for them. But their main income is from raising livestock. This is why Bahodri has applied to Arvand for a loan in order to buy more livestock and develop his animal-raising business. He appreciates the existence of organizations such as Arvand, which allow people in need of financial support to fulfill their plans.

loans.use: to  purchase  livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats.
